11533211.content:
As part of your official ownership, you were to take any and all belongings you had from your old home (except weapons which could potentially harm your master... but very little can cause much damage to an oni!) and bring them to your new home. Sadly, this new ownership was strictly legal. In this bright blue futuristic world, humans are 2nd class citizens worldwide. After the human race lost the War against the Demon army, the new leader of the 'free world' assured the surviving humans that they would be allowed to co-exist peacefully with the demons... provided they play the victors' rules.

The 'human=property' status was one of those rules.

It's like you could just run away from new Oni owners. First of all, trying to run away from a demonic lush that wields a big club is suicidal. Second, you didnt have anywhere to go. Your mother died of a heart failure before you even graduated junior high, your dad hasnt returned from the war (and probably never will at this rate), and your sis and bro got sold to dragons and you havent seen them since. You had the house all to yourself until now.

Alice 'escorted' you back to your old house to clean out the major stuff.

"Just clothes and a few odds and ends'll be enough," Alice told you as you searched your room.
"Fine," you shrugged. You filled your backpack and a suitcase full of personal stuff and left your house for good. You took one last look at the good and sighed hard.
"Get moving!" Alice ordered you. Sure enough, you got plenty of stares by passerbys as you obediently followed your oni master. It was humiliating enough that you had to dragged around by a big blue booze demon with a really big club who now owns you... but she even had you put on a dirty, sticky black collar around your neck that reeks of strong vodka filling your nostrils! Must be her own special way to mark you as her property! Then again, it's pretty mild compared to the ways most demons mark their property. You dont even wanna know what dragons do!

"God, youre slow," you heard Alice mumble, "I thought you creatures could go up to 70 miles an hour."
"That's cheetahs," you correct her, "humans run an average of 20 miles an hour."
"Pst!!" your oni master snickered at those numbers, "no wonder you hairless monkeys lost the war!" You gritted your teeth, but dared not say anything. As if things couldnt get any MORE humilating, a toad kid ran up to and shouted to his mother, "MOMMY MOMMY! Can I have a hairless monkey too?!"
"Of course not, Kap!" his mother dragged him away from you, "those beasts are a lot more trouble than theyre worth! Remember what happened to your father?"

"STOP STARING AND KEEP MOVING!" oops! Alice got angry at you again!
"S-Sorry."

Another long blistering walk later, you reached the not-so-abandoned apartment again. Alice knocked on the door and her big bad mama opened the door... with an impatient glare on her face and a drunken blush on her cheeks!
"What took ya two so long?!" Alice's mom questioned you before taking another swig of her bottle.
"The gift you got me aint a fast walker," Alice answered for the both of you.

"Then that better mean he's a hard worker," her mom quipped, "you get all his crap?"
"It's all in here, ma'am," you took the backpack off and politely handed it to her. Mama Oni sneered at you, but snatched your backpack and started rummaging through it. There was no such thing as 'invasion of privacy' anymore. Sadly, this was typical for a demon owner. Gotta make sure your little slave doesnt bring something he shouldnt have!

"Eh... clothes... clothes... socks," she muttered as she chucked your stuffed around after examining it, "...jacket? No fancy vintage name brand? Tsk, worthless. Rings? ....Grr... MOOD rings!" Those moodrings were all gray. The PERFECT color to describe your mood. "potato chips... V8 cans... gawd, dont tell me we got a vegetarian in our-oh! Oreos! Class ring?" She examined your old high school class ring, "Hm. Real gold! Might be worth something. Socks. Family photos. Dvds? Aint got a dvd player. ...Oh!" The oni mother's eyes widened as she turned her head to you and glared, "a switchblade?!"

Crap! What possessed you bring THAT with you?! ...Oh right.

"It was a gift to me from my dad," you told her, "an old family heirloom."
Alice's mom squinted her eyes at you... then broke the blade piece right off the switch portion! "JUST in case!" she tossed your broken switchblade and continued her rummage, "A Nintendo DS?! Didnt they discontinue these things?! Does it still work?! I bet this'll sell for a ton of cash if we put it up for auction! What else ya got... eh, a few books. Ya got anything from Agatha Christie? Heard those sell well if you action 'em."
You shook your head, "Sorry ma'am, I dont."
She grunted, "Damn! Then that's everything. You can put the rest of your stuff in one of the drawers in Alice's bedroom." Oh and of course YOU have to pick everything up. It's not much of a life you have left, but youre forced to accept it. Anyone else would be more strong-willed and tried to fight, but not you. You knew your limits and your flaws. Better to live as an oni's property, then run away and end up getting torn to shreds or eaten by any of the demon rulers of this world.

"Yes, ma'am," you obeyed, "Alice, which drawer can I put my stuff in?"
"I think the very bottom drawer on the pink dresser is empty," Alice answered, "you can use that one."
"Thanks."

It didnt take much time to put everything that Alice's mom didnt confiscate away. But by this time, it was already late. It was about time you get to bed cuz you tomorrow's gonna be a BIG day. Alice's mom let her drink get the best of her and had already passed out on the couch. You dare not wake her. You'd rather just turn your attention to Alice.

"Where do I sleep?" you asked.

"Youre sleeping...

115332222221.content:
As Ryan sat at the table in the restaurant waiting for his date, he couldn't help fidgeting. This would be his first date in a while, and he was kinda rusty and he knew it. Just as he was about to have a full-blown panic attack, his date walked up to the table. Seemingly paradoxically, whenever a dreaded situation actually occurred, he calmed right down, like the adage about anticipation being worse than the event. His prospective date was wearing a trench coat, like she'd just stepped out of a 40s era detective movie. "You must be Ryan," she says, holding out her hand. "My name's Mary." "Hi," Ryan says, taking the proferred hand. The other thing that struck him about Mary in that moment was the fact that her skin was a light blue in color. She saw him staring at her hand so she explained. "I was born with it. No one really knows why I'm blue. I've been checked by doctors. Lots and lots of doctors." Ryan saw that it was a bit of a sore topic for her and quickly apologized. "Don't worry, I'm used to it by now, and really shouldn't be surprised at the reaction it draws when people first see it." "Well, now that I'm past the initial surprise, I think it's kinda cool," Ryan assures her. "Really?" "Yeah, really. It's very exotic." Although Ryan tried, he couldn't help staring at her trench coat either, but given the fact that it covered most of her body, its reason for being worn was self-explanitory.

It also explained why their table was in the back, in a dimly lit corner. It would allow her to take her coat off hopefully without attracting too much unwanted attention. She removed it, revealing a pretty green dress that complimented her complexion nicely. Their waiter came and took their orders and didn't bat an eye. Apparently the shadows in the corner camouflaged her blue skin admirably. When their food came they were deep in conversation, finding they had many things in common. They both like cats, (Ryan was allergic to dogs but not cats, strangely enough.) They also had similar taste in movies, although, being a woman, Mary did like chick flicks. Just like him, she wanted kids, just not right now. Maybe in a couple of years. Before either of them knew it, their food is gone and paid for. "I'm really glad I let my friend talk me into coming on this date," Mary said. "I had a wonderful time." "So did I," Ryan replies, as he takes a glance at his watch. Sundown in half an hour, he saw. Hopefully enough time for him to take Mary home and get home himself. She noticed the glance and asked, "Is everything alright?" "Yes, I've just got this...condition." "Condition?" "I, ah, I'm...scared of the dark," he said in a rush. "It's because when I was a kid, my siblings forced me to watch the bloodiest horror movies imaginable. It scarred me." At this revelation, Mary got an incredibly concerned look on her face. "Then we should go before it gets any later. Actually, that works for me pretty well, since I don't really like being out after dark either." "Why's that?" "Well, women tend to draw the freaks after dark, you know. Rapists, serial killers, basically the scum element of society." "Oh, yeah," Ran replied a little lamely. "Well then, shall we go?" he asks, taking her arm.

"Good night Penny. See you tomorrow morning." He said, tapping the plastic gently, then turned to go to bed.

She opened her eyes and smiled, slowly shaking her head, then her tail came up and pointed at her neck emphatically. "You're lucky?" She nodded. "Heh... wow. How come I didn't find you earlier?" He said, gently stroking her head.

A few moments later she was done deep breathing and ducked down. With a puzzled sigh he slowly opened his mouth, then took a few gulps of air first too, to a hissy chuckle coming from Penny. Then she edged into his open maw.

This was very weird. He felt her wiggle gently to the back of his throat, filling his mouth. For a moment he worried over hurting her, but he'd clutched pretty tightly to her last night with his thighs. Plus he must have gulped hard before when she slid in before, right? He felt her there, just resting on his tongue, then he took a gentle gulp. Her head plopped down his throat awkwardly, and a little tightly, but she slid in, giggling by the sound of it, and he watched her body slowly slick up and into his mouth, inch by inch.

She was thin, but long. Two and a half foot of snake was a lot, but he'd managed it before. He felt her head wriggle down his gullet, then plop into his belly. Slowly he slurped and gulped her down, surprised at her taste. He'd been too panicked to notice last time. Not sweet, but nice. Like a musky tart flavor. Weird, but nice. Given he'd prepared this time he wasn't out of breath by the time her tail flicked into his mouth and then slid nicely down his throat. Curiously this time his stomach didn't feel over full. Maybe he was stretching?

"Ahh. So, Penny? Happy?" A muffled hissy giggle was the only response and he smiled. This was certainly a weird relationship... if that was what this was? He didn't feel right calling her a pet any more... then his eyes fastened on the enclosure he was building. Yeah. Locking her up felt so wrong now. He felt that tightness inside briefly (though no pain this time) as she exited the stomach, heading down, and he smiled, getting up and starting to pull the unfinished enclosure apart while he was waiting for her to reach the exit. He had to stop part way through the dismantling to head to the bathroom at the familiar pressure, but sat relaxed on the toilet, then sighed as she popped clear, taking a deep breath of air.

"So, enjoy yourself girl?" He said, peering down as her head popped up into view between his legs, nodding enthusiastically. "Heh, glad you... OOooh!" she smiled up at him as she wriggled in and out of his butt, then slowly unhinged her jaws (though at her size that was less necessary now) and sucked his cock up gently. "Dang, you are way too good to me!" He muttered leaning back on the john.

Penny disagreed with that. He'd been way nicer to her than she'd expected. She was just sorry this was the only way she could express this to him.
1451322212121211.title: Second time's the charm.

choices: Sunday night she crawls up his butt, and won't come out Monday!
Penny sees Martin's sad gaze at Jennifer's picture and wants to fix this.
Sunday night Penny is hungry and Martin helps her find a filling meal.
14513222121212112.content:
"...and they are kinda stuck up. They think they know best kinda thing. When they met humans they sort of took them under their wing and... sort of educated them. Helped them. But at the same time put loads of rules down about what they shouldn't do."

Penny shook her head as she watched the tall human on the screen with the pointy ears. This was very weird, but looked nice. She didn't understand all that 'Martin,' as her human called himself, was telling her, but it was obviously important to him so she tried to pay attention. She could see it seemed complex. Maybe when she understood things better when she was bigger she'd get it? She hoped so. Politics seemed to not make sense to her, people ordering others around, then quarreling with each other. Maybe. Maybe it was more than that? But she liked this Captain guy, and the... engineer was it? He looked cute with that girl. They looked nice together, though she never seemed to smile.

"It's kinda nice to chat like this. A lot of my online friends say Enterprise sucks. I say it's the best of them! It's a real shame they didn't finish it properly. The last episode really sucked, as rushed as they were making it. Real shame."

She may not understand it that well, but she could see it was nice. His friends were obviously stupid! She snuggled into his arm contentedly as the Captain got frustrated at the... Falcon was it? No Vulcan. Yeah Vulcan. She could see why, they were so.. like Martin said; Stuck up. She smiled. She felt Martin's eyes on her and looked up, just catching that perfect gaze of his, She could just fall into those loving eyes.

"You're amazing. You even like Trek. Heh." she smiled up at him and snuggled closer.

They watched another of the 'Enterprise' shows then something called 'Discovery' which Martin was less interested in it seemed. He said it was fun, but not really trek. Just didn't feel the same. She thought she saw what he meant. It was all flashy, shiny stuff, and felt different somehow. She couldn't feel that same friendship the Enterprise crew had together.

After that he carried her with him to the shower and he helped her get clean (though he'd done that earlier after she'd gone through him) and she tried to help him get clean in return. He seemed to like that. After some toweling down (which she only had vague, fuzzy memories from mom on) he carried her back to bed.

She made sure he had a fun night. Not that she didn't enjoy it too. He tasted delicious!

***

Martin woke up slowly, a contented smile on his face, and opened his eyes to Penny's face smiling down at him. She winked at him as she saw that loving look spread over his face. Wonderful.

"Morning Penny." He said, then reached up and pulled her in to kiss her.

Snake lips were, despite her's being more flexible, not the best to kiss. She could see the slight disappointment, but she just smiled. She knew she'd have girl lips soon enough. Just needed another meal or two, though they'd have to be big ones. Maybe she could handle that big animal across the street now? Probably, though it'd be a bit tight still. Way tighter than the cat. That might be enough on it's own. Maybe.

"So, what do you want to do this morning Penny?" He smiled, then gasped as she answered him with a gentle tug on his manhood with her tail. "Oh, you really are a nympho aren't you?" He said, though the smile obviously meant it was good thing. She just smiled back, not really understanding the word. "Heh. You don't have to ask permission Penny. I love you doing that! All of that."

She giggled and slid down his body, under the covers, and over his groin. She felt Martin groan in pleasure as she licked across the tip, then more as she sucked it into her maw, reveling in the flavor. Mmmmm! Oh this was so much fun! Though soon she'd be developed enough for PROPER sex! She couldn't wait! She remembered Mom's first time vividly, though Ben had been... awkward later. Still the memory of that first time had stayed with her, despite his idiocy.

Mmm, god he tasted so good! She wondered if she tasted as good? She didn't remember mom getting tasted, even slightly, so she had no clue from her inherited memories. Though she swore Martin tasted better to her than any of Mom's boyfriends! Even Penny's dad. Of course she could be biased.

She felt his shudder and his hands clasped tightly on her body and head, pressing her down. She smiled, feeling him squeezing her throat down on his shaft as she pulses, and she squeezed to help, loving it as he held her. She just 'Mmmmed' softly as he jerked into her, her drinking it all delightfully.

"Oh dang. Penny, I gotta do something to repay you for this. Damn!"

Penny rolled her eyes. Martin was silly sometimes. This was her giving him back all the love he gave her. Didn't he get that? She sighed as his thighs closed on her body and she wriggled contentedly, just letting him shrink in her mouth, still sucking on him gently, hearing him moan from it.

This was the life!
14513222121212112.title: Quality time.

choices: Try to catch some rabbits in the country nearby.
Maybe sneak a small-ish farm animal? Risky. Could she manage a Lamb?
Head to the city roof tops for birds. How many pigeons could she eat?
145132221212121122.content:
Sunday morning Penny watched Martin get up and dressed, seeing him glance at her as she traced his naked body across the room with a smile. He stopped with a shirt half on, head poking through the hole staring at her, then shaking his head weirdly. What did he expect? He was cute! Still he headed out for his morning ablutions and she sighed, then started looking around his room. It was full of things that meant a lot to him so she wanted to know more.

He saw a few things that looked either 'Enterprise' or something related to that kind of thing there, including a couple of posters on the wall. Mom had posters from her childhood with the Beatles so she knew about that kind of thing. Ben had hated that somehow, maybe jealous? She didn't know. She never understood that kind of thing. Er, mom never understood. She shook her head. She was still getting sorted out what was her and her mom, but she was getting it.

She slid up to his... clothes thing. Um. Dresser, that was what it was called. Slipping up it (and knocking an errant sock off the top, hoping he hadn't left it there on purpose for something) she looked around. There were a couple of little models, looking like... aircraft? She couldn't tell. Maybe spaceships? But they didn't look like those on Enterprise. She shrugged and looked on, and saw a framed photo. Was that a pop star? She didn't think so. Looked too personal.

"Ah. Jenny."

Penny jerked around at the noise, seeing Martin looking at the photo she'd noticed sadly. She smiled sheepishly, though actually wasn't sure why. Maybe she shouldn't have been looking at this stuff? He didn't seem mad at her though, just sad, though that look at the photo was... longing?

He looked at her, then back at the photo as she frowned at him. He shook his head.

"Heh, that was... a little while ago. Don't worry about it." He said and went rummaging for shoes. Penny didn't think it was unimportant, and she DID worry about it. It was obvious he had feelings for the girl. What had happened? Did the girl have to move away or something? She didn't like the thought of him not being with someone he cared for. Maybe she could help? Though at her size... yeah, there wasn't a lot she could do.

After he got finished putting shoes on he came up, scooped her gently off the dresser and saw down on the bed, smiling down at her.

"So girl, what did you want to do today? You understand I've got to go to work tomorrow, right?"

She sighed. Yeah, lots of mom's friends had to go away for most of the time, though when she was young she'd snuck with Ben to his work. While she was still small enough, which was only a couple of times. She smiled, maybe she could do that with Martin tomorrow?

Her tummy gurgled. Maybe not she thought, looking down.

"Oh, hungry huh?" She looked up as Martin said that, shaking his head. She looked a little abashed, but nodded her head. "Well... ah, I think another cat might be... awkward." For some reason he had an odd expression, slightly worried. She wondered if she'd done something wrong? "Huh. Well, uh... let me think on that. There must be something we can do. Maybe find somewhere with a rabbit problem or something and you can go nuts." He chuckled at that. Rabbits. That didn't mean anything to her. Were they big?

He carefully picked her up and carried her over to a desk like thing and sat down there, putting her on the side. He then flicked on a TV screen... oh, no it was a computer. Mom had used those a few times, she thought. Mom's recent memories were a little fuzzy for her though so mostly she remembered stuff from a few decades ago. It was the main reason she didn't really remember anything of Grandma or earlier. Grandma had had kids early, and pretty much all that memory beyond basic stuff like talking was lost on mom. And hence her.

Martin used the computer, and Penny recognized maps, and maybe some other charts, and struggled to make sense of words. She was a little small, and she knew mom had difficulty with written stuff till she got bigger. Something to do with the brain her dad had said once. She was able to get it though, she just had to re-read stuff a few times. Maybe she was better at it than mom?

"Hmm, how about a petting zoo? Mmmm, maybe not. They'd notice animals going missing. I can't really afford to buy a pet for your every meal... Uh... how about fish? Do you like fish?" Penny scrunched her muzzle up. Icky things! Slimy and icky. "Ah, take that as a no. Shame. OK, um... well push comes to shove I could go into the country and find a farm. Uh, bit risky. Maybe we can try something small?" She didn't want small, though she guessed everything was relative. Depends what he meant. "Or, we could try some of the roofs in the city. A fair few birds there, though catching them might be another matter." She licked her lips. Birds she liked. Not very big though. Maybe a few of them. "I think that's about all I can think of." So girl, anything strike your fancy?"
145132221212121122.title: Longing.

choices: The burrow was bursting with rabbits. Easily enough for her to become adult.
There weren't many left. Maybe most of them left already?
While she was eating rabbits a dog started digging up the burrow! Annoying!
1451322212121211221.content:
As she pondered Martin put up pictures of the possibilities. She knew what a pigeon looked like, lambs... OK, that wasn't what she was thinking of... actually... though she knew the name no image sprang to mind. Blurred memory she guessed. Rabbits she had no clue, but they looked interesting. A bit fluffy for her taste, kinda like that cat, though if they squirmed on the way down she'd be happy. Yeah, rabbits sounded cool, though difficult to tell how large they were from the pictures.

Martin watched as she lifted up and tapped her muzzle against the screen where the rabbit was.

"OK, rabbits it is. Actually that will be a fair bit safer... at least than the petting zoo. I admit I don't think that would be a good idea. Well, lets get you something to eat hmm?"

He certainly seemed happy about it. Penny was glad he was helping her out. Ben really hadn't much. Admittedly at first he'd been friendly to mom, but he'd never been good with helping her get food. When you're young you really depend on others like that.

Martin got a large bag, cut some holes in the side, saying 'air holes.' She didn't get what he meant at first, then realized it was like a portable home. He'd carry her in it. That was nice of him. He left the top undone but said probably not be a good idea to stick her head out too much. Many people didn't like snakes. She knew from her mom that some didn't, but many? That was a bit depressing! But at least Martin liked her.

As he opened the top a bit more to let her in she became fascinated by the way it sealed up.

"It's a zipper. Never seen one before?" Martin said when he noticed her interest. She started shaking her head, but suspected her mom had. She just didn't know. In the end she lifted two coils up to give a kind of shrug. He got the message.

"It's an interlocking link," He said, "with this curved double track here pushing them together. See?"

He moved the 'zipper' back and forth and she saw it locking together. Weird. He spent a few minutes telling her how the two shapes knitted together, and how the zipper parted them by twisting. It was certainly different, and amazing that something so simple looking was actually so complicated. He was watching her though, and as soon as she pulled away he smiled and went back to making the bottom of the bag comfy for her. At least he didn't keep yammering on like Barney had, mom's second boyfriend. That guy had been nice, but... he never got the message when mom wasn't interested in something. Which was difficult as she could speak when she met him! He didn't last long.

Carrying her to the car carefully she watched as he drove out. Mom had driven, but Penny didn't remember much of it. She knew mom had difficulty with the pedals at first, and she could see why. Not much room to put coils down there. Though Martin seemed to drive with just one foot. Didn't mom drive using two pedals? She didn't quite remember. Have to ask Martin about that when she could.

They went past lots of buildings in the area where he lived, then out into the country, trees sliding by and green hills. It was rather pretty. He soon came to a stop then leaned over the bag.

"OK, I'm gonna ask if they have a rabbit problem. Be aware there might be dogs around here and..." He blinked. "...uh. Don't eat anything other than rabbits Penny. And be careful of the dogs. They could hurt you. And don't eat them either. I think these people would be really annoyed if you ate one of their farm animals or pets."

She nodded, though sighed. As they'd come in to park she'd seen a big 'dog' on a hill nearby, way bigger than the one across the street from Martin's home. She'd have enjoyed that. Pity.

Unfortunately this 'farm' didn't work out. Martin came back a few minutes later and said that yes, they had a rabbit problem, but no, they absolutely refused to have a snake catch their rabbits! Apparently they REALLY didn't like snakes!

The next four houses were similar, either not having any rabbits or not wanting snakes, no matter how well house trained (Penny did kinda feel annoyed at that, but knew Martin just didn't want to admit she was intelligent), and they kept on moving. However at the next house Martin came back to the car with a smile and Penny knew she was going to eat.

"Yup. Apparently the father is not personally too keen, but not averse to snakes, but the son really likes them. You don't mind if he pets you do you?" She shook her head with a smile. "Try not to over-react if he gets a little heavy handed, but also try not to provoke him." She raised an eyebrow and tapped her side, hard, with her tail. "OK, I know you seem tough, but you're still small. Be careful, OK?" He had a point, and she nodded sheepishly.

She was taken into the house and set on a table. The house was wooden built and looked a bit old. Nice though.

"Oooh, a snake!" Penny's eyes got real big as a little boy ran up to her and fumbled clumsily with her head sticking out of the bag.

"Micheal! Be careful lad!" Came from the boy's father by the door. Penny wasn't good at ages, but the kid must be pretty young. Less than ten, which for humans was very young. He seemed eager, and she was careful (she didn't want the kid to poke her in the eye or anything) but preened into his hand.

"It's OK Mr Cartright. She's well trained, but please Micheal, be gentle, OK?"

"OK, mister." Michael said, though it didn't look like he was really listening. He didn't seem too rough though, so Penny let it go.

Penny actually liked the attention, licking the boys fingers a few times. Yup, he was tasty. But the father stopped the petting fairly soon.

"OK, now run along Micheal, the snake has work to do."

Oh yes, dinner time!

Unfortunately it was not immediately dinner time. The farmer didn't know where the rabbits were, or he would have dealt with them. Thus she had to hunt. But, as she slithered after one she found they were pretty dumb critters and didn't find it too hard to follow one of the fuzzy things then find the burrow.
1451322212121211221.title: Rabbit dinner.

choices: Martin finally manages to get control of his throat and cough her up. Phew!
Somehow, though obviously painful, Martin gets all of her down!
The third rabbit is just too big and won't go down. Martin starts to choke!
14513222121212112212.content:
She checked out several entrances to the burrow, just to be sure, then watched carefully. Unfortunately the openings were too far apart for her to stretch between two, let alone more. But she readied herself to go to a nearby entrance, while poised with a rock near another one. She quickly rolled the rock into the entrance, then shot over to the first one she she'd found. At least two rabbits shot out other holes and vanished into the bushes, but she caught one trying to get out of the one she headed for.

Oh yes, yummy, despite the fluffiness.

The rabbit was small, and she gulped it down in literally a second, then dove into the hole. It was a mad dash through tunnels, and a few rabbits got out. Unfortunately, even with as few that got away she finished up with only a handful, maybe six more at most, from the burrow, and rabbits weren't as big as she'd hoped. A hair smaller than that cat. With all of them it was a nice meal, but not what she was hoping for. There was no way this would get her an adult body. But she would grow a lot. That was something.

The Cartrights were appreciative, and offered Martin to join them for lunch. Especially as he didn't charge them for the service, claiming Penny got a meal out of it and that was enough. The meal was just the farmer and his son and Penny wondered what happened to the child's mom. They didn't mention it. Micheal did have fun petting her through the meal, though the father did look a tad nervously at her throughout.

When they were done Martin brought her back in the car and shook his head.

"Wow, didn't know there were people that nice any more. So many wouldn't offer that to a stranger, no matter how we'd helped! Too much worry over serial killers and the like these days." She wasn't sure she knew what that meant, and from the sound of it probably didn't want to know. "Anyway, you look full." He said, gently patting one of the rabbit bulges. Full? Hardly. Not even close, but it was a nice meal. It'd take at least three or four like that to get her to her full size she thought. Hopefully she could just find a bigger meal next time.

Martin seemed happy as he drove home and she snuggled up against him, feeling the rabbits squirm inside her nicely.

***

With a sigh Martin locked the door behind him and carried a much heavier Penny to the kitchen table. Dang that snake liked to eat! He wasn't sure why he was so happy helping her feed like this. But she definitely seemed appreciative. As he put the bag down he noticed something on the floor. Reaching down he picked up a short little translucent string of... oh.

"Yours Penny?" He said with a smile, holding up the snake skin.

Penny rose up out of the bag, saw the shed skin and chuckled. Yeah. As he looked it was hard to image that yesterday she'd fit in this skin. It was barely a foot long, and now she was over two and a half foot long... and bulging with rabbit now.

"Well, guess you'll be shedding again as you grow if this is any indication." She nodded. "Hmm.. how do you know that?"

***

Penny pondered, but couldn't think of a way to explain about her mom's memories just yet. So she shrugged. With a chuckle he lifted her out of the bag then put it away in the closet.

After them both being out and about (and her squirming all over the dirt) they shared a shower, much to both's enjoyment. Though he didn't taste as good down there when that clean oddly. She didn't mind, it was fun and he was definitely playful.

In the afternoon he went on the computer and was looking at things Penny didn't really understand. Mostly due to them being mainly words. She still had difficulty with words. She could feel herself tiring as her body started dealing with her meal, but wanted to be around Martin so mentally put it off a bit, feeling her body begin to speed back up again, it's meal delayed. She slid up and curled in his lap once she felt awake enough.

"Well hello Penny? I'm sorry, I thought you'd want some time to yourself after a meal like that?"

In response she just snuggled up against him.

"Uh huh. Guess not huh. Fair enough. Hang on a sec." He used the 'mouse' and played around with things on the screen until he was satisfied, then switched off the monitor and turned back, looking down at her affectionately, gently tracing a hand down her head. "There, all done. So, what did you want?"

Penny rolled her eyes, then slid her head down into his pants.

"Oooookay! Oh dang!" He muttered, undoing his trousers to give her more room. "Gnnn!"

She snuggled in, slurping him up gently, tasting him to the fullest. Definitely tastier than in the shower. She felt him jerk rather quickly this time, and gulped it down. Heh, he was eager today. Nice. He let her snuggle in his pants for a few minutes then drew her out gently.

"Dang. I don't know what I did to deserve someone like you, but I'm glad you want to be here. Thank you Penny." He brought her up and nuzzled her muzzle with his nose. Heh, that was cute. "I just wish I could return the favor." Penny sighed, then waggled her eyebrows and lifted her tail tip up to his lips. "Oh right. You really get off on that don't you?"

He took several deep breaths, then slowly sucked on her tail and she sighed as he began to gently gulp. It seemed way easier now, her sliding down quite easily and... She felt a bump, looked up and saw Martin had a panicked look on his face, this throat muscles contracting and spasming awkwardly. Was he choking on her her? Then her eyes fell on why she'd felt a bump. The lump of a rabbit in her tummy bumping against Martin's lips!

Whoops!

Martin hadn't thought of it either, but now... Penny knew he couldn't swallow that! That was way too.... And he gulped. Automatically it seemed from his expression. Her eyes rolled up as his throat gripped her delightfully. His hands scrabbled at her body, but didn't grip tight, seemingly worried about hurting her. His throat didn't seem to be complying with him and Penny felt herself slide in deeper, his jaws opening around the still struggling bulge of the bunny! Oh Martin!

She saw him wince, strain, then slowly, oh so slowly, the bulge went in. Wait, he was managing it? She felt the incredible tightness as his throat worked, his teeth scraping over her bulging scales and she leaned in, gently patting him on the head with a coil, staring into his eyes, giving him encouragement. From the look he seemed to appreciate it, though he was still panicking a bit. Then another gulp and the lump shot down! Hah! He'd done it! She felt the lump of rabbit slide tightly into his throat.

Then the next lump hit.

Oh this was going to be a challenge wasn't it?
14513222121212112212.title: Limited supply.

choices: Give him the best evening in bed he's ever had to make up for the afternoon.
Look up at Jenny's pic to find clues about her.
145132221212121122122.content:
Oh god! Martin struggled, holding on mostly by the endearing look of affection and support from Penny. She patted him on the back of his head, and he could see her attempting to ignore the sensations his throat were giving her (she REALLY liked that he knew), and focused on helping him.

The second bulge was easier, though he tried to throw up. Somehow he just couldn't. Every attempt he made to hurk her up he either felt his throat clench awkwardly, or he thought he caught a wince from Penny and stopped. He couldn't hurt her! Honestly, he might be imagining the latter, as she seemed very tough. Heck, his teeth had bit pretty hard on that first bulge, and she hadn't even flinched! Still, he tried to go as easy as he could on her, but was worried what this was doing to his jaws and throat!

Finally he felt the smaller second bulge slide tightly down into his throat and he relaxed a bit, though the next one hit pretty quick. And was bigger! Quite a bit bigger! Penny nudged his head up, and got him staring back into her eyes rather than on the meal, then she looped that coil from behind his head down over the bulge before his lips and squeezed as tightly as she could, smooshing it down. He actually saw the lump struggle inside her, the rabbit actually still alive! That caught him, but she managed to squeeze and reposition it inside her enough to slide in a little easier, still wriggling inside her weirdly. It was a struggle to fit in all the same and he felt his jaw muscles or tendons, or whatever, complaining loudly. This was painful!

The next two bulges were smaller, and with her squeezing they actually slid in easily. No pain at all. His eyes still watering he managed a weak smile, but then as she slid in further she was running out of spare coils to squeeze with, and he had to manage on his own. He tried to push them together with his hands, but he just didn't have her strength to do much. Number six was smallish, and with some straining he managed to get it down, but his stomach was already complaining.

Then the last one, number seven came on. This was bigger, about the same size as the third one, but this time Penny couldn't squeeze to help! He struggled, heaving, but it didn't help, and he felt something tearing in his jaw. Eye's watering he struggled not to show it, but he could see the look of anquish on Penny's face as she slipped ever deeper. As that massive bulge forced it's way in, his head getting dizzy from lack of air, she reached up, nudging muzzle with his nose as she he done earlier, and staring into his eyes. Her eyes were pretty, and this close he could tell they weren't cat's eyes. More like snake eyes but more rounded. More human like. He could even see some white around the outside. Snakes didn't have that did they? He actually managed to smile around her as that huge wriggling rabbit finally entered his throat. Painful as it was he managed to not show it, just staring into her eyes, then she nodded slowly, dipped her head back gracefully, and her head slid into his mouth.

He clutched his stomach awkwardly.

"Oh 'eck!" he managed, his belly feeling like it was going to burst! " 'Oo O'a i' 'ere 'Enny?" He managed, massaging his jaw and trying not to move it too much. Yeah, something was definitely torn. Damn that hurt!

A tap from his tummy made him look down, wincing slightly at the movement.

" 'u... 'on 'ap 'or 'es... 'wo 'or 'o?" he said, then realized how unintelligible he was right now. One for yes, two for now... then she tapped again. He checked by tapping once... then twice on his belly, and got a single tap back. Yeah, he was pretty sure that was what she meant.

Carefully he moved to his bed, undid his trousers fully (they were WAY too tight right now and just painful), and pulled his shirt off, laying down carefully with some wincing. He tasted blood in his mouth, and for a moment feared it was Penny's but soon found it was from the inside of his jaw. Yeah. He'd really hurt himself. He'd have to go to the hospital... what would he say? This was stupid! Oh.

He stared down at his belly, still squirming slightly with Penny and rabbits. Yeah, she'd have to come out first. There was no way he was letting a doctor mess with her! He'd never see Penny again!

Resting he attempted to just let his stomach expand and relax, though that didn't seem to work well. It was just too tight, too full. Then Penny found the exit. She left the stomach slowly, but that didn't hurt. It actually felt a relief as the tightness relaxed. The bulges going out did pinch a tiny bit, but surprisingly not as much as he'd thought, and soon she was wriggling through his intestines.

Once his stomach felt stable again he slowly got to his feet and headed for the bathroom. Getting her out was... not as bad as her going in, but not nice. Think the most massive constipation you've ever had. Yeah. Though at least she helped and was gentle. Afterwards they showered, and hugged, and Martin said he was sorry. He didn't mean to do that. She just shaking her head emphatically and pointing to herself. Yeah, like she was to blame! He should have realized. He was the one planning that rabbit meal for her!

She really winced every time he tried to speak, his voice really bad obviously.

" 'ook. 'Enny, I' 'onna 'ake 'ome 'ain'illers." He managed. " 'o 'a 'ly 'eep 'e e 'e 'ing. a'ay" He gently stroked the side of her head. " 'on't 'ame' our' 'ef. 'Ot 'our 'ault."

He said, seeing wetness in her eyes. Snakes could cry? He shook his head, sniffing himself. Why hadn't he thought of the rabbits when she tried to go in his mouth?

***

'Yes. Yes it is!' she thought to herself as she watched him slip into bed, still in pain.

How could she do that to him? And he wouldn't even blame her for what she'd done!

Curling at the foot of his bed, sniffing to herself sadly, she looked up as he got comfortable. She had to do something to make up for this. But what could she do? Her eyes gazed around the room, searching for something to help with. Maybe she could make a meal for him? She was still small, but she remembered Mom making some human food before. She wasn't great at it, but good enough. It'd have to be soft with his jaws hurt like that, but maybe that would help? Um, maybe she could just make him happier, to take his mind off the pain? Would he want sex right now? She wasn't sure. But she could try?

Then she looked up on the dresser, to that picture that Martin had looked so longingly at before. Maybe she could help get this 'Jenny' back again for him?
145132221212121122122.title: Martin stretches.

choices: She made it to Jenny's, and she'd slept in. Penny crept into her bedroom.
She made it to Jenny's and caught her leaving for university, following.
She wasn't as good at navigating as her mom and got lost.
1451322212121211221223.content:
Whatever medicine Martin had taken knocked him out pretty quickly, and after gently stroking his face Penny headed up to the dresser. She found that picture again and looked at it. The girl was pretty, long black hair, sweet looking eyes. No wonder Martin liked her. She felt her stomach trying to kick in again. She couldn't put this off much longer. But what should she do? She reached up and pulled the picture frame to her. It took a little fiddling but she managed to slide the picture out of the frame with her tail jaws and tongue. She hoped her spit wouldn't matter on it.

On the back, just like with some of Mom's photos, there was a name; Jennifer Hadley, and an address. She could go there! Maybe persuade.. *Yaawn* her to come back to him? Oh dang she was tired. Too much food, put off for too long. Maybe just a little nap?

***

Penny woke up much later, morning light streaming in the window. She looked down at the small picture in her coils, thankfully that hadn't crushed it in her sleep, and sighed. Well, she was bigger now. Nearly five foot long, though still light weight compared to what she'd be as an adult. If she was anything like mom she'd be over twelve foot long, 'standing' about as tall as a human when she lifted her body up. When she got a proper body that was. Right now she was still a snake, though when she looked in the dresser mirror she was happy to see her eyes now looked fully human. That was nice!

She turned to show Martin... and realized he was still asleep. He'd slept all evening, night, and now morning! Should she wake him? Didn't he have work today? He moaned in his sleep. Best let him sleep and heal. Hopefully he'd be better when he woke up later.

Penny looked down at herself. She was big enough now, though still she couldn't talk and still she hadn't developed her adult form yet. There was no way she could persuade Jenny to come here without talking. Maybe bring her and ask permission later? Didn't mom say it was always better to do that? She vaguely thought so.

It was still morning, just daybreak so... this time of year probably six O'clock. She had no idea when Martin should go to work, but she hoped he wouldn't be in trouble. Didn't work give time off for being sick? Well he definitely was! Holding the picture gently she went down the dresser leg and headed to a bookshelf. She wanted to find a map, but had difficulty. Mom's house always had a big map book. Um. What was it called? Some big word. Anyway, if she could compare the name on the picture she could see where Jenny lived. She seemed a little better at reading than last night, but didn't want to risk trying to memorize the address. She wasn't that good yet. No big map book could be found though, but she did find a little road map book and that at least helped. She found a match to the address for Jenny and she smiled.

Then she had to find where she was now.

In the end she, a bit nervously, picked out Martin's wallet and brought his driver's license out. That had his address on it and she traced the path on the mini map book. It was a bit less than a mile away. A long way to slither, but she could manage, besides it was still early. Maybe she could make good time?

Penny made sure to put the map away, then go up to the dresser and carefully put the photo back in the frame. That was trickier. Her tail and tongue were larger this morning! Eventually though she was done and she went over to stroke Martin's forehead. He was hot! Oh she hoped he was alright!

'It's OK. I'm gonna bring someone to help you.' she thought at him. Not that he could have heard her even if he'd been awake, but it was the thought that counted, right?
1451322212121211221223.title: Penny looks up Jenny.

choices: Well, you could... eat her. Just to carry her back? Naughty!
Try to explain it to her. You get words a bit now, even if not speech.
Jenny wakes up and screams "SNAKE!" before Penny can decide.
14513222121212112212231.content:
Penny might have overestimated her memory. She really should have brought that little map with her!

Slithering along the roadside, in the brush to make sure she was out of sight, she kept going. Every now and then she found a road sign. It was still a struggle, but at least she could make the words out a little better now. Took her a minute to grasp each roadsign, but her memory of which road was which was still good enough. It'd been half an hour so far but she wasn't lost. Yet.

She kept on going.

It was nearly an hour later that she arrived. She normally could have managed it in way under half that time, but awkward twists and turns, stopping to read roadsigns, it all slowed her down. At least she thought she could get back quickly. She knew the way now. She double checked the letterbox and it said 'Hadley residence' so this was the place. Sneaking through the fence she headed carefully inside the yard, wary if the place had any dogs. Martin seemed to think they were a risk to her, and she wasn't certain they wouldn't be. However nothing showed up and she slid up to the wall. Carefully she peeked up over the window sill and looked in on a dining room, empty. Huh, that was no good.

She moved to the left and tried again, finding a kitchen with a woman working at a sink. Probably Jennifer's mom. Penny tried three other windows but nothing else showed any other people. What she did find was an open window. There was a screen on it, but she managed to push the area where the latch was on the other side on the left, then on the right, enough to push the screen out and slither inside. It was tight, she was getting too big for this kind of thing. That made her remember what she'd done to Martin and wince. Oh she really had to make that up to him!

She put the screen back and locked it in place first, then slowly slithered behind a sofa towards the sounds of the kitchen, just to be sure the mother wasn't coming this direction. She wasn't, still working at the sink by the looks of it. Also some bubbling on the stove indicated she was cooking too. Likely busy for a while then.

So, having seen in on all the downstairs rooms through windows already she carefully went to the stairs, trying to avoid the kitchen. Navigating the stairs at least wasn't hard at her current size, and when up there were three doors. One proved to be an empty bedroom, probably the mothers. The second was a bathroom, and the third.. before she opened the door Penny heard faint breathing. Sounded like Jenny was asleep. Penny glanced out a window at the sun rising in the sky. Well, it was before eight AM, maybe a little early, but didn't Jenny have work or school to go to? University probably as Penny thought she would likely be too old for school.

Shrugging mentally she gently opened the door with her mouth and tail, and slid inside. Thankfully the door didn't squeak. She found the room white walls and ceiling and almost everything else pink. The furniture, the drapes even the bed. Under the pink comforter she could make out Jenny's sleeping face. Definitely the right place.

But now what? She'd aimed to just haul her back and ask questions later, but though Penny was larger, she wasn't that much larger. This girl was almost as tall as she was long! She didn't think she could wrap her up in her coils and snakehandle her all the way home.
14513222121212112212231.title: Penny finds Jenny.

choices: Though worried at Jenny's reaction, Penny brings her to Martin. He needs her!
Somehow, during the journey, Jenny's fear turns to arousal. What is going on?
Jenny can't do this to the girl. She's terrified! She heads back to throw her up
145132221212121122122311.content:
Penny pondered. She could risk trying to get Jennifer's attention. She even saw a scrabble board in the corner, but Martin had been worried over how people would react to snakes. She wanted to bring Jennifer to him, not have her scream and try to stomp on her or something! She worried, her mind going back and forth, now beginning to worry if he was alright back there alone. Maybe she should just bring Jennifer back to help him? But... oh, if she didn't believe Penny would be in trouble AND Martin would still be sick! All she wanted was to make things better for him, maybe get Jenny and Martin back together again. He'd like that wouldn't he?

She looked up. There was no way she could carry this girl back home. True she was under five foot, but Penny just didn't have enough coils to hold her. Not even close! The only way she could HOPE to carry her was... She smiled. In her tummy! Ooh, naughty. She blinked. Er, would Martin approve? She wouldn't hurt the girl, but... yeah probably she would be scared... if she was awake... Well, she'd just have to be sure she didn't wake up!

With a satisfied smile Penny carefully slid up to the pink bed and reared up, slithering under covers towards the foot of the bed, happy to discover Jenny slept in the nude. Clothes didn't taste good.

***

Jenny slowly roused from a weird dream about some exotic holiday, her swimming in hot ocean, then kneaded by masseuse. She smiled, still mostly asleep as a wet pressure rose across her midriff, just cresting her breasts, which were slightly squeezed by something shifting around her. Whatever it was gently nudged her in, and that wetness spread over them tightly. In fact she felt really tight everywhere. Blearily she blinked, not really fully awake.

"Mmmhmm?" She muttered, looking up at the inside of her covers. She'd slipped down in the bed? Huh that didn't happen often...

Then she found she couldn't move her arms, pressed warmly to her sides. What?

As she pondered that something slid wetly under the back of her head, and something else dark slipped over her face. She twisted to one side, a pang of worry starting, but then the darkness enveloped her, the soft surface pressing down on her face. Turning with a gasp she got a breath to the side in a gap in... whatever it was..

"What? What's going on?" She said, starting to really worry. She couldn't move her entire body at all! Then the tightness rippled over her, from her shoulders all the way to her toes, sending a shiver of emotion through her, which she had already in abundance from the exotic, and somewhat erotic, dream she'd had. The crack her face was out of moved up and something squeezed over her face with a squelch again. She gasped, tipping her head back, and saw a small opening above her to the dim light coming through the covers, which then closed abruptly before her.

"NOOOO!" She yelled, but it sounded muffled around her, and there was only a small gap in front of her face as she tipped back. Everywhere else was kneaded and squeezed by warm wet.... Flesh? Her eyes went wide. She'd been eaten! She screamed again, and the pressure around her lessened, the rippling (as nice as it was, despite the horror of her situation), slowing and stopping.

She lay there in the dark, feeling soft yielding pressure all around her, her pulse hammering in her ears rapidly. A slight cool breeze came down from above. The... mouth that had eaten her? This wasn't possible! Was this flesh, or was her mind playing tricks on her? She was gasping for breath, but the gap above opened briefly and more cool air flooded in. She gasped, but it closed once more, and then she felt things shift. Her whole body twisted from side to side, the moist prison squirming around her as it moved. It was an undulating motion left to right in ripples like... like a snake! Oh god, she'd been eaten by a snake! But... why was she so aroused? Her mind span in circles, terror and arousal fighting in her mind.

After five or ten minutes she managed to get her breathing under control (sort of) though she was shaking still and that.... feeling rose over her every time this thing's innards squished over her! She blushed fiercely as her body betrayed her, but she couldn't... no. This was... impossible! The thing twisted and turned, reared up a couple of times, bent down, moved all over the place and kept on going. But after maybe ten more minutes her panic started to die down. She somehow was still breathing, cool air coming from above somehow, and it wasn't squeezing her to death. This didn't exactly thrill her though, as it just meant she'd.... oh god. She was going to be digested alive! Shivering inside, the aroused thoughts lost to the terror she shivered.
145132221212121122122311.title: Tasty Jennifer.

Penny manages to hide when the medics arrive, taking Martin. Now what?
Jenny actually hides Penny when the medics come. Does she like her?
1451322212121211221223111.content:
Penny had messed up. She sobbed as she brought Jennifer home. She had no idea whether she could help Martin or not, but the girl's reaction to her eating her had been sheer terror. It had started so well, and from the taste and few moans it had looked like Jennifer was enjoying being swallowed. Then when she awoke... yeah, not good. Martin would never forgive her for this! She just knew it! But he needed help! If... if he never spoke to her again... she'd... *sniff* accept it. If only Jennifer could help him.

The girl did stop screaming after a while. Early on Penny considered taking her back and throwing her up, but then... Martin wouldn't get help and Penny'd just be locked up! No, better get this over with.

Finally slithering up to Martin's door she checked nobody was looking and opened it and slid in, her body hugely stretched with the massive bulk of the woman inside her. She headed to his bedroom, but stopped and got a scrabble board out. Penny might not be able to talk, but that scrabble board at Jennifer's had given her an idea on how to communicate. Might need two to get enough letters though. Thankfully Martin had two such games.

***

Jennifer was currently just sobbing, wondering why she wasn't dead yet. She wasn't crushed. She was still breathing. And the stomach was still... not burning. She didn't want to think too hard on the alternative. She didn't understand it, but then felt motions stop a few times, only minor motions from her... she shivered... predator. Then those ripples started again, in reverse! She blinked as she rose a few inches slowly, squeezed upwards, the heat rising from the weird sensations once more. She tried to ignore that, but it was hard. Slowly she felt herself rise, then coolness hit her in the face as the mouth widened before her. Tears of joy coming to her eyes. She was going to live, she was...

Looking out of the jaws of the creature that had eaten her she saw the floor of a room. On the floor were scrabble letters.

'Martin needs help hes hurting please help jennifer'

The muscular contractions pleasantly raising her had stopped so she just stared at the words. Then a snake tail curled into view and pointed at the letters.

"Wha?" she gasped, this whole thing so strange she just couldn't wrap her mind around it.

Then the squeezing started again and she moaned as she was kneaded upwards and outwards. Shuddering she tried to ignore it as she was disgorged awkwardly onto the floor. This was far too erotic for her terror and relief flooded mind to grasp, but she panted through the weird sensations and finally landed with a moist thud on the floor, cold, wet and... recognizing the carpet.

With shivering muscles she lifted herself on her elbows, then slowly turned around. Behind her was an impossibly small snake that... looked apologetic. She gaped at it. That little thing had eaten her? No... it couldn't be! It wouldn't meet her gaze, but the little she saw it's eyes looked... very un-snake-like. Almost human! It definitely looked embarrassed or maybe ashamed would be a better description. How did a snake have expressions like that?

Martin liked snakes.

The thought rose in her mind abruptly. It was one of the things she'd hated about him, that and his obsession about all that space stuff. Yup, this was Martin's room. His bedroom and... She heard a pained moan. Slowly she got to her knees, still shaking, and peered into the bed. Martin was there asleep, a pained expression on his face. Automatically she put her hand to his head, and felt him hot to the touch!

"Oh my god, Martin! I gotta get help!" She heard a sigh of relief and turned to give an amazed look at the source of the sound; the snake. "You... brought me here to help him?" It nodded and her eyes got larger. "You... you ATE ME!" She screamed.

"Nnnngh!" Martin moaned and slowly opened his eyes.

"M.. Martin? Are you OK?" She said, still staring at the snake out of the corner of her eye. It seemed thoroughly ashamed of itself, sort of sunken in on itself, it's head pointing to the floor dejectedly. What was that thing?

"J... Jenny?" He said, blinking and coughing, staring up her, then down, and his eyes suddenly became really big. "Y... you're... naked!"

Suddenly Jenny went bright red. She'd never let him see her like this before, and she covered her breasts, shivering, then turned glaring daggers at the snake.

"Yeah. Your snake brought me here!" She said acidly.

"P.. Penny? How, she's tiny."

Jenny blinked. Penny? The snake was a girl? She realized part of what she'd been just mad at was that the thing had got off on tasting her naked body, but if it was a girl snake.... wait, what was she thinking? It was a snake! It wasn't interested in people! She glared at it again anyway. It HAD eaten her! She blinked. It had eaten her then carried her back to Martin's place. What, it used it's stomach to carry people or something? What kind of freak snake was this? Then she recognized the look on Martin's face when he looked over to the female snake. It was... like he used to look at her. Somehow she found she was blinking back tears.

"She's... not so tiny." She said, looking at the snake that was longer than she was, though still so think she couldn't believe it had eaten her. And now maybe it was... her replacement! What?

"Ungh. Last night's meal. She grew. I... I... Gnnnn." He groaned, and at his pained sounds she leaned over him, worried.

"Oh, Martin! Let me call the hospital!" She said, the weird snake/girlfriend forgotten for a moment.

She got up and dashed to the phone, not noticing both Penny's and Martin's eyes trace her naked bottom avidly.

"911? Yes, I have an emergency a... friend of mine is sick. Very sick. I need help. He's burning up!"

Behind her Penny settled down, both sad and glad. She'd got help for Martin, but she suspected her time with him was over. She was so hoping not to have to go find another boyfriend like Mom had to. And.. he was so right for her! She sniffed sadly. As long as he was going to be OK.
1451322212121211221223111.title: Taking Jenny to Martin.

14513222121212112212231111.content:
Penny hides when the medics come, watching as Jennifer explains that she was worried for her friend. The medics don't seem to notice that she is wearing Martin's clothes (which don't exactly fit her shorter frame), but they help Martin. That's all Penny cares about.

After they leave she slinks out from under the bed, thoroughly ashamed of herself.

"YOU!" Penny jumps. It's Jenny! She must have stayed when the ambulance left. "What happened to Martin, and what are you?" The angry girl said, crouching down in front of Penny, glaring at her.

Penny gulped, then used her tail to point to her mouth and made 'waa waa' motions.

"Don't give me that! You did the scrabble thing didn't you? So explain!"

Jenny then threw one of the scrabble sets noisily down in front of Penny, making her wince. With a sigh she started sorting letters. as she laid out sentences (having to wait till they were read to re-use letters), she watched Jenny focus on the letters. She didn't respond at all, and while Jenny was reading her expression got less angry and more... confused.


'Martin helped me I helped him'

'He helped me grow I made him happy'

'He tried to make me happy, but I hurt his mouth'

'I didnt mean to neither of us realized it'

'He stretched too much'

'You were all I could think of to get help'


When Penny was done she curled on the floor, anxiously looking up at the girl staring at the scrabble letters.

"He... stretched? What do you mean stretched?"


Penny squirmed on the floor. She got the impression Jenny wouldn't understand, but... she deserved an answer.


'I like being squeezed he ate me to help.'

'First couple of times he liked but third time we forgot'

'Id just eaten and lumps stretched his mouth'

'I tried to help but he couldnt stop swallowing'

'I h'

She stopped, scrabble piece trembling in her mouth above the carpet. She paused a long time before putting it down

'I hurt him hell never forgive me'

'Never forgive me for hurting you'

Jennifer stared at Penny, not saying a word, mouth open and as still as a statue. Penny closed her eyes, expecting to be hit, shouted at. Something.

Penny realizes it's not going to work, worried Martin is going to be lonely.

145132221212121122122311113.content:
"He... ate you? You like being eaten?" Jenny said, a shake in her voice.

That was not the question Penny was expecting. She frowned, then slowly nodded, tipping her head sideways at the girl. After all, when Jenny had been asleep and just waking up she seemed to enj... Penny blinked, Jenny just looking somewhat confused at the moment. The girl liked being swallowed. She might not even consciously realize it right now, but Penny was sure of it. She glanced at the scrabble letters. Probably not a good idea to bring that up though. Given her reaction to it earlier she might... well, over-react now. Besides there were more important matters. She sighed and started pushing letters around again.


'Now you will have to take care of him.'

'I doubt hell want to see me anymore.'


Jenny got wide eyed and shook her head vehemently.

"Oh no, you are NOT putting that on me! You're his girlfriend now, you get to deal with it!"

This was ridiculous!


'You were his girlfriend why do you not care.'


"Care? Look, he was nice. Yes, I know, but we didn't mesh, OK?" She seemed awkward and annoyed. Frustrated more like.


'But why didnt you mesh hes perfect.'


Jenny snorted.

"Perfect! Oh for heaven's sake! No he is definitely not. He's a nerd!"


'You knew that when you met him though right' Penny was fairly sure a 'nerd' was something to do with spaceships and stuff. She wasn't sure why Jenny objected to that.


"Well, yeah, but not how much of one. He was always watching that scifi stuff and silly games. Boring."

Penny raised an eyebrow.


'Aside from the fact that im pretty sure you dont need to like everything he does.'

'How did you know they were boring did you watch one completely.'


Jenny looked at her as if she'd grown another eye.

"No, of course not! I'm not watching that drivel!"


'What do you watch.'


Jenny squinted at Penny suspiciously.

"Melrose Place, Friends, Desperate Housewives..." She said counting on her fingers, seemingly going to continue, but Penny started putting letters down.


'I think those are about families right relationships.'


"Yeees?" She said, frowning.


'Then you'd like Enterprise it's about the relationships.'

'Aboard the ship a kind of extended family'

'including the various problems they have together.'


"You've got to be kidding! It's spaceships and lasers!"

Penny rolled her eyes.


'Humor me and watch one episode.'


Once she watched Jenny read it she pointed to the living room with her tail. Jenny stared back with a grimace.

"Why do you care?"

Penny raised an eyebrow surprised.


'Because Martin cares about it and he cares for you.'

'He kept your photo and still misses you.'


Jenny glanced briefly up at the Dresser. It seems she'd already seen the photo, but she still bit her lip and stared at it for a few seconds.

"Fine, but I'm blaming you for the lost hour!"


'Forty five minutes but fine.'


"God, you're pedantic like him too!" She said, but got off the floor and headed to the living room. Penny followed, but brought the Scrabble letters in a bag. She might need to explain some things. She kept the remote control handy and made sure to pick an episode focusing on Trip and T'pol.

***

When the credits rolled Jenny sat back with a grumpy expression.

"Sorry, no. Still don't like it."


'But you admit it is like those show about relationships.'


She frowned.

"OK, I guess, but still it's just too weird."


'You at least understand why he likes it the complexity and emotion.'


"You are really weird you know." She said staring down at Penny on the Sofa beside her. "I don't know anyone else that has tried to make me think scifi is a soap opera."

Penny didn't know what a soap opera was, but assumed it was another relationship based thing.


'Im a Slithala of course im weird.'


"I thought you were a snake?" Jenny said.


'We look like snakes when young half snake half girl when older.'

'I'm not quite there yet.'


Jenny's eyes got really wide at that, staring oddly at Penny.

"Does Martin know this yet?"


'I couldnt tell him as i only learned to use letters after I grew last.'

'That was just after this whole problem with his throat.'


"I'm the first you've spoken to?"

Penny looked oddly at the scrabble letters, thinking 'spoken' is probably the wrong term, but she didn't think Jenny would appreciate being corrected.


'Yes you are I want to talk to Martin and he knows I can think.'

'But I couldnt figure out a way to talk before'

'Letters didnt make sense then.'


Jenny squinted at Penny, crossing her arms.

"Bigger brain huh?" She said. Probably right Penny thought, and she nodded after a half shrug.


'Bigger everything otherwise I couldnt have eaten you.'


Penny was kinda using it to gauge Jenny's response, and wasn't disappointed. She shivered, but Penny could swear she looked slightly aroused.

"Don't remind me! Surely you could have found another way?"

Penny rolled her eyes yet again. She was doing that a lot with Jenny.


'Oh right you would have been fine with a snake barging in and pushing.'

'Scrabble letters around wouldnt you not going to stomp me.'

'before reading oh no never think of it.'


"No need to be sarcastic!" Jenny retorted.

Penny chuckled.


'The only other thing I could think of was to wrap you in my coils.'

'And carry you back but I just wasnt big enough.'


"That would have been almost as scary!" Jenny said, glaring at Penny. "Couldn't you have put a note under the door before I saw you or something?"

Penny pondered.


'I didnt consider that but it wouldnt work I cant write.'

'Sliding scrabble letters under the door would not work.'


"Hmmm... So you say." Jenny said, then sighed. "Look, I get it, you like him and you wanted to get help, but there had to be a better way than eating me alive!"

Again Penny could swear Jenny looked a little flushed.


'If there was I couldnt see it sorry.'


Jenny glanced up.

"Heck, you could have sent me an email or chat or something. Can't you work a keyboard?" Jenny said, waving at Martin's computer.

Penny blinked, groaned and slapped herself in the face.


'I didnt think of it I had seen him write messages I might be able to.'


She pondered, then shook her head.


'sorry but would have been message from Martin.'

'Would you have answered.'


"Maybe... possibly." Jenny said, then sighed. "OK, probably not quickly." She sighed again, but more sadly. "I hope he's OK. Despite me not being his girlfriend, no matter what you think, I still don't want him to be in pain."

Penny smiled and rested her tail on Jenny's shoulder, patting her gently. The girl looked askew at her, but didn't object at least. That was an improvement.

Though if Jenny wasn't Martin's girlfriend then when he kicked Penny out for what she'd done he'd have nobody! She didn't want him to be lonely.
