1451322212121211221223111133.content:
The phone going off made both of them jump.

"It's OK, I'll get it." Jenny said, and yet again Penny rolled her eyes. Like she could!

"Martin's phone, Jennifer speaking. Who's this?"

"Jenny?"

Jenny grinned and covered the phone with her hand, nodding at the phone as she looked at Penny.

"Martin!" She whispered.

Yeah, Penny figured that out. She kept her expression calm at least. Martin carried on while Jenny messed with the phone.

"What are you doing there? Wait, you mean that wasn't a dream?"

Jenny suddenly blushed remembering what Martin had seen after Penny coughed her up naked!

"Well... you were pretty out of it. I'm sure you might not remember everything right."

Penny rolled her eyes. Why Jenny was so embarrassed about her body she hadn't a clue. Martin must have seen it when they were together, right?

"Uh, Jenny. I... Honestly I'm not sure." Yeah, he seemed a little out of it."I was actually ringing.... Oh god I'm an idiot. She couldn't answer the phone!"

Jenny frowned, then glared at Penny. She held the phone out melodramatically, mouthing 'It's for you.' Penny stuck her tongue out at her in reply. With similar retort Jenny switched the phone to speaker.

"Yeah, well not yet apparently."

"Huh?"

Penny sighed and started to get the scrabble set out. Jenny shook her head and reached over, turning on Martin's monitor, brought up notepad and pointed at the keyboard. With a smile Penny slid up and tested the keyboard out. She had to do it one letter at a time but it was quicker than scrabble.

"Well, she can hear you now anyway. You're on speaker." She peered at the screen. "And she says she hopes you are well."

Martin's voice back was irritated.

"Don't joke Jenny, she's important to me OK?"

"I'm not joking. She's typing... slowly... on your computer. God, even I can type faster than that!" Penny stuck her tongue out again, and Jenny responded with the same.

"Penny can type?" Martin sounded pretty shocked, and Penny could understand why.

"She says 'Grew bigger, now can understand words more. Couldn't before.' Yeah, well she certainly is big, she had to be to e.... er... well, she's big." Yeah, the girl wasn't mentioning the fact that she ate Jenny. Penny was glad, but he'd have to know sooner or later. She couldn't go on pretending. Better get it over with now.

"I'm not saying that!" Jenny squeaked.

"What is it?" Martin said on the phone. Jenny glared at Penny, who just looked sad.

"She... says she's sorry she ate me. And she isn't!"

"Wha?"

Here it came. He'd be dumping her now.

"She ate me, what about that don't you understand Martin. She's a snake... well, Slithy thingy. Whatever." Penny typed her species out properly. "Er, Slithala Penny says. If that's how you pronounce that."

"She's not a snake?" Martin said.

"Heh, and you being the expert huh?" Jenny said, then glared at Penny as she tapped desk, typing 'Don't insult him!' "Yeah, she said she's a girl snake thingy. Or will be when she grows up. Heh, sounds like your girlfriend is underage." Then she gaped as Penny typed 'Three'. "Three? You're three years old?" Penny typed more. "Three DAYS old? Oh my god! Talk about robbing the cradle!" Penny just looked cross.

"Three days? Damn, she must have just been born when I found her." Martin said, and Penny chuckled as he didn't seem to react as Jenny expected.

"Yeah... well... She says she's nearly adult. How the heck does that work? Three days old an adult?" She paused while Penny typed. "OK, I know you said nearly. Don't be so picky!" More typing. "What?"

Martin interrupted at the odd pause.

"What is it?"

"Er, she says she has her mom's memories." She said in an odd tone.

"Wow, is she a hive mind or is it like Goa'uld genetic memories?"

Penny blinked, and slowly smiled. Martin understood.

"She says... the latter she thinks. Sort of. But not recent memories. God can't you just text him? I hate being this translator for you!"

"Heck, I'm gonna be in here a while so you'll have to look after her for me." Martin said with a chuckle.

"Oh hell no! I'm not babysitting a snake for you! This is you getting back at me for the ponies isn't it?"

"Actually, I kinda came around on that. You got me interested in them."

"Say what? You're watching MLP now?" Penny wondered what they were talking about, but focused on the main issue to her at least, typing.

'He can text me?'

Jenny turned to her.

"Yes he can text you." Then turning back to the phone. "And no I'm not looking after her."

Penny typed.

'It'll only be a few days till I grow. If I get a big meal maybe just one day."

"And what, you'll turn into a pumpkin?" She giggled..

Penny sighed, then typed the OTHER main thing on her mind.

"Oh, right. Uh Penny wants to know what the doctors said. Are you OK?"

"Uh, yeah. That's kinda weird. I'm on observation to see if anything else is wrong, probably for a week at least, and I've got bloodwork going, but my jaw is fine. Better than new apparently. I know I was bleeding but somehow it all healed before I got to hospital. They say it looks like I have a nasty infection, but they'll know more when the bloodwork comes back. I'm on antibiotics right now. And other stuff."

"I'm not baby sitting your snake for a week Martin! You can't make me!" Jenny said, her tone rising.

"Well, then bring her to me. I miss her."

Penny blinked. He did?

"What?" Jenny said, catching Penny's lost look. "Oh, love sick idiot. Of course he wants you! He's a horny guy! I heard what you said Penny. Er, read. Whatever."

"Wait, what?" Martin said shocked. "She told you about the blowjobs?"

Jenny's eyes suddenly got really wide.

"My god you're a pervert! She's a freaking snake!"

'Slithala.' Penny typed almost automatically, a silly smile on her face. Martin still wanted her!
1451322212121211221223111133.title: Miraculous healing.

choices: A nurse comes in and Penny has to hide.
Penny wants to be eaten to see if it will heal Martin more.
Jenny suggests hypnotherapy to see if Penny could remember more.
14513222121212112212231111331.content:
Martin unfortunately had to wait a little while. It had been awkward on Monday apparently, so they caught visiting hours on Tuesday afternoon instead. When the door finally opened (and this time wasn't a nurse or doctor) he smiled to see his ex girlfriend carrying a heavy looking bag. Well, wheeling it. It was a travel bag with one of those extendable handles.

"And you just have to be on the third floor?" She said with a glare, but her gaze softened. She left the bag by the door and leaned over the bed, hugging him. He was not surprised she didn't kiss him. "How're you doing Martin?"

"Uh, surprisingly OK actually. The medications they've got me under seem to be hitting me pretty hard, but the infection so far seems not to be too bad for whatever reason." He caught Penny's head, larger than he remembered sure enough, poking out of the bag cautiously, then nudging the door shut so she could come out unseen. "I'm glad the two of you could make it."

Jenny glanced over her shoulder and sighed, shaking her head at the snake.... Slithali, or whatever Penny was. This was all so awesome!

"If you two start making mad passionate love I'm leaving, OK?"

There was a soft beep and he saw his phone held up by Penny who had apparently been using it to type as she slithered up onto Martin's bed.


'Sure? You can join in if you like? I'm sure he'd like that.'


Martin bit his tongue, but thankfully Jenny fixed her glare solely on Penny.

"I'm going to say this one more time. NO. Not now, not ever. I am not going to be part of some little harem!"


'How about a big one?'


Martin snorted at that, unable to help himself. He shook his head.

"You know she's just trolling you Jenny? Give it up."

Jenny sighed and turned around.

"Great, now you have a snake prankster to make my life hell."


'Is it working?' Penny typed, only half understanding what they were saying, but it sounded fun. And she was fairly sure Martin had meant that Penny was not serious. She had been. She didn't see why Jenny couldn't enjoy being with Martin too. He obviously liked her so why not?


"Anyway..." Martin said suppressing a smirk, "... as I said I appear to be healthy. Sort of. Whatever this infection is the doctors are worried about, but so far hasn't been affecting me... unless the symptoms only showed up after the docs started their treatment. I kinda assumed it was all from the drugs but... meh, could be wrong I guess." He frowned. "Um... Penny? This may sound silly, but are your species magic in any way, or have any weird abilities? Say something that might have healed my mouth?"

"... or like eating unsuspecting people alive?" Jenny said quietly.

Penny ignored her.


'My mom didn't know of any, or at least directly, and nothing that might have helped your mouth. She did however meet someone who was a scientist who claimed that the rate our young grow at should be impossible normally. It's almost like when we're young we absorb all our food and turn it into our bodies, which this guy said was unprecedented. I'm not sure if that classifies as 'magic' but that's all I know.'


"Surely you know more about your own species?" Jenny said with a snort. "I mean didn't your mom tell you anything about them?"

Penny seemed to pull back in herself slowly before answering, typing with her tail.


'I never met her. I hatched shortly before Martin found me. My mom didn't know her mother either, though her mom had her young and not a lot of memories carried over as recent ones don't carry to young. I'm not sure if that was usual or not. Perhaps we just lost a load of our culture.' She stopped, tail paused over the phone for a few seconds, staring through the device, miles away. Finally she looked up at Martin. 'Honestly, I have wondered about that, and so did mom a bit when she was younger. I have no idea why mom didn't stick around for my hatching, or her mother for her's either. Maybe it was different reasons? Maybe it's something inherent in us? Maybe it's why Martin found my egg in the middle of nowhere. What that means I don't know.'


Martin leaned up and gently stroked the side of Penny's head.

"I'm sorry Penny. I didn't even think of that. I hope your mom's OK."


'Thank you Martin. Maybe I'll find her someday?'


"Maybe. Well if you ever have kids I hope we can raise them together."

Jenny peered at the two lovebirds as they stared into each other's eyes, and found that watching them wasn't as cringing as she had expected. And that there was also some pangs of jealousy in her too. She'd dumped him ages ago, but still.... No. She'd got rid of him for a reason. Now at least he had someone... or something, to take care of him. As much as she didn't want to stay with him she still felt something for him and certainly didn't want him to be unhappy. Probably. She was a snake after all! That was just weird!
14513222121212112212231111331.title: The Hospital.

choices: Almost immediately after swallowing Penny a Nurse DOES come in.
It's tight, and Penny doesn't want to hurt Martin. They take their time.
It's... Way too easy. Did Martin's jaws just dislocate?
145132221212121122122311113312.content:
Penny had to admit this talk of her mom was... a little unnerving. She was far more worried about Martin, even if he seemed to be OK right now.


'How bad was it before?' she typed nervously, having to nod to the phone to drag Martin's attention from her eyes. 'Before you got to the hospital? Was it just bleeding? Did you feel dizzy, or headaches or anything?'


"Hey, don't worry about me." He said, then saw her frown and just tap the phone with her tail. "Well, yeah was feeling kinda out of it. fuzzy headed, and yes some headache. But that's all gone now."


'But the medicine is affecting you? Maybe I could help? You asked if I maybe caused your throat to heal. Maybe I did. I know so little about my people. I'm really smooth, have no lumps right now. Do you think....' she paused in her typing, feeling a little light headed, '... eating me might... help you?'


He raised an eyebrow as his eyes slid back to her from the screen.

"Really? I.. have no idea." But Martin was smiling. Penny smiled back.

"Oh god you two are hopeless!" Jenny muttered. "No matter what perverted satisfaction you'd get from that it's a terrible idea. This is a hospital. I think they'd notice if a snake invaded his stomach. Sorry, Slithali!" She added at the look Penny gave her, though she didn't look sorry. "I doubt they'll make the distinction."


'I go through him pretty quick. I doubt they'll notice.' She typed, and had the satisfaction of Jenny's eyes going very big.


"Go through?.... oh you are disgusting!" She said, though Penny saw her blushing. Heh, she liked it. Bet she wished she could slide through Martin too.

"Jenny, please be nice to Penny." He said pleadingly. Then he turned back to the Slithali... still getting used to her not being a snake it looked like from his expression.

Penny wondered what he'd think once she got herself her adult body? Jenny had said he was really into snakes. He would still like her, right? It wasn't just because he was obsessed with her current form? No, he'd have to like a more human like girl body more, wouldn't he?


'Well, right now my body isn't too much thicker than I was the last time. If you can swallow my head I should slide in OK. This may be the last chance though. I'm going to not only get bigger but... shapelier soon.' She typed with a grin and had the satisfaction of Martin smiling back at her after he'd read it. 'and I won't have to rely on typing any more!'


"Aye men!" He chuckled and leaned in, gently resting his forehead against hers, eyes closed.

Jenny still seemed... a bit distracted through.

"I still have no idea how you could swallow th.... her." She said, interrupting the moment. "I mean, her head is huge. How in heck can you swallow that?"

"Honestly, I'm not sure. But she's not huge Jenny. I admit as she is now it does look impossible, but she's right. Her head isn't [i]that[/i] much larger than the last time I swallowed her, and..." he sighed with a wince, '... apart from the lumps, that was still easy. It'll likely not be quite as straightforward as all that, but so far my mouth has seemed to be the limiting factor entirely. If I can't swallow her head then we'll have to just stop there."

Jenny stared at him.

"You're really considering this aren't you? Are you nuts? What if a nurse comes in and sees you gulping a snake." And before Penny could reflexively start typing 'Slithali' she turned and butted in. "Yes, I know. Slithali. But the nurse won't know that!"

"Well, it won't take long. Could you guard the door Jenny? Please?" Martin said, attempting to imitate puppy dog eyes.

She glared back at him.

"You are so lucky I still like you." She said with a glare and then went over to lean against the door.


'Thank you Martin.' Penny typed, Jenny at least unable to read it from where she was. 'This is the last time I guess, and I'm going to miss it. The tightness. The closeness. Being inside you. Thank you so much for still caring.'


"Hey. Any time." He said, and she raised an eyebrow. She guessed he was more referring to his caring than the swallowing, but maybe he really didn't appreciate how bigger she'd get. Maybe.

As they prepared Penny noticed that Jenny was still looking at them. She smiled. Maybe she could understand why she liked this? She hoped so. Maybe it would put off what she'd been through when Penny had eaten her.
145132221212121122122311113312.title: Healing suggestion.

choices: Martin asks Jenny to help Penny eat enough to get to full size.
Jenny missed something and a Nurse arrives before Penny can exit Martin.
Jenny is getting fantasies about being eaten... By Martin!
1451322212121211221223111133123.content:
Penny's five foot length coiled gently on the bed, her head curled up in front of Martin, gazing into his eyes.

"I... can't make up my mind if I prefer your snake eyes before or these better?" He said with a chuckle.

Tap tap tap. He glanced down briefly, it was a bit annoying to have to glance at the phone every time she 'spoke' to him.


'Really? 'Fraid you're stuck with these now.'


Her eyes were almost golden, maybe a hint of the old yellow green and black, but now looking very human like.

"Well... I guess I'll live with it." He said, and leaned in to kiss her again. This time at least he didn't react poorly to the snake-kiss, though she still knew her current ability was lacking.


'Just wait till I have proper lips. I'm not gonna let you get any breathing room.'


Martin just smiled and kissed her again. Then she flicked her tongue inside his mouth, before gently wriggling her muzzle in too.


'Bon appetite.' She wrote even as she closed her eyes and slid inside.


When she'd been young her head was relatively bulky compared to her body size. Now it seemed she was more even proportionally. However she was five foot long and her head, though still snake like and tapered, was also large. Thus she was surprised as she felt her jaws ooze into his mouth, then her muzzle plop into his throat seemingly effortlessly. She felt a slight 'pock!' sound around her, and frowned. Did his jaws just dislocate?

Gently he swallowed and she moaned, feeling his muscles knead and draw her in. She dropped the phone, any plans of talking while being eaten lost to the wondrous sensations of being squeezed inside him.

Jenny meanwhile was struggling to avoid gaping as Martin, closed eyed, ate Penny like an anaconda! As she leaned against the door she gulped, watching his jaws part, stretching wider than any human's jaws had any right to, with seemingly no discomfort, and sucking in Penny's slender neck, and beginning to widen across her larger body. True, Penny had said he seemed to be able to manage her before, but this easily? After she was a little big wider? Maybe she had done something to him when he ate her before? She couldn't take her eyes away as Penny gleefully slid down her lover's throat, Martin's mouth stretching almost impossibly at the middle, Penny's largest diameter about five inches across. How did he do that without such a calm expression?

The remaining tail did not take that long, waving in the air till he sucked it up like a wet noodle, a contented smile on his face, and his stomach bulging out his hospital gown, as filled with snake as it was. Martin, still with a satisfied grin, opened his eyes and caught Jenny staring at him. She quickly flicked her gaze away, blushing. Why was she blushing? Well, obviously that whole thing was damn sexual to those two. She just felt awkward being a witness. She considered saying just that, but it felt like a rationalization. Instead she just opened the door a crack and checked outside to see if any Nurses were coming. They weren't.

"C... coast still clear." She whispered, not willing to turn to meet Martin's eyes. Suddenly she was feeling a little warm.
1451322212121211221223111133123.title: Ease of access.

choices: Jenny relents and agrees. Martin seems nicer than she remembers.
Jenny agrees, but still thinks he's a perv.
After thinking Jenny can't do it. She'll take Penny home but that's it.
14513222121212112212231111331231.content:
Martin felt the rather large bulk of Penny slither deeper and sighed. Damn! That had been... rather easy? Weird, but cool.

"You OK Penny?" He said, and felt a single tap from his intestines. "Good. Hope you enjoy the trip. Er, Jenny?" He said, looking up at his ex. This might be awkward. "Look, I'm gonna be stuck here for a while. I know you don't owe me anything but I'd appreciate it if you could take care of her. Please?"

Jenny slowly turned back to face him, her face rather scrunched up and glaring at him.

"Look after your girlfriend? Really?"

"Jenny, please. She can't stay here, she can't stay at my place..."

"Why not?" Jenny butted in. "No-one's going to bother her there? I'm sure not!"

Martin sighed. Yeah, this could be awkward.

"That's dangerous. Her, on her own there. What if she's seen? Plus she has to eat. She can't just lock herself indoors the whole time. And no, what's in my fridge won't cut it."

Jenny squinted at him.

"Yeah, I'm not gonna be her dinner."

He held his hands up defensively.

"Not saying that! God Jenny! Just... help her and make sure she's OK." He chuckled. "She's a big girl, I think she can mostly look after herself, but... yeah, food is an issue. Look, I'll pay if you need to get something for her. Rabbit, or whatever. Or... you can head out to find something in the country. I'm sure she'll be OK on her own if you help her there and back. Just... well I worry about her."

Jenny was glaring at him the whole time.

"You. Worry about the snake?" She shook her head minutely. "You are hopeless! Martin, she can eat a full grown person, and she's not even full size yet! She does NOT need me to take care of her!"

With a sigh Martin shook his head. Yeah Jenny obviously wasn't thinking it through.

"Of course, she can't possibly be in any danger can she? Not like some scientist or the government would capture her and want to study her... Really? As far as we know there are few of her people left. That's... well, I think she really would be in danger. Please help her!"

Again Jenny didn't let up that intense stare.

"You just want to see her with boobs." She said, and Martin's eyes went wide. "You're a guy, seriously, no matter how much you like her now, the thought of her with tits, it's driving you insane isn't it?"

Slowly he frowned at her, fixing her eyes with his.

"We were together for about four months Jenny." He said after a few moments silence. "You really think I'm that obsessed? Did I ever try to feel you up? Did I ever push? I wanted you to like me Jenny. I wanted us to be a couple, for you to stay. Yeah. I admit the thought of Penny like that is very cool, but more I want to ensure she's safe. She's happy. And above all that the two girls I like don't end up hating each other. Is that too hard to understand?"
14513222121212112212231111331231.title: Taking care

choices: Jenny takes Penny home and tries to find food for her.
One the way home a stray dog pesters Jenny. She doesn't like dogs.
When Jenny gets home with Penny, her parents are visiting! Yikes!
145132221212121122122311113312311.content:
Jenny's memories of their time together was... conflicted. When he took her to see some boring scifi movie. When he enthused over some spacey website. When he starting spouting off about what NASA was doing... she just turned off. But... they had had some fun together. That time on the beach. That one time she persuaded him to go to a dance party... though she really wasn't sure he'd enjoyed that. But he hadn't complained. A few movies had been fun together, and when she pushed him to dress up he was quite presentable. That one time when she'd gone to town on him and they'd gone shopping together on Main street. That had been fun.

Jenny blinked. For some weird reason a vivid image of Martin's lips around her feet flashed into her mind and she fought a blush starting. What was she thinking? That snake had tried to... HAD eaten her. Why would she... want.... Martin... Now an image of his lips around her shoulders flashed into her head, his tongue tasting her breasts. She shook her head abruptly. What was wrong with her? Besides, that was impossible anyway. Right?

When she looked back he seemed a little worried.

"Um, you OK Jenny?"

"I... I'm fine." She pouted, trying to focus, looking down to his belly where the Snake was. Inside him. God this was weird. "I guess I can do that. But if she tries to eat me again!" She glared at him again, trying to push it as much as she could. Mostly trying to avoid thinking about why she was thinking about Martin... nope, not going there!

"She won't." He said. How did he know for sure huh? Probably thinking with his dick again. Maybe.

"Alright, I'll feed the 'Slithali' and keep it safe till you get back, but you take over when she's done growing Martin! I'm not a maid!"

He smiled and she remembered how it used to be when they were together. Yeah. Well, if he could stop talking technostuff anyway.
145132221212121122122311113312311.title: Jenny relents

choices: The drive home was uneventful and Penny starts digesting. And changing!
She gets stopped by a cop. Hide Penny, Hide!
When she gets home her parents are visiting! Yikes!
1451322212121211221223111133123112.content:
Penny was back in the bag. Yes, she'd been washed first. EWWW! Jenny made sure she left the room for that! Seriously, why did Martin do that with her? Glancing down at the bag where Penny was she shook her head. Weird.

Her car was just around the corner. Why was the Hospital parking lot so damned full all the time? Maybe the place grew in number of patients and outgrew the lot? Who knew? Maybe just bad management. Far more likely! Now she had to walk three whole blocks to get to her car, and this wasn't a nice neighborhood.

"Brr." She shivered. Yeah, was less cold than... well, she stared up at the torn posters on the walls, the peeling paint, the steel ladders falling apart. One was laying on the ground. She was surprised no-one had stolen it. "Not a nice place."

A small snake head poked out of the bag and took a quick glance, looked up and nodded in agreement before pulling back inside.

In fact... the street up ahead did not look nice at all. Mostly the rough looking guys messing around over there. Jenny stopped, turned and headed into an alleyway. Yeah, so not getting near a gang posturing. Sure, didn't hear any guns, but who knew. Nope, not doing that!

The alleyway, though empty of people, looked worse. Trashcans were scattered everywhere, an old van was here, it's windows long since reduced to frames, it's wheels vanished. The rusted shell looked very sad but also very in place in the surroundings.

"GRRRRRRR!"

Jenny spun around and gave a yelp, dropping Penny's bag in fright. OK, that was a big, mean looking dog. Looked bigger than a rottweiler, at least ones she'd seen before... from a distance. She was not a fan of dogs. One had bitten her once.... and this one looked like it wanted to too!

"Er... n... nice doggy. Stay back!" She glanced around, then realized she'd dropped the bag. Martin would never forgive her if she left Penny here! "Easy... easy boy.... er....." Reaching down slowly to the bag she stopped when the dog growled again, loudly.

Then it leaped at her!

"AARRGGH!!" She gasped, falling over backwards, but a blur of brown and cream flashed in front of her and the dog yelped.

Panting she scrambled up on her elbows and looked down, seeing Penny's small frame partially wrapped around the dog, but... oh those were cuts. Looked like the dog had bitten her before she could get onto him. Scared she shuffled back on the ground, trying to get away from the two as they scrambled on the ground. The dog got a bite on Penny's tail. Ouch! That looked nasty. Then a coil wrapped around it's neck and pulled it away. Not that she had much to wrap around. She was only five foot long. The dog looked at least three foot long, if not bigger. It's paws scrabbled back and forth over Penny's scales and Jenny winced again.

"Penny! Be careful!" She gasped, looking for something to help with. She didn't have mace, or a knife or anything... not that she wanted to get close enough to that dog with a knife! Then she heard a yelp and turned in time to see Penny's jaw finally latch onto the dog's muzzle and gulp. "Yeah! Get him Penny!"

Once Penny had a good grip it went surprisingly quickly. The thing tried to swipe at her with it's paws, but a few more gulps pressed it's forelimbs against it's body and in it went. The huge mass of the animal stretched Penny a lot, and... Oh, she was gonna have to carry this home! Jenny glanced at the bag. Yeah, that was not gonna cut it!

It was barely two minutes later when the dog vanished completely, Penny's jaws closing past the thrashing tail.

"Er, are you OK Penny?" The snake... Slithali, looked tired and Jenny could still see she was bleeding from quite a few cuts and bite marks. "I... think I have some bandaids in the car. It's only a block from here. Do... you think you can get there?"

Penny glanced tiredly back at her bloated body and experimentally shifted. The dog twisted a bit in her, but she managed to move. Then Penny nodded to the bag.

"You aren't gonna fit Penny. Besides I can't carry... oh, the phone. Sorry!" Jenny reached in the bag and got Martin's phone back and put it down on the ground next to Penny. She had to use her muzzle as she could see past the bulk of the dog to watch her tail and the phone at the same time.


'I can get there, but slowly. Are you OK?'


Jenny blinked.

"Er... yeah. Thanks." She said. Penny had... saved her. "Hang on. Get close to the alley exit and I'll move the car closer. Er, maybe hide behind those trashcans." She said pointing to the rusted and bent cans to the right of the alley. Then she stopped and leaned over, resting a hand on Penny's head. "Thank you Penny. I... don't know what I'd have done if you hadn't helped me."

Helped her? Heck, the snake had done everything! But Penny smiled back at her and nodded, sliding around till she could pick up the phone with her tail and began to slowly make her way to the trash cans.

Jenny rushed off and brought the car around, thankfully there were no gang members or anyone there, and she glanced furtively before opening the door and motioning Penny in. It was painfully slow, and she saw the snake wince as she pulled her huge, dog bloated body into the back of Jenny's car. Belatedly Jenny realized she was gonna get snake blood on the back seats! Oh to hell with it. She'd get it cleaned later.

Climbing in the back seat with Penny she got out her first aid kit and wiped with alcohol pads, sprayed antiseptic, gingerly spread antibiotic cream, and carefully applied bandaids. Yeah, Penny had got pretty beat up, but it had been short. The dog was still struggling in there, making it a little difficult, and she saw Penny wince as she bumped the snake's injuries a couple of times.

"Sorry. Looks like that doggy aint gonna make it." Jenny said with a chuckle. "Poor doggy." Penny glanced up questioningly. "Uh. I never did like dogs. Had some back experiences. Martin's more a dog person than me."

Penny glanced down at her bulging body, the movements finally slowing, and looked a little nervous, pulling the phone up where her muzzle could reach it once more.


'Is Martin going to be angry with me for this?'


"Oh heck no! You saved me, I just mean he likes some dogs. I'm sure he won't be mad at you for stopping a dog attack me! Don't worry."

Suddenly Jenny realized how close she was to this snake... This snake that had eaten her. She had a brief shiver as she remembered that whole experience. Still.... she seemed, sort of OK. And Penny had saved her life. With a slightly nervous smile she again stroked Penny's head.

"I... guess I'd better get you home." She glanced at the massive bulge, now unmoving. "Guess you are gonna need a while to deal with your meal. I have a garage so no-one will see you get out of the car. Don't worry."


'Thank you Jenny. I'm glad you weren't hurt.'


Looking at the blood stained snake body Jenny did feel bad that Penny had taken that for her... though at least the snake had got a meal out of it!

"Yeah. Well, I'll drive us back. I'll leave my phone open while driving. If you need something text me." Penny nodded then settled down tiredly.

Yeah, this was so confusing. This snake had eaten her alive... and also saved her life... and was Martin's girlfriend. Her life was getting so weird!
1451322212121211221223111133123112.title: Evil doggy.

choices: Penny puts unconscious Jenny to bed, pondering about what she'd said.
Jenny wakes to find Penny snuggling very intimately with her! Yikes!
Jenny wakes up... looking out of Penny's sleeping maw. Shit!
14513222121212112212231111331231121.content:
Once the garage door was down Jenny helped Penny out, glancing at the seats. Yeah, gonna need to clean that. Er... what will a car cleaning service think of that? I mean, it doesn't look like a lot of stain admittedly, but very red. Yeah, not gonna be anything but blood. Still, animals bleed, she could say she had a snake that bled in there. That'd be the truth after all?

"Here you go, just relax." Jenny said, letting Penny inside the house. Thankfully she wasn't bleeding any more. The few cuts she hadn't been able to bandaid had stopped bleeding. "Here's the spare room. Just relax here. Er... do you want the door closed?"


'It would feel safer. Silly I know, but like this I feel very vulnerable.' Penny typed. 'I'm feeling very sleepy. I think I'll see you tomorrow.'

Curled vertically with her head on the floor, her coils as a pillow. Lord knew how she squeezed herself in there, but she managed it somehow. She just closed the door and let her snooze.

Admittedly she couldn't take her out to the movies or a meal (not that she'd be interested in such) but she found they shared some TV shows in common, and she was eager to hear about who was doing what in town... Maybe just because she didn't know anyone there. But still it was fun to talk, and.... well, she was worried about Martin. Penny was too of course, but Jenny couldn't shake the feeling that something was wrong.

So she was very surprised when a couple of days later the hospital said he seemed past the worst of it and his body was recovering from the infection. They never actually named what the infection was, and for some reason there were no details of the MRI or any of the other exams they'd had, but it looked like the last day or so they'd become less tense around him and both she and Penny finally began to relax. Even so it was the rest of the week before they'd let him go, and he headed home on Saturday night. Penny was positively giddy as they picked him up in Jenny's car and headed to Martin's place, Penny in the back seat with him, unfurled finally (though Jenny had said she should wait till they actually got home! Penny didn't listen of course), and the two kissed and cuddled the whole way home.

It was a little packed in the garage with both his bike and Jenny's car. He'd had to sell his car a while back. He'd never been a car person anyway.

"Should I bring you two a pillow or something?"

"I think that's Jenny's subtle way of saying she's being ignored."

"Oh, I'm sorry Penny, you want a kiss too?" She said smiling warmly.

"Was it something I said?" Penny asked.

"I... guess so." He whispered. "I really did love her. Still do I guess. I... suppose I just wasn't enough for her."

"Awww, you're plenty enough! I'm sure she'd like you. I think you're delicious!" Martin almost choked at that, shaking his head. Penny bit her lip. "Oh, right. She can't eat you can she? Well, not all of you. Oh.. oh OH!" She suddenly got excited. "It's been nearly a week!"

Penny was extremely open about that kind of thing. The last few days the girl had not really held back one iota about what she intended to do with Martin when she got him back in her arms. You hesitate, then regain your senses. "Why should I?" you say. She responds by putting her axe blade up. "Duly noted" you respond.

She leads you into a nearby building, which looked quite abandoned. After entering, she brings you into a room that looks surprisingly well kept and well furnished compared to the rest of the building, complete with a queen sized bed and a desk. She makes you sit on the bed before putting away her axe.
145331.title: A woman with a metallic neck, clad in skimpy ar...

145332.content: I turn around on this walkway- it is a woman. She's pale, almost six feet, with a black schoolgirl skirt & shirt on. Short knee skirt, observed.. why'd she be behind me? I just turn around and keep walking, surely she didn't kill my parent's, right? I think I've been trying hard since the police didn't find a thing. Walking now up the stairs to my dorm, her footsteps follow behind me. "This is the boys dorm." I say to her, why would she follow me? Weird. How do I know if its her? "I know. I want to talk to you in private." Uhh.. shit, im at a standstill here and im not feeling a good feeling.
145332.title: A pale, normal-appearing women. (A Mesh)

1453321.content:
"Sure.." reluctantly said, I let this stranger walk behind me. Her monotonous voice with a soft pitch is unusual, and as I open the door to my dorm and enter she nearly pushes me out of the way to get in first. I close it behind me as I enter, she better be here to talk about something related to my parents. Entering my main room, she draws my curtains closed and I immediately want to leave. Her light green eyes stick out to me, how'd I not notice that? She.. her skirt seems to be retreating upwards and her shirt sink into her!? A- monster girl! Her skin is light green she has featureless breast and a curvy body- she could be the killer- a untraceable shapeshifter! "What the he-!" Bam, my face is hit with her outstretched hand and it wraps my mouth, im unable to yell! I got to leave I think, but try in vain to leave as im yanked back to her with some inhuman strength. This is the end.
Without a clue of intentions I let myself go limp, but im only grasped by her hands which return to normal, pressing me against her body and, surprisingly, soft breast (C cup.). Is she the killer? Or some unknown monster? "Im glad you didn't keep that up." Her hand moves from my chest to my neck, and its very warm, now I should try to talk. "U-Hey, what did you come here for?- Im A-" "Alex, I know. I've observed you for some time now." Im hit with a ping of anxiety, who knows what she watched me do- freakish. I don't want to be forcefully in her grasp either, so I try moving away just for her to counterweight me onto my own bed, putting me in a position of laying ontop of her, resting my head on her pillows. "L-Let go!" She doesnt, and my struggles are still in vain as her hands fuse together. There's nothing to do with my limitations, I should talk.. no more rash actions.
"Im here to take you as my husband, if you want to. Your life has not gone so well, and I've longed to find someone who cares about the perception and emotions of others. I am Mesh." Hit with her introduction, im astounded and speechless.
1453321.title: "Sure..?"

choices: "We're going to my planet, you'll be surprised."
14533212.content:
Its rash to marry a alien woman who I just met, and could be dangerously powerful over me, but my parents are gone. My uncles, grandmas, passed on. No brother's or sister's, im a only child, too. Her grasp is probably the closest I've gotten to a person since my youth. "I don't have a family here, I'll marry you." She giggles lightly, how'd that make her laugh? "You have me as a family member now. You have my family, to. " But nobody of mine. "Please, try to come to terms with your life here. I can't bear to bring you far away if you don't accept your parents death, and leaving for a long time." I guess she's seen alot, and thats good I think. She must get my struggles despite me being a little weirded out, and the terms I've come to accept is im the only one left, but not who hit and run them. I would like to know who it was. "I accept leaving this planet, but I can't accept not knowing who did it and not bringing them to justice." Her grip tightens a little. "I expected that. Your parent's killer is dead." What..

How..

"Your lieing." I cant hold that back. He drove off, she's tricking me. "No, im not. He was known as Joe Klien. He died of a stroke the second of December last year." Joe Klien? Whoever he was, if I can trust my own judgement, I believe her. Even if not, its time to move onto this weird chapter of my life, maybe I'll get insight on this life of mine. "Nevermind, I believe you. Im glad to be your husband, Mesh." Im flipped under her, and as I turn around, her eyes are staring me in the face l, and I see her even dark greenish human-like tounge and teeth as she smiles wide. "You'll enjoy this new life of yours, I promise." I feel kind of at ease now, and suddenly a click hits my head and I.. reawaken, in a a huge domed room, walking on a carpeted platform with machinery and command chairs like I've never seen. Earth is what I look at though. Its oceans, clouds, storms.. all visible, the ice caps, its my home like I've never though I'd see it. "Are there more races then yours, Mesh?" I ask.

"There are alot." She simply replies.

1453322221.content:
I turn around and see ...nothing. Just an empty street. Could've sworn I was followed. I turn around and keep walking, then I hear footsteps behind me. I turn around again, and see the empty street again. I continue down the street again, this time to foot steps get even closer. I turn around to see nothing behind me again. I continue walking, now the foot steps slow down, but they sound very close to me now. I quickly turn around and still see nothing. This is getting scary, I need to catch and figure out who is following me. I ready myself as I continue walking down the street. I hear the footsteps again, but then I feel a tap on my shoulder. I quickly turn around and grab the hand. Next thing I hear is a scream. "EEK! I'm sorry I'm sorry I'm sorry"

I hear the voice, but there's no one in front of me. I feel like I've grabbed someone's hand, but there's nothing in it. This is too freaky, so I yell out "Who's there? Show yourself!"

"I'm sorry, my name is Alexandra. We go to the same university. I saw you in orientation a-and I wanted to...we talked to each other and... well I just thought you... um- I wanted to talk to you I guess?"

Wait, did this disembodied voice just have a crush on me? Also, she did sound familiar "Um...Wait, were you the girl with bandages wrapped on her face?"

"Yeah, you remember me?"

"Of course, the group leader tried to make a big deal about how we were both called Alex and such, how could I forget? I thought those bandages were because you had a skin condition" I let go of her finally as she clearly wasn't posing any threat anymore.

"Well, that's not far off. My skin is what makes me invisible. I just wear the bandages to help people see me."

"Wait, does that mean you're completely naked right now?"

"Y-yes. It's the only way for me to be completely invisible. I wanted to get your...um.... I wanted to get to know you better. But I get really nervous when trying to talk to you, so I thought I might try coming out like this, so I could talk to you without you looking at me directly. Does that make sense?"

"Oh yeah, I think I heard about something similar to that, where you just talk to the air rather than to the face. So you just wanted to ask me out on a date?"

"Oh um...well..."

"Cause I would love to."

"W-wait, really?"

"Yeah, you seem really nice, and you stripped down naked just for me" I joked.

"Oh uhh" from the sound of her voice, she was probably blushing "Yeah! It's a date."

"Okay then. I'll meet you tomorrow. Let me give you my phone number and you can text me your address so I can pick you up."

"Yeah, that sounds great!"

The next day

I rinse my mouth and wipe away the toothpaste covering my lips. I check myself over in my mirror. Neatly combed hair, my trademark green shirt, a pair of dark grey jeans, and my necklace. I walk out and check my phone. No missed calls. I check the time, and see that it's 7:30. "Crap, I'm gonna be late." I curse myself rushing outside. I stop and run back in grabbing a large wooden stake and placing it in the hilt on my waist. I get in my car and drive to a small fancy restrant. I had a date today. She seemed really nice, and I kinda liked her... even though I've never met her. I check my phone and look at the time. 7:57. A bit early... I walk in and look around. He leads me to a small table close to the window. I look out and see the moon shining brightly. A waxing cresant, beautiful. I stare at it a minute and return to life. I wait for her to arrive. We both quickly skim our menus and Millisa says, "I'll have the stake, rare please." "And you sir?" "May I have the clam and shrimp soup?" "Most certainly. And to drink? "Just water for me." I say, "As well as me." Millisa responds.

15131.content:
Ah, the Were-Bat. Interesting creature, no? Now for those who haven't heard of such a creature, a Were-Bat is basically sort of like a werewolf. Only instead of transforming into the iconic monster, the person (whether they would be a man or a woman) transforms into a large bat-like creature, sporting large leathery wings capable of flight, just like a real bat, whether it's a Fruit Bat or the notorious Vampire Bat.

You think there isn't such a thing as a Were-Bat, hmm? Well, allow me to introduce you to Doctor Kirk Langstrom, also known as the Man-Bat, from the Batman mythos. You see, Dr. Langstrom suffers from a chronic deafening disease, which causes his hearing to degrade over time. So to cure his affliction, he uses Vampire Bat DNA and mixes it with his own DNA. At first it does work. But eventually, it causes Langstrom to violently transform into the Man-Bat, an intimidating human-bat monster. Fortunately, Batman was able to change Langstrom back via antidote.

Now that this history lesson is over with, it's time to choose who our lucky victi- I mean volunteer will be, hmm?

choices: The date ends and you arrange to meet up again
The date continues and you decide to go for a walk after dinner
15133211.content:
Sitting at the table, playing nervously with your cutlery while you waited for your mystery date to arrive, you couldn't help but wonder why you had agreed to this in the first place; not having a great deal of experience with women in the past and being kind of nervous around new people. You supposed your friends were just looking out for you, seeing as you were the only one in your small group currently single (and had been for quite some time)...well, either that or they were playing some really elaborate prank; having never actually seen this new girl before and half expecting some truly repulsive creature to waddle her way through the door.

"Nah, they wouldn't do that to me," you said to yourself, trying to shake the thought out of your head, figuring that even your best friend Mike, who was something of a joker, wouldn't go so far as to actually book you a table in a restaurant just for a prank (though admittedly it wasn't really much of a restaurant, more like a fancy burger joint).

Deciding then to think positively, picturing your date as some incredibly sexy, sweet and funny girl (and praying to God that you were right), currently knowing virtually nothing about her, other than the fact that her name was Emily, she was a year younger than you, and that her family had just moved to town two or three weeks ago from somewhere out in the sticks. Not that you were alone in this though, your friends knowing very little either, and the only reason you were actually sitting here was due to Clara (Mike's girlfriend, who was a year below you) sat next to one of Emily's recently made friend's in History and the two of them had decided to pair you up. Emily it seemed, according to her friend, currently being in a similar dating situation to you, only with far less of a social circle to choose from (kind of suggesting that she was forced into this thing too). According to Clara she was nice though. "Cute" being the word she'd banded about a lot to describe her, assuring you that the two of you would get on like a house on fire.

Well you certainly hoped this was the case, even if she wasn't 'girlfriend material', having not really spent much alone time with a girl (other than your mom and your sister that is) and kind of needing to get back out there and start playing the field; it having been a long while since your brief dalliance with Michelle back in the 9th grade.

As all this was going through your mind, with your attention still focused on the knife and fork that you were sliding back and forth across the table top, you hadn't noticed the door to the diner open and a figure hurry in, getting somewhat of a fright when you suddenly heard a voice from above you say, "Uhm, Hi there. Are you...are you Ryan?"

Jolting back a little in surprise, you looked up to see an equally nervous looking young girl, clutching a satchel tightly in her hands, dressed in a cute little pink 'Hello Kitty' top (that was currently hanging off one shoulder), a short pleated grey skirt, long, thigh high stripy pink and white socks, and a pair of plain white sneakers.

"Uh yeah, I am...that's me," you replied, feeling a little embarrassed for getting such a shock, "You must be Emily."

"Yep. Sorry if I'm late. I was doing some studying and I kind of lost track of time."

"Heh. That's okay. No problem," you told her, beckoning for her to join you in the booth, "Please, have a seat."

"Thanks," she awkwardly smiled, pulling the satchel strap over her shoulder and shuffling onto the seat opposite you, getting herself comfortable as you began to mentally assess your date.

Relatively speaking she wasn't too bad, perhaps not being as stunningly beautiful as you'd been imagining, or even quite in the same league as Clara (who was a real looker), but she was definitely, as Clara had put it, "cute", having a very soft and pretty face with a few freckles dotted around her nose. Her hair was cut short, brown, with long bangs that hung down well past her eyes (and since introducing herself, had brushed them out of the way at least three of four time). And while she was quite short, she wasn't overly so, looking to be about 5' 3", at least 7 or 8 inches shorter than you, possessing rather a skinny, athletic sort of figure with smallish breasts that really didn't make much of a dent in her top. Not that you were complaining though, not exactly having a queue of tall, blond, busty babes waiting for you outside as back up or anything, and actually finding Emily rather attractive, hoping that her personality matched her looks.

Once she was settled, and once the two of you had got over some initial, rather sheepish small talk, discovering in the process that Emily's friend, Caitlin had dropped her off (the friend that Clara had arranged this with), and that it had been an extracurricular Chemistry project that she'd been working on that had caused her to be late, a waiter appeared and handed the two of you menus, which you both then began to peruse.

After ordering and receiving your drinks, you discovered two more important things about your date. One being that she appeared slightly clumsy at times, almost spilling her coke over herself and half the table on at least two separate occasions, and two, that after her initial perky introduction she didn't really seem like she was all that interested in actually being here with you, her attention wandering from time to time out the window or to other couples sitting at other tables. "Shit!" you thought to yourself, realizing this date was quickly going down hill, Emily giving you the distinct impression that she'd much rather be somewhere else, "I'm really out of practice. Gotta try and be more interesting!"

So with this in mind, grasping at straws, you then interrupted your rather long and drawn out story about the last time you'd eaten here and instead said, pointing towards her shirt, "That's uh, that's a cute top you've got on there. D'you like all those Japanese cartoons and stuff?"

Letting out a half giggle, Emily thankfully responded, "Thanks. And yeah, kinda. I like some anime stuff."

Quickly following this up, not wanting to lose her again and for your date to return to dullsville, you decided to take a chance and reveal something (perhaps) a little on the embarrassing side, telling her that, "Cool. I like some of it too. My sister even had this Hello Kitty game that was actually pretty fun..." adding with a nervous chuckle, "Just don't tell my friend's that or I'll never hear the end of it."

This provoked yet another giggle from Emily, having appeared to have finally broken the ice, as she replied (slightly more enthusiastically than she had done before), "I' think I've got that game! The one where you have to collect apples while avoiding those really funny crows with the little hats on?"

"Yeah, that's the one."

"That's such a fun game," she smiled, opening up a little more herself, "I haven't played it in a while though. I sort of got sucked into the whole Mass Effect craze."

Hearing this made your ears instantly prick up, and you yelped excitedly, "You play Mass Effect?! Me too!", discovering that this cute and slightly quirky girl was into the same video games as you being both a major break through and as awesome as hell.

Using this as a new jumping off point, things took a much better turn, with Emily revealing much more of her inner geek as well as actually laughing at some of your jokes, as you both enthusiastically chatted away. First about games, then about movies, then cartoons, then just about everything else, finding the you really did have a lot in common and that Emily was indeed a very friendly, very smart and very cool girl. Also, far from appearing bored or disinterested, as she had done before, now she really did seem like she was enjoying spending time with you on this date, just as you were with her.
15133211.title: The first date

choices: Meeting up for lunch the next day
A few days later, after having gotten to know one another a bit better
151332111.content:
The rest of the date continued on in pretty much the same vein, the two of you finding now that you had quite a lot to talk about as you both chowed down on your burgers, there of course being the odd occasional pause here or there, but no more than was to be expected on a first date. The more you chatted with Emily, the more things you discovered; owning up about her apparent clumsiness after tripping up and nearly falling over a chair on her way back from the bathroom, as well as revealing just how smart and studious she was - having not only been top of her class at her old school, but having also already joined quite a few after school clubs at this new one (History, Biology and English being her particular favorite subjects). Though you could hardly compete with this, doing okay at school but not exactly setting the boards alight with your test scores, you couldn't help but admire her enthusiasm, getting a real nerdy and innocent joy over something so banal as reading text books and studying. Perhaps she wasn't quite the girl you'd been hoping for when you'd been waiting for her to arrive, but that really didn't matter anymore, finding her incredibly attractive and fun to be around, no matter if beneath her cute and giggly girl-next-door exterior, she was really a massive geek.

A little while later, after the two of you had finished your meal (which you had happily obliged to pay for), things turned a little bit more awkward outside as the two of you stood there, not being quite sure exactly how to part. Truthfully you didn't want the night to end so soon, having only spent a couple of hours together inside the burger bar and there being so much more you still wanted to know and find out about her. But then again, this was just a first date, not to mention the first time the two of you had actually met, and asking her to do anything else now would be kind of pushing things a little too soon. So instead, you offered to walk her home, figuring that this was a far more innocent and gentlemanly gesture.

"Thanks for the offer but my friend Caitlin said she'd pick me up," Emily replied, dashing your hopes for that.

"No problem," you quickly told her, attempting to hide your disappointment, "Just wanted to make sure you got home safely is all."

Blushing a little at this, she then asked you, "What about you? Did you drive or...?"

"Heh. no, I wish!" you laughed, feeling slightly embarrassed, hoping this didn't take you down a notch in her estimation as you revealed that, "I don't have enough cash for a car of my own yet," before getting back to the original question. "No I uh, I walked. My house isn't far from here so I'll be cool."

"Ah, okay."

With the date now clearly coming to an end, realizing that if you didn't say something now then it was going to be too late, you bit the bullet and told her truthfully, "It was nice hanging out with you though. I had a really great time."

"Yeah, me too," she smiled, blushing a little again, the streak of red across her freckle dotted cheeks making her look all the cuter, causing you to nervously grin.

Deciding then to take things a step further and ask her what had clearly been playing on your mind ever since you'd left the restaurant, you went completely for broke and said, after a brief pause, "...Maybe we can do it again some time?"

Unfortunately her initial reaction to this was not quite what you'd hoped for, practically biting at her tongue as she stared at you with an look of unease painted across her still slightly blushing face, as if wrestling with something inside her head. "Shit! Shit! Shit! Shit! SHIT!" you chanted to yourself, realizing that you must have read the signals wrong, feeling your heart sink a little in your chest as it became quite apparent that this cute and funny girl was about to say no.

She didn't however and instead after about ten or fifteen seconds, said, "Yes!" the word leaping out of her mouth with such enthusiasm and candor that it almost felt like it had been imprisoned there and was making a desperate bid to be free. "Yes I would. I really would like that," she continued, smiling from ear to ear now and looking a little embarrassed herself as she quickly pulled a scrap of paper and a pen out of her satchel and began scribbling something down. "That's my number if you want to give me a call," she told you as she passed you it, before turning and quickly scampering off, calling out behind her, "See you later!"

Being a little taken aback by what had just happened, as well as the suddenness of it all, you watched as she disappeared down the street to wherever her friend was picking her up and called out, "Night!", before turning your attention to the piece of paper and seeing a cell phone number, as well as a few little kisses written on it. This of course, brought home to you what had happened, you sense of dread that she was going to reject you (as had happened a few times in the past) suddenly giving way to a intense feeling of joy, as you pumped a fist in the air in celebration and silently mouthed; "Yes!"

"Things are looking up now," you said to yourself with a smile as you placed the number into your pocked and began making your way home, glad after all that your friends had convinced you to go out on this date, and even more glad that it was with Emily.

After returning home, around twenty or so minutes later, and after a good grilling from your sister over how your night had gone (as well as a call from Mike who was also anxious to find out), you lay there on your bed just staring at the number Emily had given you, wondering if you should give her a call now or not, realizing that it might seem a bit kind of desperate and instead deciding to simply send her a text.

"HAD GR8T TIME TONIGHT. CAN'T W8T TO MEET UP AGAIN. YOU FREE ANYTIME SOON?"

Less than a minute later, you received a reply that read; "ME 2. WAS A LOT OF FUN. HOW DOES TOMORROW LUNCH SOUND? :)"

"SOUNDS GR8T! :D," you quickly replied, not for one minute thinking that it would be so soon, but happy that she wanted to actually meet up again at school, "MEET YOU BY FRONT ENTRANCE @ AROUND 12?"

"LOOKIN FORWARD 2 IT. XXX"

Reading that, you instantly fell back again onto your bed, grinning away to yourself like a mad man, hoping that things would continue to go as well tomorrow as they seemingly had tonight, not being able to wait to find out more about this truly awesome and exciting girl.
151332111.title: Plans for a second date?

choices: Emily invites you over to her house
The two of you go for a romantic moonlight stroll
1513321111.content:
The next morning you awoke with a spring in your step and quickly got dressed and ate breakfast, anxious for the first time in a long while to actually get to school, ignoring the less than subtle teasing that was being dished out by your elder sister as you headed out the door.

Once at school, you received more of the same from your friends as Mike and Clara cornered you in the hallway almost as soon as they'd spotted you, wanting to know more about your date and about Emily, who Mike was now a lot more interesting in actually meeting.

"Yeah I suppose she's kind of geeky," you told them, after Clara had brought up how studious she was and how she'd heard she'd previously been top of her class, "But not like full on Math club-geeky. More kind of cute-geeky; y'know, like being into anime and video games and stuff. I mean she plays Mass Effect for God sake! How cool is that?"

"That is pretty cool," Mike agreed, adding jokingly "But if it turns out she is a total nerd, then you realize we're going to have to destroy her right?" putting on a fake English accent as he proclaimed, "The nerds must not be allowed to thrive!"

Giving her boyfriend a sharp jab to the chest with her elbow, used to these kind of ridiculous outbursts, Clara told him to, "Shut up you idiot," before turning her attention back to you again. "Just ignore him Ryan. She sounds really nice, I'm glad it went well for you last night."

"Yeah me too," you agreed, smiling away to yourself.

"I'm just joking, dude, good on ya!" Mike then said, having recovered from Clara's elbow and giving you a playful little slap on the back. "Just tell me when our first double date is gonna be and I'll be there."

"Heh. Might be a little too soon to start thinking about that," you chuckled.

"Yeah, Mike. Give the boy a chance to get to know her first will you!" Clara said, admonishing Mike yet again.

"Jeez, I just can't win here can I?" he laughed, feigning injured pride.

"Apparently not," came Clara's response. "So you gonna see her again anytime soon, Ryan?"

"Today actually. She wants to meet up for lunch."

Looking suitably impressed by this, your best friend grinned, "Hot dang - A second date already. Way to go bro!"

Receiving a few further congratulatory slaps on the back from Mike as you tried to tell him that it wasn't really a date, the three of you then headed off to class, with Clara giving you a few little tips on what to say and what not to say, adding that she'd put in a good word for you with Emily during History, before you all then went your separate ways.

The rest of the morning went by pretty quickly and after one or two more run ins with Mike and Clara, and after receiving a smiley face text message from Emily, eventually lunch time rolled around, and feeling your excitement rising again, you stuffed your books and your bag into your locker and headed off towards the front entrance to find her.

"Hey, you made it!" she smiled, as you made your way over to where she was stood, at the bottom of the steps, waiting patiently for you, dressed again in a cute but quirky little outfit, complete with long stripey socks, but with her hair this time pinned back slightly with a yellow butterfly shaped clasp.

"Of course, where else would I be?" you replied, spotting a large blue book clutched tightly beneath one arm and indicating towards it jokingly, "Just doing a bit of light reading there were you?"

"Oh this? Heh-heh. No," Emily giggled, looking down at the book, giving you a little glimpse of the cover which had some sort of large green reptile on it, "This is just uh, just something I'm working on for Biology. Wanted to get it out of the library first before anyone else had the same idea."

"Ah, smart thinking. So, you wanna go grab something to eat then?"

"Sure."

And with that the two of you headed off to get some lunch, picking up exactly where you'd left off the previous night, losing none of the rapport you'd established as you laughed and giggled with one another all the way to the nearest fast food joint, learning a lot more about each other in the process.

After that things progressed pretty well between the two of you, meeting up with Emily again the next day and the next one after that, before finally working up the courage to ask her out again, this time to the cinema which she gladly accepted. Though the movie was pretty bad, the two of you had a great time, and although neither of you had yet made any kind of moves or made any reference to actually being boyfriend and girlfriend, you began to get the distinct impression that this was where things were heading, and were pretty darn happy about it too.

Agreeing to it after an little bit of persuasion Emily seemed to get on well with your friends and they seemed to like her too, finding her quirkiness kind of amusing, especially after she accidentally knocked an entire keg of beer into the pool (which had thankfully been unopened). With everything else going relatively smoothly and Emily having a good time (although avoiding the booze that everyone else was partaking in you noticed), you thought now might be the time to take things to the next level, spotting pretty much every other couple making out or dancing provocatively with one another, and decided to try and get in one some of that action, leading her onto the 'dance floor' (Mike's living room) where you began busting some of your, admittedly, rather lame movies. Cracking up at these at first, eventually she started to join in a little herself, her dance moves being ironically enough, almost as bad as yours, only in a rather more adorable sort of way, and feeling bold now (having had a few drinks yourself), you then placed your hands onto her hips in an effort to achieve some actual physical contact.

Emily however, quickly pulled away, causing your hands to fall back, and fearing that you'd offended her you immediately went to apologize, finding to your surprise that she continued on happily dancing as nothing had even happened. "Okay, that was kind of weird," you thought to yourself, glad that you hadn't totally blown it but being slightly perplexed by what had just took place, wondering to yourself if perhaps she was one of those girls that didn't like physical contact or something.

Relaying what had happened the next day to Clara, wondering if you had indeed done something wrong, she reassuringly informed you, "Nah, it was probably just nothing Ryan, don't sweat it. She probably just wants to take things a little slower, and didn't feel like having your drunk hands pawing all over her, that's all."

"Yeah, dude. I mean she didn't scream at you or storm off or anything, that's got to be a good sign," Mike added.

"Yeah, I guess so," you replied, not entirely sure you actually believed it though. "It's just I've got absolutely no idea what it is she's thinking. I mean we get on really well and stuff, but are we actually going out or does she just want to be friends?"

"Seriously Ryan, you need to stop over thinking things so much," Clara sighed, shaking her head and grabbing yours firmly between her hands, telling you in no uncertain terms, "Cause trust me when I say; she's totally into you. It's obvious!"

"You really think so?"

"I know so," she said, letting go of your face again, "So stop worrying so much and just go with the flow."

Hearing this coming from Clara, an actual girl with actual experience of dating (even if it was with Mike) made you feel a whole lot better about what had happened, and deciding to take her advice to not worry so much, you did just that, meeting up with Emily again for lunch soon after and continuing on as if everything was normal.

"So my parents are going out of town this weekend to visit my Aunt, and I wondered if you might want to come over to mine while they're gone," Emily surprised you with half way out the school gates, adding with a giggle, "Maybe we can play some Hello Kitty or something."

"Yeah, that'd...that'd be awesome," you stuttered, totally ignoring the callback, being a little too shocked by what she'd just asked you, well aware what inviting a member of the opposite sex over to yours (especially while your parents were away) usually implied.

"Cool!" she beamed, flashing you a cute little grin, and even more surprisingly grabbing at your hand, confusing you all the more.

Smiling to yourself, happy for this small but meaningful bit of contact, the two of you then headed off to get lunch, chatting away about what kind of things you could get up to on Saturday, spending most of the journey there and back with hands still clasped. For a moment you'd even considered leaning over and giving her a quick peck on the cheek while she was eating her fries, but you thought better of it, figuring that just this was enough for now, and perhaps you could maybe risk that later when you were alone together at her house.

"Ugh! I thought you guys were supposed to be away already," Emily groaned, ignoring the question.

"Well we were, but you know your father; it's always one thing after another."

Receiving another inquisitive glance from her mom while her father fumbled about in the background with various bags, dropping half of them onto the floor (clearly possessing the same clumsiness gene as his daughter), you thought you'd probably best introduce yourself, not wanting to appear rude, and giving them both a wave, you said, "Hi, I'm Ryan."

This of course led to, just as Emily had predicted, a great deal more follow up questions, some of which made Emily groan even further and at times turn a little red (and in truth, you as well on occasion). Thankfully though, her parents seemed like really nice people and they appeared to take to you well, her mother in particular commenting on "what a nice young man" you were after offering her husband a hand getting the bags into the car, as well as inviting you over for dinner when they returned. Much to Emily's relief, they then finally took off, though not because she was embarrassed of them (at least that was what you'd gleamed from how they all interacted with one another; Emily seemingly having quite a good relationship with her parents), but more so because she was embarrassed by what they might say or ask you, getting the distinct impression that you were probably the first boy she had ever brought home.

The entire room was decorated in a bright pink color with fluffy teddies all over the place, as well as various little anime and video game statues and a huge big picture of Albert Einstein taking up most of one wall. Although weirdly enough there were a few large tears through Albert's face, which had been taped back up, as well as it seemed quite a deep scratches and scuff marks decorating most of the walls, something that you couldn't help but point out. "You don't have a real one of those things hiding under your bed do you?" you asked, indicating to one of her teddy bears, then placing a finger on one of the scratches next to the poster, "One who has something against old Albert here?"

"Heh. No," Emily giggled, looking slightly nervous for a second, before explaining, "That's just from me being clumsy. I'm always falling over and wrecking stuff."

Accepting this and thinking nothing more of it, the two of you then got down to listening to some of the purchases you'd made at the mall, before playing some of Emily's video games, starting off with Mass Effect (which she was actually pretty fantastic at) and eventually moving on to, as somewhat of a joke, Hello Kitty - The game that had gotten the two of you together in the first place.

After a few games of that, the two of you then decided to watch a movie, Emily choosing Men in Black, which was a favorite of yours, serving up a big bowl of popcorn to complement the movie.

Now seated next to one another in the living room, on her parent's comfy leather couch with Emily snuggled up against your right shoulder, you found it somewhat difficult to keep your attention exclusively on the movie. Now she was pressed up against you on the couch, practically resting her head against your chest and looking as comfortable with you now as you'd ever seen her. Surely if there was a time to make a move then this was it, no matter what Clara had advised. And surely Emily wouldn't take offense to something as small and innocent as a little kiss? "It's now or never," you thought, running your tongue along the edge of your lips and staring down at Emily's still smiling face, having finally decided to make your move, leaning your head forward a little towards hers. Noticing the movement above her, Emily looked up, and staring into her big, inquisitive green eyes, you flashed her a reassuring smile of your own and quickly brought your lips towards hers...
