I've looked up hundreds and thousands of books on the subject and even scoured the entirety of the internet, but so far I've come up with zip. All I know is that I am one, I have been since I was 11 years old."

"11 years old?" you again repeated, shocked by this, having expected to her to have either been born this way, or for it to have been a recent affliction, "What? How? Were you like bitten or scratched or something, like in the werewolf movies?"
151332111111111111.title: You decide to talk to her about what happened

choices: You come to a decision by lunch time
It takes you a few days to finally come to a decision
1513321111111111111.content:
"Kind of yeah," she nodded, before then proceeding to explain the rest of her story. "I was out playing in the woods near this old swamp where we used to live with my dog Sparky. I'd played there hundreds of times before so I didn't think anything of it. But then it started to get dark, so we headed for home. Next thing I know Sparky starts barking and I hear this weird hissing noise coming from the trees. Then I see this big pair of yellow eyes staring at me, and you can probably imagine what happened next." This you could indeed, recalling Emily's eyes when she'd transformed into that thing, as she continued on anyway.

"This huge green lizard thing jumped out at me and sunk it's teeth right into my leg," she said, moving her hand down to one of her stripy socks and rolling it towards her ankle, "It's one of the reasons I wear these big socks all the time, to cover the scar." There right enough, at the back of her left calve was a long, almost semi circular scar that did indeed look like several large teeth marks, about 5 inches across, a scar which you had of course never noticed before. "My parents found me about an hour later," she continued, rolling the sock back up, "I was delirious. Talking about monsters, which they of course didn't believe, and Sparky was gone, presumably eaten by that thing that attacked me. Everyone just figured that Sparky must have bitten me and ran off, and that was the end of that, things went right back to normal. Except for me. Things never went back to normal for me.

"The first time it happened, I think it might actually have been a full moon. Though it doesn't exactly work like with werewolves. I couldn't control it in the beginning and I was terrified. It's tricky enough being an 11 year old girl going through puberty without having the added worry of transforming into a giant lizard every night and running amok in the swamps and in the woods. Sometimes I'd even wake up, butt naked, in the middle of nowhere, covered in mud and dirt. It was horrible!"

"Jesus..." was all you could think to say after hearing this story, it being not quite what you'd expected, sounding incredibly tragic and painful for a young girl to have to go through. Especially Emily.

"Yeah," she nodded, agreeing with your sentiment, looking almost wistful as she conjured up the memory. "I didn't know what was happening to me or why, but I did sort of learn how to live with it, even control it to a point. So much so that I could change when I wanted to change and not when I didn't..." adding rather awkwardly as she looked as you, the guilt evident on her face, "apart from some occasions of course..."

"Otherwise you wouldn't have done that to me..." you mumbled, finishing the thought.

"Oh God, I know and I wish I could have been able to control it!" Emily regretfully gushed, her sorrow over what she'd done being more than evident in her face and voice, as she looked away in shame, "It's just sometimes, when my emotions get too high, like anger or...or lust, it just happens. I can't stop it. That was why I wouldn't kiss you, or get too close. Even though I so desperately wanted to." This sort of made sense you supposed, Emily having been all standoffish for weeks before suddenly jumping all over you. "I think in the end that might have been what finally triggered it, all that repressed emotion I felt towards you," she told you, her eyes returning to yours again as she said sincerely, "I really, really like you, Ryan. More than any guy I've ever known. And I know you might not believe me or think I'm some sort of freak or something, but I promise you I'm not. I just a girl. A girl who was given some crazy curse she never asked for, sure, but a girl none the less."

You could almost feel a lump in your throat forming as she said this, her big green eyes almost tearing up as she gently placed a hand atop yours and softly spoke. "And I hope you can forgive me for what happened, and that perhaps one day we might be able to start all over."

"I don't know...I don't know if we can," you replied, moving your hand away, not yet sure what to make of all of this. It being a huge upheaval in your relationship and a heck of a lot to get to grips with. Your girlfriend (or rather wanna be girlfriend) was a strange were-lizard beast thing, how on earth were things supposed to go back to normal after learning that?

Deciding that this wasn't neither the time nor the place to come to any decisions just yet, you then asked her, "Who else knows about you...about the lizard part?"

"Nobody," was her response, "You're the only person I've ever told. I was too frightened of what might happen if anyone else knew. Even my parents."

There was a brief pause in the conversation after she'd said this, her story appearing to get sadder and more lonelier by the minute, as you imagined Emily having to deal with this whole thing all by herself since she was 11. It was madness! That being said, and although you still clearly felt a lot of affection towards this girl (and now a great deal of sympathy as well), the whole thing was just too big and too weird. Monsters existed and she was one of them. You really needed some space to process all of this, and so told her as much.

"This is all so fucking crazy! I need some time to think."

"Of course. Take all the time you need," Emily said, a flash of hope evident in her voice as she realized you hadn't ruled out anything quite yet. "Just please, don't tell anyone, and don't think any less of me. I never wanted any of this to happen." And with that she gave you one last little smile and then turned and walked away, off to class as the bell for first period began to ring.

Watching her go, left alone now with your thoughts, you mulled over everything she'd told you for a moment, before then too heading off towards your own class, thinking as you went about all this stuff you were going to have to come to terms with, as well as the decision you were going to have to make.
1513321111111111111.title: A history lesson

choices: You can't find Emily, she appears to have disappeared
15133211111111111111.content:
The day went rather slowly after your conversation with Emily and you found yourself being unable to concentrate in class, your mind being elsewhere as your teachers droned on and on about whatever lesson it was they were teaching. Even during recess and lunch, sitting with your friends, you found yourself unable to focus on what they were saying, still very much thinking of Emily and what it was she'd told you.

"C'mon, dude, you got to tell us. What was that all about between you and Emily this morning?" Mike asked, as you him and Clara sat in the cafeteria eating your lunch, still trying desperately to squeeze some info out of you as you stared off into space, "You can't hold out on us here."

"Huh, what?" you asked, being briefly pulled from your thoughts.

Mike laughed at this and waved a hand in front of your face jokingly. "Wow, talk about spaced out...You still in there, Ryan?"

"Yeah, sorry guys. I'm just distracted is all."

"Well we can see that," Clara said, letting out a chuckle, "The question is; why?"

"Yeah, have you and Emily hit a rough patch or something?" Mike asked, following on from his girlfriend's comment, nothing seemingly getting past them.

Though 'rough patch' wasn't how you'd best describe what had happened, you figured it was close enough and replied, "You could say that," not really wanting to give away too many details, but needing to give your friends something to get them to shut up.

"Ouch," Mike then grimaced, as if feeling your pain, asking tentatively, " She doesn't want to be "just friends" does she?"

"No, nothing like that," you said, shaking your head, your problem being the exact opposite, "I get the feeling she wants to be a lot more than friends."

"Well that's awesome news, dude! That's exactly what you wanted," Mike enthusiastically grinned as he took a bite from his burger, little realizing that there was a lot more too it than that. His girlfriend however was a little more perceptive, agreeing with Mike's sentiment, "Yeah, it is," before adding much more inquisitively, "So why are you acting all spaced out then? Don't you like her anymore or something?"

This was slightly harder to explain (especially without giving away the whole 'Emily is a were-lizard who basically raped you' thing), and so doing your best, you somewhat awkwardly stuttered, "No, it's not that...not really. It's...well it's complicated," hoping that perhaps this would suffice.

Mike was quick to jump in again, telling you with his mouth half full, "Doesn't seem complicated to me, Ryan. You like her and she likes you. It's perfect. You guys are totally meant for each other," adding, as a somewhat running joke he'd constantly been making for the last few weeks, "So quit moping and lets get arranging that double date already!"

Clara seemed to concur with this, telling you, "I've got to admit, as much as I hate agreeing with my idiot boyfriend, Mike is right. You guys are great together. So what it is that's stopping you?"

"It's kind of hard to say. It's just something that happened recently. I kind of got a glimpse of her in a...a different light, and I'm not really sure I liked what I saw."

"Wow. Why? What did she do?" Mike asked, his interest peeking, clearly expecting a bit of juicy gossip.

"Nothing!" you quickly replied, realizing what Mike was after but not wanting to give it to him (even though what had actually happened was way more freaky than anything he could possibly imagine). Receiving a disbelieving glance from Clara, very much aware that this wasn't exactly the truth, you then told them, picking your words very carefully, "I mean, yeah it was something. But it wasn't something she meant, or wanted to do...it was just something that kind of happened."

"Cryptic much?" came Mike's response, looking rather lost, his girlfriend wearing a similar expression.

"Ryan, I'll be honest, I don't have a clue what you're talking about," she began, looking you straight in the eyes and using that 'Clara knows best' kind of voice that she always had when giving you advice, "But it sounds to me like you're getting all hung up over one tiny little insignificant thing that wasn't even her fault." Though the 'not being her fault' part was certainty true, you had to draw the line at the whole 'insignificant' part; turning into an 8 foot lizard hardly being what you'd consider insignificant (though you supposed Clara had no way of knowing that). "I mean if you like each other, does that really matter?" she continued, speaking some truth, "Does what she did or didn't do really make all that much difference if you guys have fun together?"

Thinking about this, you could definitely see some logic, having really strong feelings for Emily that went way beyond what she looked like, or even what she'd done. The whole lizard monster thing not being able to change that. "Hm, no. I guess not..."

"Exactly," Mike butted in, giving you his two cents worth, in his usual less than subtle way, "You and Em are an awesome couple. Nearly as awesome as me and Clara here. You really need to stop over thinking things dude and just do what feels right."

"Yeah. Why'd you think I wound up with him instead of a normal boyfriend?" Clara laughed, giving her boyfriend a prod.

"Hey! I'm normal!" he laughed back.

"Barely."

"Yeah!" you said, realizing that what they were telling you was true; that your feelings for Emily hadn't really changed at all. You still though of her as the most amazing, awesome, cute and funny girl you'd ever met, even if she did transform into a horrible beast, she was still that very same girl you were crazy about, just as she'd been telling you over and over. You couldn't just throw that away, could you? Not when there was even the slightest chance that the two of you could make a go of it. Certainly you knew it wouldn't just happen over night, and deep down you were still somewhat terrified of that giant monster that lived inside. But if you had to, you could get past it. You did lose your virginity to her after all, and that, as well as being unbelievably terrifying, was also kind of...special. Wasn't it?

Deciding that it was, and that you weren't quite ready to give up on you and Emily's relationship just yet, you put down your knife and fork and told your friends, "You know what, you guys are right!"

"Of course we are," Mike grinned, taking another bite from his burger, as you then stood up, said goodbye to the both of them and went off to find Emily, feeling that there was no time like the present, desperately wanting to share with her what you'd just this minute realized.
15133211111111111111.title: You come to a decision

151332111111111111111.content:
Not spotting her anywhere in the cafeteria and recalling that she either always went out for lunch or brought something with her and sat outside to eat it (the two of you having done that on quite a few occasions these last few weeks), you headed out the door and down the hallway.

Reaching the main entrance, you went outside, stopping briefly to ask a few juniors if they'd seen Emily about the place, and finding much to your surprise that they didn't actually know who she was (clearly not having made as big an impression on her classmates as she had on you). Heading then around the back of the building towards the art department, where there was a few tables and chairs, expecting perhaps that Emily might sit out there, you turned the corner and too your surprise suddenly came face to face with the very person you were after, almost running into her in the process.

"Oh, he-hey," she said, clearly a little shocked to see you soon, but flashing you a smile as she looked up from the book she was reading and (rather adorably) pushed her long bangs out of her face.

Smiling back, no longer quite so on edge around her as you had been, you replied, "Hi, I uh, I was hoping to bump into you...", taking a deep breath, to compose yourself, not wanting everything that was now running through your head to all splurge out at once.

"Heh. You almost did...bump into me, that is," Emily, nervously giggled.

Giggling a little awkwardly yourself, you then told her, "Listen, Emily. I've been doing some thinking and, I, uh, I think we should...um," scratching nervously at the back of your neck as you noticed all the other students around, "...maybe go somewhere a bit more private?"

"Sure. Yeah. Of course," Emily agreed, happy by the mere fact you were talking with her again.

"Great."

Heading off towards a quieter, less public spot by the football bleachers, neither of you really saying a word until you got there, you then turned to Emily and told her, letting you feeling gush out, "Okay, so I know we only spoke this morning, but I haven't been able to stop thinking about what you said and...and about us, and I know I told you that I don't know how I feel about your anymore, but that...that's not really true."

As soon as you said this, Emily's eyes widened and you could almost hear a little gasp of joyous anticipation escape her lips. This didn't stop you from continuing on however, needing to get this all out in the open as quickly as you could, telling her, "It's taken me some time to realize it after all the crazy stuff that happened, but I like you too Emily. I really do. I don't think I've ever felt this way about anyone before. I know it's all pretty messed up and stuff, and I'd be lying if I tried to tell you that I wasn't totally freaked out by what happened, y'know...back in your room. But I believe you when you say it wasn't your fault and you didn't mean for it to happen."

Pausing then for breath, having finally gotten to the part you'd been hurriedly racing to get to, before your nerves took you, you looked Emily directly in the eyes and said, "So I was wondering if maybe we could try and give things another go."

"Really?" she beamed, looking like she was about to jump for joy, her mouth widening into a smile as she replied, "Yes! Of course!" adding immediately after, "I mean, if you're sure that is..."

"I am. I mean, I'm still a little uneasy about the whole were-lizard thing, but I like you too much to let that get in the way," you explained, flashing her a smile and holding out your hand towards hers, "So it might, y'know, take a little while for me to get used to that whole aspect, but I do want to make you and me work. I want you to be my girlfriend."

Taking your hand and wrapping her small, delicate fingers around it, Emily reiterated this thought, happily telling you, "And I want you to be my boyfriend," before suddenly throwing her arms around you and hugging you tight, dropping her book in the process. "Oh, Ryan, you don't know how glad I am!" she said, breaking from the embrace, "And don't worry, I don't expect you to just get used to it just like that. And if you have any questions or anything, things you want to know or find out, then I'll tell you. I'll let you know everything. I don't want to keep anymore secrets from you."

Happy to hear this (as well as briefly feeling Emily's small body against yours again), you told her, "Okay, good. Cause I think that might be the best place to start; finding out everything."

"Of course. What do you want to know?" she asked.

"Well maybe we shouldn't talk about it here. There's too many people around, and I imagine it'd probably be best if I was sitting down for some of it."

"Sure. After school then? We can go somewhere. Back to your house, or mine..."

"I was thinking more like now," you interrupted, feeling like you really couldn't wait that long, having so many questions and things to ask, "You know, just skip the rest of class. I kind of feel this whole thing is more important right now anyway."

Emily looked a little unsure for a moment, no doubt worrying about actually skipping school (being such a responsible and studious person after all), before deciding 'to hell with it' and replying, "Okay. Let's do it. Let's skip school," adding with a giggle, "I've never actually done that before."

With this now decided and Emily on board, all you had to do was work out where exactly you should head to once you did; your house or hers?
151332111111111111111.title: Locating Emily

1513321111111111111111.content:
"Crap! My mom's not working today, so we won't be able to go back to my house," you said, remembering what she'd told you this morning about "finally being able to get some cleaning down in that pit of a room of yours", what with you no longer playing sick and locking yourself in all day.

"Well we could always go back to mine. My parents are always out during the day," Emily replied warily, clearly concerned for your feelings as she did, "...if, I mean, if that wouldn't be, you know, too weird for you or anything."

Admittedly she was right to be, her place; her bedroom to be precise, being where you first saw the monster...that other part of Emily. After what had happened there, after what it...what she had done to you, you realized you probably had every right to be wary of going back to her house; it being the site of a very, terrifying and traumatic experience for you. That being said, it was just a house, and it was just a bedroom. If you could forgive Emily for what she'd done to you and leap over that great hurdle, then surely returning to the scene of the crime couldn't be all that scary (not when said crime scene had pink walls and cute little teddy bears everywhere).

"No, it's okay," you assured her, "Let's go to yours then."

"Okay. If you're sure."

"Yeah, it's fine. Totally fine. Now c'mon! We'd better get out of here before the bell goes."

And so, sticking out your hand, Emily gladly took it, flashing you a smile which you returned, indicating finally after all the many strange and horrifying things that occurred, that the two of you were now boyfriend and girlfriend. Heading quickly through the school gates, feeling a rush of excitement as you did (having of course bunked school once or twice before with Mike, but never like this, never hand in hand with a girl), the two of you headed off down the street towards Emily's home, avoiding as best you could any talk about her condition or what had happened, wanting to leave all those questions until you actually got there, and instead chatting a little awkwardly about some of your classes and the day at school so far.

When you did reach Emily's house, you did indeed feel a strange sort of chill as you entered, almost subconsciously recalling every detail from that Saturday afternoon when you'd ran out the door in a panic, and noticing this, Emily asked, "Ryan? Is everything okay?"

"Yeah, fine. Everything's cool," you replied, snapping out of your daze, aware that if you and Emily were going to work, you were going to have to be able to walk into her house without turning into a blubbering mess, reminding yourself that you were with her now, not the monster.

Heading then into Emily's cute, girly bedroom, you again felt the same sensation (especially when you spotted the scratches and scuff marks on the walls - realizing now what exactly had made them), but quickly shook it out, instead focusing on the fact that Emily's flattened bed had been replaced by a new one. Mentioning this to her, she explained that her dad had bought her a new one after she'd convinced him that it had collapsed from her jumping around on top of it, looking exceptionally guilty as she did. It appeared that these sort of things happened quite a lot; her bed being destroyed, her clothes torn to pieces, large chunks being taken out of the walls when she transformed and her inherent clumsiness went a long way to explaining a lot of it (the fact that her parents would never believe in a million years that their sweet, studious daughter was also a 8 foot rampaging lizard beast going the rest of the way).

Sitting down on bed while Emily pulled out the chair from under her desk and turned it around to face you, you looked at each other for a few seconds before deciding to get down to business and ask the literally hundreds of questions that had been filling up your head ever since you had first discovered that Emily was a were-lizard, and after what she had told you this morning.

"So what do..." you both started to say, causing the two of you to let out an awkward giggle, before Emily graciously let you go first.

"Heh. Thanks," you smiled, thinking over what would be the best question to actually ask, your head being filled with so many. Coming quickly to a decision, you then said, "I guess the first thing I want to know is are you still like, y'know...you, when you change? When you become a were-lizard? Or is it like a separate being or something?"

"No, it's still me. It's all still me."

"But last week, in here...what happened..." you replied, somewhat confused by this answer. The thing that had forced you to have sex with it certainly not appearing in any way like the Emily you knew.

"That...that was still me," Emily told you, dipping her head again in shame. "Only I wasn't really in control of my actions." She'd mentioned this not being in control thing before, and although you hadn't really known what it had meant, you had of course assumed that the monster part of her was kind of like another entity living inside her, and that with practice she had learnt to repress, so what she told you next, as she raised her head and looked back up at you again came as quite a surprise. "It happens when I don't initiate the transformation and when a strong emotion takes hold," she explained, blushing a little again and confessing, "I just really wanted to kiss you so bad, and I'd been repressing it for so long, that when it finally happened...things got a little out of control.

"You see I've never actually had a boyfriend before, because I've always feared that if I did, if any boy actually liked me enough to go out with me, then well, what happened would happen."

This all took a moment to process, mouthing, "Jesus," at both the revelation that the 'control' she had mentioned seemed to refer to an ability to transform at will, as well as the fact that she had known fine well that dating you would end up with her turning all lizard (the not having had a boyfriend before bit being something you had already guessed, though not for this reason of course). "But then why did you even agree to go out on that date with me in the first place, if you thought that?"

"Well, in all honesty, that wasn't exactly my idea. My friend Caitlin, she kind of pushed me into it," Emily said, very much confirming the thought you'd had sitting at that table, waiting for her to arrive on that initial date. "She pointed you out one day in school when you and Clara and her boyfriend were in the cafeteria and she asked if I thought you were cute, and well...eh...I guess you know what my answer was. I never actually imagined she'd ever set us up on a date. But she did; her and Clara did. I told her I didn't want to go and tried to get out of it, but she wouldn't let me. She even came over to my house just to drive me to the restaurant to make sure I went. I think she must have felt sorry for me, seeing as I didn't really have any other friends but her. As well as rather foolishly admitting that I'd never had a boyfriend before either."

"That's kind of funny. My friend's pushed me into it too," you told her, finding this ironic, "Though I didn't even know what you looked like."

"...Or what you were letting yourself in for."

"I guess that's why you were so quiet and standoffish at the start," you then added, figuring that made sense now too.

"Yeah. I just wanted to get it over and done with so I could tell Caitlin I went and it didn't work out," Emily admitted, looking a little uncomfortable as she explained this, her face every so often breaking into a nervous smile, "I so wanted to not like you, but well...I did. I really did. I probably shouldn't have given you my number, but I'd never felt that way about anyone before, I was too wrapped up on how cool and funny and great company you were that I wasn't really thinking about what might happen. Then as things progressed, I convinced myself I could hide my 'condition', repress it so that you'd never know. Just so long as I didn't let my emotions get the better of me. Which they of course eventually did."

"Wow, that must have been tough..." you began to say, stopping yourself and letting out an awkward chuckle (not wanting to appear big headed), "Heh. That is, I mean, not tough cause I'm so irresistible or anything, tough because..."

This also made Emily giggle. "Hee-hee. It's okay, I get what you mean. And yeah, sometimes it was. But I felt like you were worth it."

"So do you only transform then when that happens, when you get emotional or whatnot?" you then asked, getting back to what she had mentioned before about 'initiating' transformations, curious to know if it meant what you thought it had, asking delicately, "Or do you change other times as well...y'know, like when you want to?"

"Yeah, when I want to," she told you, flat out answering that question. "Usually the big emotional transformation don't happen all that often. I've gotten rather good at avoiding situations like...well like this. Though I do usually to transform three or four times a month when big ol' Lizardy Emily gets hungry. Sometimes I need to feed."

"Feed?"
1513321111111111111111.title: You go back to Emily's

choices: Emily tells you about what its like to be a were-lizard
Emily's enthusiasm gets too much and she once again transforms
15133211111111111111111.content:
Hearing this made you turn slightly white, having feared for your life when Emily had transformed on top of you, on this very same bed last Saturday, your first thought having been that she was going to eat you, and now from what she was saying, it seemed she may well could have.

"Yeah, you know, like any other kind of animal," Emily told you, ignoring the shocked look on your face for a moment as she proceeded to answer your question. "That's also when I'm not always 100% in control, so I usually choose to initiate the transformation myself and go out hunting. That way I get to decide whats on the menu and don't end up hurting anyone by mistake." This thankfully helped to return some of the color to your face, realizing that she hadn't meant 'feed on humans', though aware that it still might be a possibility, if she was indeed not in control all the time.

"Have...have you ever?" you nervously asked, needing to be sure. Having accepted that your girlfriend was a giant lizard monster, but not being quite sure you could accept her being a murderer and cannibal as well.

Her initial response didn't exactly fill you with much confidence however as she pondered, "I'm not really sure. Not that I know of. Though back when it first began, I wasn't in control at all and I sometimes had no clue what was happening when I changed. Anything could have happened then I suppose." Then seeing the look of worry on your face, realizing that her answer probably wasn't the most comforting, she quickly added to ease your mind, "But if I did, then I certainly never heard about it."

Realizing that this was probably the best you could hope for, Emily at least not consciously eating people (and you hoped not unconsciously either), you then moved the discussion on, not really wanting to dwell on such an unpleasant thought. "Then uh, what does, what does a were-lizard eat?" you asked her, this whole feeding and hunting thing suggesting she didn't simply raid the fridge or head out to the store.

"Uhm, you know...fish, mice, birds, raccoons, deer..."

"You eat deer and raccoons!?"

"Probably sounds pretty gross huh?" Emily asked, looking slightly embarrassed. "I guess it is. But when I'm in were-lizard form I don't really notice so much. I just eat whatever I can find," adding with an awkward little giggle, "Better than eating a person right?"

"Uh, yeah. Yeah, I guess it is," you replied, finding this all rather uncomfortable. The more you heard about Emily's life the weirder it all seemed to get (though to be honest, what else were you really expecting?)

Recognizing this on your face, Emily suddenly appeared rather distressed, throwing a hand over her mouth as she squeaked, "Oh God, this all must seem really horrible. Are you totally freaked out right now? I bet you are. I must sound disgusting!"

"No! No, you don't. Honestly," you told her, shaking your head, "You're not disgusting," realizing that as weird as all this was, the last thing you wanted was to make Emily feel bad, trying your best to comfort her, "It's just...just a lot to take in is all. A lot to get my head around. But its okay. I'm not freaked out."

It took a minute or two more for you to convince Emily of this, but eventually she relaxed and said, "Okay, if you're sure. But if you are weirded out and wanted to leave, don't worry, I won't judge you. I guess I am kind of a freak."

"Trust me, Emily, I'm not going to leave. And you're not a freak. You're awesome!" you assured the seemingly fragile little girl sitting before you, placing your hand on top of hers and staring into her soft green eyes, more than ever reminded of her incredible beauty, compassion and humanity, three of the traits that very much drew you to her. She may have the ability to turn into a giant 8 foot, super strong reptile, but underneath she was just the same as everyone else, and you weren't going to let her think for one moment that she was any less because of it. "You've just been dealt a rough hand in life and you're making the best of it," you continued, giving her hand a gentle squeeze, admitting, "Hell, if I was in your shoes I'm not sure I'd be able to cope so well. In fact I know I wouldn't!"

"Thanks," she smiled, your words seeming to have done the trick, as her worry quickly vanished and she gave your hand a squeeze in return. Parting again, and letting out an embarrassed little giggle for thinking that you might want to abandon her, she then sat up again in her chair and asked, "Is there anything else you wanna know about my condition?" getting back to the reason you were sitting here.

You of course had more questions than you could shake a stick at, and while you had started off with a lot of the logistical aspects, such as how she changed and why etc., what you really wanted to know now was, "What does it feel like when you transform. When you change into that thing...I mean, into a were-lizard?"

"You don't have to worry, Ryan, you can call me a 'thing' if you want to," Emily chuckled, referencing your little slip up, thankfully letting it fly, "And to answer your question, I'm not really sure how exactly to describe it. It kind of starts like with this like sort of warm, pulsating feeling beneath your skin that gradually grows stronger and stronger inside, until you can actually feel yourself start to stretching and your body getting bigger, with every single inch of muscle, skin and bone tightening and expanding at exactly the same time.

I didn’t know there was somebody else already sitting at this table. If you like I’ll...” “No,” said Jim. “No. That’s perfectly fine.” Jim was sweating because he saw the hippopotamus woman’s large and intimidating teeth as her mouth was opened. 152.content:
You were just walking along in the forest, thankfully a team of eco-activists had prevented it and the lake it surrounded from being destroyed. You walked to the lake the path you had worn into the grass felt familiar and the grass swayed side to side as a nice summer's breeze passed through the glade. You froze as you saw a girl sitting near the lake, it was strange as you had been visiting the place for a year now and seen no other people. Well you saw couples who knew of the lake so you'd just watch them for a minute or two slightly envious as they usually enjoyed a picnic near the lakeside. As you got closer you noticed she was some sort of foreigner as she was wearing a light almost sky blue kimono and there were small slatted wood sandals on her feet. She slowly stood up and turned to face you and your eyes met for a second her violet eyes which seemed to stare right through you.

She started to walk towards you and that's when you started to really observe her. She moved with the grace and elegance of someone who was brought up to be a wife. Her long knee length blonde hair flowed behind her. You realized she was slim yet tall as she got closer you realized even at 5ft 8 you probably only came about chest height to her. However one place she was not very small was her chest, it pushed against the kimono which barely seemed to contain what you guessed had to be some quite large DD breasts yet she walked like they were no hinderance what so ever. You didn't realize she was standing right in front of you till she gave off a small cough and you looked up slightly to meet her gaze.

"Hello" she says smiling.

"Hi" you reply your gaze locked on her violet eyes and she smiles again.

"What are you doing out here?" she asks.

You shrug "I just come out here for walks, it's quite peaceful" you reply.

She nods and turns around, seems to think for a second, then turns back "would you like to come to my home?" she asks.

You stare at her for a second "uh sure, if it's not far" you reply. She smiles again "not far at all" she replies, she starts to walk away and you follow her. A minute later the two of you enter a clearing where a very simple looking log cabin sat, now this was something you had definitley never seen before. She walks to the cabin and simply walks inside, you follow her into the cabin the door shutting ominously behind you and making you jump. "Must just be the wind" you think to yourself as you examine the cabin. It wasn't much, there was a small wood burning stove, a small sink with a counter, 2 small chests of drawers, a simple red rug, a single bed, and a small japanese style table complete with sitting cushions. The woman pulls out a small brass kettle and sets to work you assume making tea, she motions with a free hand for you to sit on one of the cushions so you do.

"So, who are you?" you ask.

"I'm Kyoko, my parents moved here from Japan, they wanted to live a simpler life, what with all the modernization that was going on" she replies. You nod and she turns to face you "it's polite to tell someone who you are after they answer you" she says.

"Oh, sorry, I'm Alex, I grew up in this area but I never saw this cabin and I've been visiting these woods for years" you say.

Kyoko takes the kettle off as it boils and pours tea into 2 cylindrical cups before setting one in front of you and sitting down puts her own down. You pick the glass of tea up and take a sip, it was wonderful, best tea you had ever had, although you weren't a big tea drinker. You felt something brush against your back and you thought it must have been her hair so you looked over and your mouth just dropped. Sticking out of her head were 2 large golden fox ears and out of some hole in the back of her kimono sprang 9 long golden tails each tipped with white. Kyoko turned and stared at you "what's wrong?" she asks, you can't answer you just point at her back, she turns and notices the tails and sighs.

Standing up she says "it's as you see, I am a fox demon, I didn't lie when I said my parents moved here, but we were trying to escape, from those who wanted us dead" she says her voice sounding sad for a second. She takes your cup and hers and puts them in the sink then just stands there, "the door is just over there, you can leave, just like all the others" she says. Kyoko didn't start crying or anything she just stood there, her ears and tails drooped to the point where her ears were pressed against her head and the tips of her tails were dragging against the wooden floor. You just sat there for a second, I mean it wasn't like the ears and tail had changed Kyoko's personality, it wasn't like now you knew she was a fox demon she was suddenly trying to kill you. You slowly stood up and walked over to her and hugged her from behind, Kyoko turned around and you got a faceful of cleavage for a second before she lifted your chin up with 1 long finger.

Her violet eyes glowed slightly now as she just stared down at you "your not scared?" she asks.

"Should I be?" you reply. A smile played over Kyoko's lips and suprising you she hugged you your head landing back in her cleavage.

"Thank you" she whispers lowering her head so her cheek rested on your head. You tapped her arm and she looked down and let you go your breath escaping in a loud "pwahh" as you took in another breath. Kyoko smiles and walks over to the small table and sits on one of the pillows before patting the other, you walk over and sit down. She looks at you fro a few seconds before simply asking "why?"

"Why what?" you reply.

"Why didn't you run away? Why are you still here?" she asks.

You shrug "does knowing your a fox demon suddenly make you evil?" you ask. Kyoko shakes her head vigorously "we aren't evil......just mischevious" she says. You nod "So there's your answer, your still you even if I know your a fox demon, plus the ears and tails are quite cute" you say. Kyoko breaks out into an ear-to-ear smile and she grabs your hand and quickly stands up pulling you with her. She then runs outside and despite the fact that it was perfectly sunny you swear you felt...rain. Kyoko just smiles at you and before you could react she kisses you her tails wrapping around you holding you in place. You were too shocked to do anything for a second before you decided to just go with it and kissed Kyoko back. Kyoko broke the kiss and she smiled "you know when it rains on a sunny day it's called a fox's wedding" she says. You nod slowly and you were startled as she turned around her tails suddenly filling your view "could you please, kiss them?" she asks. You just stared at the tails for a second before cupping 1 in both hands and kissing the tip, you did the same with the 8 other tails and Kyoko turned around and smiled.

Suddenly the rain stopped as Kyoko lowered herself to the ground in a kneeling position and then laid her hands on the grass and lowered her head "please take care of me" she says. You had only seen this pose in manga and it left you stunned as Kyoko raised her head "I might be inexperienced but I'll do my best to take care of you" she says smiling.

Shaking off the rain I stepped in further, looking about curiously. This didn't look like a natural cave, more like one of those tourist things. You know, 'See the deepest cavern in Texas!' or something. The floor had been smoothed out, I didn't see any little stones or debris anywhere and the place looked fairly light and breezy... though curiously I couldn't find any lights. Glancing around, frowning as further searching still reveals no lamps or ceiling lights despite the bright interior I headed in through the first chamber via a smaller passageway, just a few feet long.

Now it was obvious. Tables and chairs are a bit of a giveaway for some place to be organized, and pretty well too.

"Neat. Literally. Well laid out too." I muttered to myself seeing a set of shelves on the far wall with cans on them, a refrigerator nearby, and a largish table with three kitchen chairs around it.

"I try. Nice to be appreciated certainly."

The sudden voice nearly made me jump out of my skin, especially coming, as it did, from right behind me.

"JEEZE! Don't do that Lady. You nearly scared me... half... to...." my voice and brain ground to a halt as I turned to see who had spoken.

I truly was not expecting that she would be naked... though it wouldn't exactly matter... maybe. The scales covering her may leave little to the imagination but they covered pretty well her... oh, I guess that WAS her skin. She was maybe a little over six foot tall, very well proportioned, green, covered in large, heavily overlapping scales on her back and the outside of her arms, and small, smooth scales on her front, inside of her arms and face. And her face was... interesting. She looked like half way between a human and a snake (no hair though), but with two short horns behind two angular, almost horse like ears. No matter how reptilian her face looked though her expression was blatantly exasperated.

"Uh huh." She said tiredly. "And now is the bit where you scream, attempt to kill me, or run into a wall."

I blinked.

"Why?" I said, still attempting to get my brain in gear. No reason I shouldn't be polite though. "...Miss... or is it missus?"

Her expression softened a bit and her lip curled in a faint smile.

"Miss thank you, and the name is Olive. Pleased to meet you...?" She said, holding out a dainty, though clawed, hand.

"Oh, Peter. My name's Peter." I said, taking her hand in a firm grip and was somewhat surprised that her hand was warm, "I'm afraid I'm a bit lost. I was with a tourist forest trek party and got left behind. It was kinda badly organized. Heaven only knows who would let the party spread out like that in the middle of the forest like this!"

"Yeah, you never know, you could run into a dragon or something."

And at that she flexed wings I hadn't noticed as they'd been furled behind her back and head, and flapped them briefly. They were rather large wings, almost filling the chamber, and I blinked as the wind gusting in my face for a moment.

"Um. Yeah. Guess so. Mind you, wouldn't be too bad a thing now would it?"

Olive paused, squinting at me cautiously.

"Depends on how much you enjoy being eaten I guess."

I blinked. Did she just say?

"So...." I managed, fear now starting to creep into my voice. "... you're going to eat me?"

You: Findley Kimbro, an undistinguished high school student; you're not smart, strong, or socially inclined. You get along well with everyone, but you're mostly a cipher - a very pale and seemingly undernourished cipher. Your wardrobe tends to black Converse hightops, black jeans, button-down Oxford shirts, and a gray canvas duster. You've also got photochromic teashades and a Severus Snape haircut; despite your distinctive look, distinctiveness has eluded you.

Her: Cindi Charlote Folger, a transfer student from... elsewhere. She's clearly made out of chocolate, though the particular mix varies with her mood. In your estimation, she has an engaging personality and is strikingly cute, but she's not without her bittersweet moments. She's 'naked', as is traditional for humanoid slimes, so her wardrobe really consists of her hairstyle, which could charitably be dubbed a sprung chignon. Despite her perky, quirky nature, Ms. Folger nevertheless finds herself in a cliqueless condition and winds up matching your own social orbit... to both of your benefits, certainly?

155332122222211.content:
"That's Charlote, with one 't'!" the girl says, and you wince for her. She's not reading the mood of the class she's introducing herself to, both the monsters and humans starting up a low whisper of scandalized derision in their various groups. "This is the first time my family's been able to openly mingle with the human population, but we've actually been earthplane adjacent for several centuries and served as the inspiration for all sorts of culinary..."

She carries on, oblivious, and your eye's drawn back to her 'nissy' - the normalization identity sticker that, under the dictates of the Pax Terata of 2012, all newly-arrived monsters on earth need to provide on request to prove that they're conforming to law and not ready to go on a rampage against humans. The thing is, it's considered really bad form to wear it openly if you're a monster, and she doesn't know that yet. So all the other monsters are snickering at her.

What got your attention is that her nissy has a big AC-XD origination designator on it... Artificial Construct, Extradimensional. Does that mean her home dimension's been manufactured and isn't a naturally occurring phenomenon like every other 'dimension' you've ever heard of? You're not geeky enough to grasp all the ramifications of that, but it seems cool.

"Thank you, Ms. Folger," says Mr. Chatterton, the xenosociology teacher. "That's a first-rate introduction, and I'm certain we all wish you well here at ATIC." He'd been charmed, which further doomed the new kid; don't ever charm the teachers.

She's moving back your way, still not getting it... smiling and quietly greeting the other students, who mostly ignore her, roll their eyes, or respond with snide congeniality. You've got the back of the long row because you go unnoticed - does anyone even know there's an extra desk back here? She winds up at the end of the row next to yours, ahead and to your right. She greets you and sits down before you can do much more than pop your hand up in a quick wave. She's gregarious, but socially obtuse. And she smells nice. Hmmm...

*

A week later, you can see Cindi's not holding up well. She's ditched her nissy, but the light's gone out of her eyes. Artesia Teton's not her kind of town and she'd probably never in her chocolatey life figured she'd wind up attending an 'internodal comprehensive' - fancy talk for a regular high school that includes monsters, which hadn't existed when you were still in middle school.

There weren't monsters when you were in middle school, except in games and movies and stuff. The Rupture changed all of that in a hurry, and ushered out a whole lot of humans as well. Artesia Teton had done OK, isolated without being too isolated, but you were still down an aunt and a few cousins. Most of the monsters who'd shown up locally seemed nice enough, and life had more or less gotten back to what it had been within a couple semesters. You hadn't thought it might be nice to have monsters around until Cindi showed up.

She'd arrived as a sweet, light brown, milk chocolate and was now shading to black, utterly aloof. She'd sat cross-legged on arrival, and now had both feet primly on the floor. The indifferent bun on the back of her head with all the chocolate tufts sticking out was now serpentine, mechanical, and not a 'hair' out of place. She'd become stiff and bitter, like baking chocolate, and that's what a bad week could do to you, sometimes.

The fact is, you've taken an interest in Cindi since she's become an outcast. It couldn't have happened any other way, because you'd never have had a chance with someone who wasn't an untouchable. The girls don't like her because she'd come off as goofy and unconventional that first day. The guys don't like her because, well... to put it politely, even though she's naked, she's missing some interesting bits. The monsters don't like her because they don't think something that's a dessert can be a proper monster.

So you take the direct route, passing her a note that says, simply enough, "I like you!" Not one of the great romantic lines of all time, but you think she needs something unambiguous.

1553321222222111.content:
After the note, there's the expected awkwardness as Cindi gauges your intentions. You talk between classes, then settle on a mutual lunchtime routine, and start generally hanging out the following week. She comes over to your house and meets your mom, which is an acid test: your mom's quite friendly to Cindi and enthusiastic at your bringing a friend home, which surprises you... given that her sister and nieces were devoured by a monster a little over a year ago. Of course, excepting her constituent matter and slimy pedigree, Cindi's pretty much a regular girl.

Cindi's also becoming a regular visitor at your place after school, though she has no interest at all in video games and tends to prefer helping your mom with dinner. Odd, because as far as you know, she doesn't eat - meeting at lunch means she talks and watches you eat. She's an excellent cook, but there are many elements of her life that don't bear further scrutiny: what she subsists on, where she lives, her family, stuff like that. You've been wise enough to pick up on the topics she's vague about and then steer clear of them.

It turns out that, while she's fantastic at cooking and likely as accomplished at math (better than you, stated simply), she's terrible with written languages. You've got enough going in that department that you're actually able to help her, which feels weird; you've never been academically gifted, and the idea that you could be useful in this regard is almost shocking.

Eventually, the day comes when you're sick of grinding through trig homework and Cindi's had her fill of Dostoyevsky, and you have to ask her something.

"Cindi, why is it that..." you begin, having to break off and point at her belly button.

"I wondered when you'd bring that up," she says, grinning. At least she's not sensitive about it. "Why am I not complete, as a human girl my age would be? Viscomorphs reproduce differently than humans, naturally, but that raises the question: since there was no placenta or umbilical cord involved in my creation, why do I have a navel?"

The fact that she's not great at reading doesn't mean she's dumb. You nod, suddenly consumed with the hope that Cindi will let you touch her there. You've had some slightly more than friendly feelings toward her for the past week, but you'd been very careful to keep them concealed. Force of habit.

"The simple answer is, it's tradition," she continues, noticing you're staring at her belly button. She doesn't seem to mind. "Humans and..."

"...choco sapiens," you supply, smirking.

"Humans and slimes have enjoyed a symbiotic relationship for a very long time in other corners of the omniverse, and so humanoid slimes had to adopt mammalian characteristics... since humans don't usually become amorphous. It's sort of like, what do you call it... Wasmannian mimicry. Bipeds are evolutionarily more likely to become tool users, and as embarrassing as it is to admit, slimes are typically free riders, so..."

You can't help yourself, reaching out to give her a Pillsbury poke. She breaks off from her involved belly button explanation to draw her arms up and grin, allowing you access and giving a convincing Doughboy giggle that ends with an "Eeeeek!" of feigned surprise. You collapse into laughter as she regards you with a "boys will be boys" smile of forbearance.

You've touched Cindi before - hesitantly at first, afraid your hand would come away covered with chocolate, which hadn't been the case - and she feels more or less like a human girl. A little warmer and a lot smoother, but not completely unfamiliar. That aside, a poke at her middle represents a more intimate form of contact than you've ever attempted before, and you're not sure how she'll take it.

"My turn," she says, once you've composed yourself. She's smiling, but she means it. "Untuck that shirt, Finn, so I can see where to aim."

If Cindi blushes, you have no way of knowing - sometimes her well-defined but molten eyes will soften out of their usually sharp detail, but she doesn't change color. You're not so lucky and, red-faced, have to flap your hand to apologize for taking the liberty of a navel-poke, suddenly too shy to talk.

"Yeah, right," she says, not about to let you off the hook that easily. With a look of eager mischief, she starts untucking your shirt for you, which tickles. So you tickle her back, and stop at once in surprise. She's ticklish?! Why? More of that slimy what's-it mimicry?

Then follows a spirited contention never before seen in your bedroom: a tickle-wrestling bout with a girl you're not related to. You know she could trounce you if she wanted, but Cindi plays fair and behaves like a human female - with perhaps a little more strength than a girl her size would be expected to possess.

After nearly two minutes of give-and-take, your mom comes in to chide you for your rambunctiousness. Cindi has the grace to apologize, still as winded as you are (you're not sure if she actually breathes or just provides a reasonable imitation), and your mom chuckles indulgently before walking back out. Well, why not? It's not comparable to a human boy and girl in the same circumstance, where the girl might potentially get herself in trouble following a cease-fire. Of course, your mom probably wouldn't appreciate that line of reasoning.

You both try to return to what you were doing, which is almost impossible; you're useless for polar conversions, and she can't focus on Raskolnikov.

"I've got a secret, I've got a secret," you sing to Cindi at a whisper. "Cindi Charlote's... ticklish!"

"Omigod, tell no one!" she responds, eyes wide as she completely unspools her hair into a finger-in-socket fright wig - before stepping out to help your mom with dinner. At least she left you laughing.

*

Things proceed between the two of you in much this way, with perhaps a little less roughhousing when your mom's around. In fits and starts, you enter the fuzzy territory between 'friends' and 'girlfriend/boyfriend'.

With (as might be expected) the requisite complications...
