15533212222221111.content:
It's a few days before the Homecoming dance, and a new student is introducing himself in xenosociology.

"Tauber!" he says, squawking it out. He looks like Pac-Man as done by Bosch, a hovering sphere with a mouth, shiny blue metal under layers of patchy, translucent pink, organic membranous... stuff. Just big enough to swallow a good-sized human. "From Kappa Uku, world of matter-eaters! We eat and eat and transmute matter to energy with admirable efficiency! We will solve this planet's waste and power issues!"

Mr. Chatterton's not able to keep this guy chatting beyond his matter-eater pitch, and Tauber eventually floats to the back of the class on the far side of the room. He can't very well sit at a desk. There are classrooms that have been specially modified to accept other monstrous forms, but Tauber's the first non-humanoid monster in your x-soc period.

"Hi!" Cindi whispers once he's settled, smiling and waving. She still remembers her own first day and wants to provide more of a welcome than the other students managed. Tauber had been roundly ignored, but didn't seem to care.

You notice he's got small black eyes above his mouth. These blink twice as he pivots toward Cindi, rotates back, and then swivels again in a perfect double take.

"Chocolate girl!" you hear him mutter to himself. It's good to know he has some voice other than that unappealing squawk.

There's a vid today on the cultural achievements of the Stippleboom, so the lights dim to allow for forty minutes of messing about. Except it's actually interesting, and you wind up paying attention.

You see something out of the corner of your eye - a long tongue of segmented blue metal is slowly projecting from Tauber's mouth, the tip of it aiming for Cindi. In good spirits these days, she's back to sitting tailor style, so the sole of her left foot is perfectly aligned for a rendezvous with Tauber's gleaming yahzick.

"Hey..." you start to hiss at Tauber, just as Cindi claps both hands over her mouth to stifle an explosive shriek of laughter. Without turning around, she chops her left arm in your general direction, making a furious and unmistakable gesture of "IXNAY!" You've maybe been playing intemperately on that particular weakness of hers lately, but that doesn't mean you want Pac-Man shrimping your girlfriend.

Tauber draws his tongue back in complete silence, so quickly you don't even see it retract. Given the sudden wobbliness in what's been his otherwise uneventful levitating act, you think he must be going into raptures over the way Cindi tastes. Come to think of it, you haven't even gotten a chance to try that yet. You sit out the period, seething, and miss any opportunity to harsh out Tauber; he's through the door before anyone else, a sphere on a mission.

"Don't do that in class, Finn!" Cindi says, giving you a playful shove out in the hallway. You stumble back a little and roll your eyes.

"That wasn't me! It was a giant metal tongue! You can't tell the difference? It was that new guy, just licking away! Licking and licking to his heart's content, the dirty..."

"It was a single lick, don't exaggerate," Cindi says, looking thoughtful. "No saliva, either. It felt like a finger, sorry. I should have known you wouldn't be that assertive with everyone else around. Maybe it's a matter-eater pleasantry, since I was the only one who was nice to him. Why haven't you ever tried it?"

"I'm not up for anything dirty like that!" you mutter, cutting your eyes away as Cindi beams at you. Of course, Cindi can't get dirty if she doesn't want to; she'd told you that slimegirls reflexively manifest 'preclusive cohesion', meaning they keep other stuff from sticking to them and maintain their immaculate composition. Cindi could go dancing in a charnel house or a manure pile and still emerge squeaky clean. Well, squeaky-chocolatey. And was she actually inviting you to Taub out on her? Or... wait, was she giving you a hard time for not being nice to a new student and not talking about foot-tonguing at all?

Cindi lays off with her grin once she sees you're blushing.

"That's OK, Finn. I know you're more into the vanilla stuff."

Before you can reply to that, Tauber's back. The hallway has been emptying out, and the bell rings. But the matter-eater's blocking your way, and it looks like a school librarian has affixed a projection bud to the side of his metal/membrane shell. The bud flickers on, and a holo of the Lusus Lexipendium appears before the three of you, greatly magnified. You've been studying it in x-soc, of course: a compilation of the laws governing human/monster interaction, a work in progress being tirelessly translated into all human and monster languages. Most people just call it 'The Bean'. Tauber's pointing out a particular section that seems to deal with monster/monster relations.

"It's Greek to me," says Cindi, shrugging. "Or is it Latin? No, OK, that's definitely English."

"Hang on, that can't be right," you say. But it seems to be: the relevant passage indicates that anything generally considered food on any world hosting a (the word makes no sense, but it's obviously a reference to the proper name of Tauber's race) 'matter-eater' shall be delivered upon formal request by same as remuneration pursuant to... some legalistic mumbo-jumbo referencing a treaty that's not even a year old. You know some monsters were favored more than others when humans were pretty sure their entire species was going to get gobbled up, so this must be some sort of loophole.

"It is correct!" Tauber squawks. "By treaty, I claim... chocolate girl!" His mouth clangs open and shut three times in succession.

"I guess, technically, she's made out of food," you say, feeling weird. "But she's alive! You can't just eat a fellow sapient!"

"He wants to eat me?!" Cindi says, horrified. Just as quickly, she's curious. "I wonder what that would feel like?"

"Please submit to my completely legal appetite!" Tauber squawks. His mouth clangs open again, and his tongue drapes out. He looks sort of dopey. A closer look, and you can tell he's smitten. That one taste of Cindi must have really gotten to him.

"Tell you what," Cindi says, detaching her left leg below the knee and offering it to Tauber. It's still wiggling and kicking around, even as Cindi extrudes some more chocolate and forms a new limb.

"Hey!" you protest, seeing Cindi's old left leg land on Tauber's greedy tongue. He gobbles it right up - and then drops to the floor in a swoon!

"It's really not a big deal," Cindi tells you. "I couldn't even guess how many arms and legs I've given up since I was a kid. I've even been bitten in half a few times. What's wrong with sharing, Finn?"

"Choklit," Tauber whispers.

"Man!" you say, stunned that this sort of thing is legally allowed. Humans have all sorts of rules of conduct they have to follow when dealing with monsters, political correctness taken to a monstrous degree. You'd never have imagined monsters were held to such low standards amongst themselves.

And, of course, there's the unfortunate fact that seeing Cindi's wriggling gam and tootsie gobbled up that way had... promoted an effect on you. Which Cindi had noticed with a secret smile before you noticed her noticing, which would have been even more embarrassing.

The tardy bell rings, and the two of you make tracks before Tauber recovers from his epicurean ecstasy to...
15533212222221111.title: Enter the gourmand

choices: The barber shop: your hair needs some attention
Somewhere else: you're off for the rest of the day, have fun
155332122222211112.content:
You and Cindi both manage to get to your next class on time, while Tauber gets a tardy. Fortunately, he's not in your next class - and, unfortunately, neither is Cindi. Before lunch, you've got it on good authority that Tauber has lapsed into something like matter-eater lovesickness and is intent on swallowing Cindi whole at the next opportunity.

You skip out on trig (don't mind if you do!) and head for the school office, trying to bruit about that a student could very well be eaten before the end of the day. Shuffled between two vice principals and a guidance counsellor, you wind up talking to the NHL rep. Which isn't what you had in mind.

"Mr. Kimbro, there's actually very little we can do," she says, skimming through her own holo of The Bean while her other two sets of hands work an emery board between them with brisk efficiency. The nameplate on her desk has her as 'Roxy Grimaldi-Rossiter'. You've always had bad luck with the hyphenated surname chicks. "While I'll agree that the language in this particular bylaw needs attention, the matter-eater is within his rights to consume your girlfriend. She is your girlfriend, isn't she? Aww, that's so cute! [Ahem] The Non-Human Liaison office can't intervene, and would certainly lose any legal challenge resulting from an attempted intervention in this matter. Our hands are tied."

"Yeah," you reply, looking pointedly at Roxy's six arms. Monsters mostly live by the whole 'law of the jungle' concept, and it stands to reason there'd be a conflict of interest here. Roxy sighs to herself when she notices your expression. She actually looks like a pretty hot sorority pledge from a nearby college, if you can get around the extra arms.

"Well, why does she have to be made out of chocolate, anyway?!" Roxy asks, obviously annoyed that she can't do the right thing. You feel a little better at seeing this pang of conscience. "She's a slimegirl - couldn't she just be made out of slime? Preferably slime that's inedible by human standards? A chocolate slimegirl... it seems like gilding the lily to me."

Roxy takes a deep breath, all six hands together in a gesture of businesslike appeasement.

"Look, even if we can't advance an official agenda, administratively... why not just get her off-campus? I'll write up a pass for both of you, and maybe this matter-eater will eat something more memorable tonight... forget all about Ms. Folger by tomorrow. Worst case, she can transfer to another school." Roxy brings up a display showing that Cindi and Tauber aren't anywhere near one another, presently. Hmm. You didn't know they could track all monsters on campus like that, but it makes sense. "You can slip out before first lunch, and we'll play it by ear tomorrow morning... maybe give her a half-day study period or excuse her entirely until we come up with a resolution that doesn't involve her being scarfed like a Snickers bar. Is that acceptable?"

You know what happens if you go ballistic: you're human, and Roxy's a monster, and that would cause a stir in and of itself. Your best bet is to find Cindi and get the heck out of here... so you whip up an expression of assuaged reasonability with a frosting of contrition for throwing this in Roxy's lap and distracting her from her manicure. You get a pass for yourself and Cindi and are out the door of the admin office...

...almost in time. The bell for first lunch rings.

*

There's already a crowd outside the cafeteria, the noise drawing you there while you were making a beeline for Cindi's English class. Looking inside, you see Cindi go sprinting past the windows with Tauber a few paces behind. She seems to be taking it in stride, and Tauber's got something new stuck to his shell: a little bloop box putting out Pac-Man intermission music. It's almost classy.

You run in, fully prepared to deal with Roxy under less inviting circumstances once you do something unkind to Tauber.

"I talked to the NHL rep!" you shout over the sound of the audience. Everything goes quiet, Cindi and Tauber screeching to a halt on their next circuit to look your way. You realize it's all up to you, and have to ruin a great rescue by telling the truth.

"Uh... she says there's nothing she can do."

The intermission music and shouts start back up immediately, as does the chase. Cindi's much more graceful than Tauber, the matter-eater sideswiping chairs, tables, and people in his pursuit. You decide to maybe accidentally give him a kick on the way by, and he just as accidentally chomps off half of your Severus haircut when you do.

In a fury, you join the chase. Cindi looks back, sees you, smiles and waves. Tauber spins on his own axis, scowls, and spits your hair back in your face. You nearly stumble, but keep your feet and are gaining on Tauber when...

...tiring of the chase, Tauber shoots out that metal tongue of his with the speed of a chameleon, loops it around Cindi's waist, and drags her into his maw.

"GULP! says Tauber, with a corresponding "Eeeeek!" befitting a distressed damsel from Cindi.

Tauber then drops out of the air and starts rolling around spastically, transported by the lusciousness of an entire chocolate slimegirl.

"CHOCKLIT!" he squawks, and is pleased.

Now really in a rage, you try kicking the matter-eater... who promptly rolls on his involuntary way, landing you on your ass. The crowd goes wild and, at present, no one is offering any assistance - none of the teachers, none of the other adult employees. It's monster versus monster, and there are reasons aside from legality that this isn't attracting any disapproval.

Tauber has started to glow, and your heart breaks. He must have just completely disassembled Cindi and converted her to energy.

"Chock..." he starts to squawk again, and then shimmies around violently. A rill of chocolate sauce trickles out from his linear trap, and then a gout. His mouth's being forced open by chocolatey pressure, and his glow is becoming a full gleam.

"Help, help!" Tauber squawks out, now clearly having trouble. More chocolate jets forth as he opens his mouth to call for assistance. He's getting unhealthily bright, but there's still no heat. No one rushes to his aid, most probably feeling that he's getting his just deserts.

You're a little more helpful, thinking Cindi might have found a way to save herself. Tauber's got a transmission port in his back, and there's a ground station over near the steam tables the lunch ladies are clustered behind. Some monsters are robots, and they need to eat lunch, too - and since it's not considered uncouth, they can dump 'dirty power' in the same area.

With some effort, you manage to get Tauber rolling in the right direction and seat him over the ground flap. Connections automatically mate, and Tauber's overload radiance starts dimming down at once.

"Fudge my life!" Tauber gargles out, mournful face pointed at the ceiling. His mouth flies open, molten chocolate glurting all the way up to the sound tiles in a sticky fountain. His bloop box supplies the sound of a dead Pac-Man.

Cindi jumps out of this mess, looking pleased with herself.

"Finn!" she squeals. "I can't believe I did it!" She gives you a hug that almost cracks your ribs before checking on Tauber, who looks like he'll pull through (with the matter-eater equivalent of an Alka-Seltzer). Jubilant, Cindi whirls around to pick you up, handling you as though you're not much heavier than a box kite, and charges past the lunch ladies and through the kitchen, nipping out the back.

"Hey, what's going on here?" you ask, borne along in Cindi's superhumanly strong arms. Is this her actual strength, or something she picked up while on sabbatical in Tauber's innards? She avoids any possibility of onlookers by heading out the back parking lot and running down the middle of Atonicia Street, where there's fortunately no traffic.

"Sorry, got excited," she says, stopping to put you down gently on your feet. She's not out of breath, so maybe that answers a question you had several days ago. "I should calm down, first. How long until lunch is over?"

"Call it a little over twenty four hours from now," you say, breaking out the pass Roxy gave you earlier and smirking. You give Cindi a quick rundown on what you'd been up to before arriving at the cafeteria.

"Perfect!" Cindi shouts, hopping around in her eagerness to be somewhere else. And then she's cartwheeling around you, and then she's picked you up again and started running for...
155332122222211112.title: Chocoholiday

choices: "I have to go home and report on my Blooming. See you tomorrow, Finn!" [Smooch!]
"I haven't properly thanked you, so... got anything in mind, Finn?" [Wink-wink!]
1553321222222111121.content:
"OK, come on, I can walk for myself," you tell Cindi. She pulls up short at Small Street, putting you down and following as you head east. Bigtooth maples lining the sidewalk are dropping the red, yellow and orange of autumn all around you. Cindi grabs a falling leaf and regards it, suddenly mum.

"It's not that big of a deal," she says, before you can prompt her. "Any kid should be able to do it, but I couldn't before today. So you won't get why I'm both a little excited and ashamed. When I thought Tauber was actually going to eat me, I was able to Bloom. All I had to do was generate more than he could eat at one time. It was scary, but I'm also weirdly grateful. Something so simple, but I'd never managed to get the hang of it."

She demonstrates by pointing with her right index finger, and an impressive jet of chocolate sprays into the gutter. Leaves boat along on the sudden stream, until Cindi snaps her fingers and the syrupy stuff promptly vanishes.

"Huh," you say, only mildly surprised. The truth is, you already thought she could do something along those lines. "Didn't you spontaneously generate chocolate the other day when you fed Tauber your leg, though?"

"Yeah, but that got incorporated into my matrix," Cindi says, sounding a little pleased with herself again. "This is neutral mass. It's inert - the same substance as me, except not... well, alive. It's just plain old chocolate. Better than anything you could get off the shelf - don't get me started on the state of chocolate-making you humans have going - but I can't do much with it except blast it around. You know, like fat and sugar 'bloom' out of crummy chocolate and it gets all white? Similar, but without any of the crumminess."

"I get it," you tell her, smiling. "So you're a late Bloomer?"

She groans, claps a hand to her forehead, and Blooms all over you. You weren't expecting it and almost go down. The warm, liquid weight of the stuff is nearly dragging your clothes off, and you stagger to the leaf-choked verge before collapsing, shouting over the outrage as Cindi laughs at your condition. The truth is, you don't mind much - and then mind a lot less once Cindi, still laughing, tackles you from behind and forces you all the way down. After a bit of slipping and slithering, she winds up straddling you. Needless to say, the mildly crisp September afternoon's gone decidedly sultry.

"You kids get offa there!" an old woman shouts from her porch. It looks like she's trying to make sense of what she's seeing, and that doesn't stop once Cindi snaps her fingers to unBloom you and the immediate area. Cindi leads you off while, waving and smiling, she apologizes to the lady for the trespass. You straighten your clothes out, stealthily realigning your equipment at the same time. The urge to pounce right back on her is nearly overwhelming, but you keep it together and walk it off.

"Finn, that was sort of fun!" Cindi says, and you can tell she's teasing you. Of course it was!

"-GASP-!" you respond, flushed right to the roots of your half-haircut.

"All right, I'm sorry," she says, managing not to smile. "I was all excited earlier, so I thought you could use a dose. You deserve better after all of that in the cafeteria. And, by the way... my hero!"

Cindi presses up close and gives you a lungsucker of a kiss. You've traded pecks on the cheek before now, but this is the genuine article. Your first kiss, really. Again, you're so surprised that you can't offer more than passive participation, struggling to smooch back as fervently.

"Sorry again!" she says, pulling away after several moments. "I wanted to say thanks, but you look wound a little tight at the moment. I guess this wasn't the best place."

"For what it's worth, Cindi, I'll be remembering Small Street a long time from now," you tell her, dots swimming at the edge of your vision. The weight of desire is smothering, but you continue your little stroll and impress Cindi with your nearly supernatural restraint.

Small Street is just that: only six houses long, and then you're in the Mt. Pierron shopping center. It's changed slightly since the advent of monsters being everywhere, but it's still mostly the same little place you've known off and on through the years. It's not considered trendy to get your hair cut at a strip mall barbershop, but you like that there usually aren't many other people around. And no one today, by the look of it. Seeing the 'No Shoes, No Shirt, No Service' sign, Cindi discreetly forms a duplicate of your own outfit for herself. Skipping the duster, naturally.

"Mr. Kimbro," says Mr. Schooley, swinging a chair around for you. He's cut your hair since you were a kid. He greets Cindi politely, but doesn't seem fazed by a cocoa slimegirl stepping into his shop. She probably could have stayed naked. Looking around, you see a lot of new equipment to handle the monster clientele. Mr. Schooley just rolled right along with the changes. His hair's gone white, but he still looks like he should be in a Cassavetes flick.

"I can see you've had some trouble here," he says, getting the cutting cape on you after you've hung up your duster and sat down.

"I'm going to have a look next door," Cindi says, smiling and stepping out. You smile yourself and frown. What's she going to do at the beauty shop? Offer her chignon as a complimentary appetizer?

*

You tell Mr. Schooley about Cindi without any leading questions from him. He carves your hard-won Snape down to a Dale Cooper after you both discuss what would look best. Since the shop stays dead during this lengthier-than-usual operation, you tip him five and give genuine thanks; taking your hairdo across fandoms like that is a procedure only Mr. Schooley could manage. You make your goodbyes and head for the beauty shop.

"Hey, that looks pretty sharp, Mr. Kimbro," Cindi says from behind you. OK - it's not like she had to invest the time to actually get her hair cut, but what was she doing over there? Waiting around for her chance to sneak up on you?

Expecting a surprise, you turn around and keep it together without so much as a smirk. She's changed 'outfits' to a very short A-line dress with bloomers, frilly socks, and Mary Janes. You figure the all-day sucker is Bloom-sculpt, as is the huge hair bow. The hair itself is all sausage curls, but at least she left the bangs alone. "People keep making fun of my hair, so I thought I'd go for something more respectable."

"They'll... certainly be set back by this makeover," you tell her. She looks so serious. Is she for real?

"What a gentleman!" she says, grinning. A snap later, and she's back to slimegirl naked - minus bow and lollipop. She has changed her hair, making it much simpler: a slightly longer fringe with the rest caught back in a ponytail. It looks more casual and mature now, less sculpted. The stray pops of hair from the chignon had gotten her teased, but you still secretly thought it had been sort of cool. "If saving my life meant you had to get a haircut, I thought I should look different too. They gave me some ideas in the salon, and I liked this best. It's like a whole new us!"

"Plus, now, if anyone laughs... you can just Bloom them."

"Finn, I shall not hesitate to enrobe anyone who teases me in the future," she says solemnly. And then winks. "But seriously, I am going to get detention, I can feel it. I won't be able to control myself."

"If cleanup's a snap, how are you going to get in any trouble?" you ask, seeing it Cindi's way. There's more than a few people at school that would look great coated in chocolate! Except they're all girls, and you're not sure how Cindi would react to being encouraged in that sort of 'revenge'.

"The only trouble I see right now is..." Cindi begins, looking down at her toes.

1553322221.content:
Let's cut the bullshit. Youre a dead man. Someone out there is trying to kill you. They want your life that only existed for a little over 20 years to end. The question is why? Why would anyone want to kill you? What have you done wrong? Youre a good kid. You never done anything bad to nobody. Sure, you were no saint, but you dont remember doing anything so bad that it warrants murder!

Maybe you shouldve never hung out with those guys. Maybe you shouldve never went to that party with them. Maybe you shouldve never had that drink since you were still technically underage. Maybe you shouldnt have looked at that oddly pale-skinned black haired girl with purple eyes weirdly as you left. Maybe you shouldve never took a look at the numbers on their foreheads. At first you thought somebody spiked the drink you had really bad... it's silly to think you could magically see numbers on people's foreheads, but now you know that those numbers had a meaning. The numbers symbolized who was next to die.

A week afterwards, #1 Billy Graham, found dead in a gruesome car accident. A month later, #2 Will Mercer, drowned during a swim in a nearby beach. A few weeks after that, #3 Karen Phillips burnt alive after a sudden freak accident set her garage on fire. It seemed the deaths had finally FINALLY calmed down by the time you went halfway through the next semester... only to read the news that the bodies of #4 Jake Francis and #5 Miguel Santiago were found buried in the middle of a forest during a fierce winter storm. To everything else, these were just ordinary tragedies, but deep down you knew the truth. The numbers. You wanted to tell somebody, but you knew nobody would believe you. Who would? YOU wouldnt believe you. But because you kept silent, #6 Tracy Wong, the leading actress in the school's performance of Romeo & Juliet met her end when the setting collapsed on her.

All that currently remains is #7 Hunter Crane Walters, YOU.
Many sleepless nights pass as you feared for your untimely end. The very few dreams you have repeats of you passing by the purple eyed girl as you left the party. Over and over again. And every time you see the #7 on your forehead in the reflection of her eyes. Now you knew how the kids who were hunted down by Freddy Krueger felt. But at least THEY knew who was killing them. Plus, Freddy only hunted them in their dreams. Whoever's after you could strike regardless of whether youre asleep or awake. In fact, he/she could strike any single moment in however long a life you have left!

****************************

*Bzzzzzzzzzzt!* Went the alarm clock. It was FINALLY 8 in the morning. You groaned tiredly as you pressed the button on the alarm clock, wondering why you even set the alarm in the first place. You had bags around your eyes, your stomach was in knots, and mad were you groggy. You limped toward the kitchen, rubbing your head, mumbling to yourself.
"Good morning!" your mom greeted you with a smile as she set up a plate of pancakes and scrambled eggs for you.

"M...morning," you grumbled as you sat down. Your mother's smile looked uneasy. You knew that she knew something was wrong, but you ignored it and started eating. Despite the pancakes tasting good, you felt like it didnt seem right you should be eating something like this. Pancakes were a good happy meal and part of a cheerful, get up and get ready to face the day, breakfast. Definitely not for you. You werent even worth a bowl of Cheerios. But for your mom, you gratefully scarfed it down.

Unfortunately, you could see that uneasy look in your mom's face through the corner of your eyes. You pretended not to notice, but it was to no avail.

"So how are you feeling?" she asked out of nowhere.
"Fine," you quickly told her and continued eating.
"Are you?"
"Yeah," you nodded and looked away. It got silent for almost a minute, but then your mom continued.

"So... that girl who died," she spoke, "was she a friend of yours?"
"No," you shook your head. 'She COULDA been,' you thought to yourself, 'if only I had warned her.'
"Did you know her?"
"Not very well," you answered, "we didnt talk much."
"Too bad," she noted, "she looked like a nice girl." You didnt respond, you just kept eating.

"...You havent been sleeping very well, have you?"
"Hm?" you stopped eating when she asked that question.
"Your father and I noticed you seemed more tired than usual," she explained, "youre not as energetic as you used to be. You dont go out as much. You've been skipping a few classes as of late." Figured she was gonna start with that!
You shrugged hard.
"Hunter, this sudden changed happened ever since that girl died."

You dropped your fork and knife. You couldnt eat another bite. "I'm fine," you lied.
"You dont look fine," she knew you were lying, "Hunter, it's ok to be scared. These things happen."
"I'm not scared," you almost raise your voice.
"Then why are you so panicky?"
"Mom, can we just drop this?!" you started to get up out of your seat, but that look your mom was giving you was stubborn.

"Is there something bothering you?"

"No," you told her, "I gotta get going."
"C'mon, Hunter!" she snaps, "we know youre upset about something! It's much worse than that girl, isnt it?"
You just took a heavy breath and that was it.
"I just want to let you know," she tells, "if there's something you, you can talk to me about it. I'm happy to listen. I'm just worried about you."
Youre worried about you too. You didnt know what to say. You didnt want to blow her off, but you didnt want to scare her... or make yourself look like a weirdo. But the longer you kept this a secret, the more miserable you felt.

"You can trust me, Hunter," she assures in that sweet tone that makes you melt, "I'll just ask you this one last time: is there something going on that's bothering you?"

15533222212.title: Another lie for the day.

155332222121.content:
As soon as a crowd of people crossed your path, you used them as cover as you dashed toward the cafe, hoping the girl didnt spot you. Fortunately, you looked behind you and saw her umbrella still standing with the crowd. Great, you lost her!
The moment you made it inside the cafe and slammed the door behind you, you realized how silly you've been acting just a moment ago! Come to think of it, why the heck did you run away from her? Maybe she just was just trying to be friendly. Great... now you feel like a jerk for purposely ditching that poor girl!
'This is why I can never make friends,' you think to yourself as you head to the register. Ever since you had a hard time sleeping, you at least developed an appreciation for caffeine.

"Welcome to Cafe de Grande!" the girl at the register greeted you with a phony smile. "What can I get for you?"
You couldnt even pretend to be chipper.
"Tall Mocha Mint," you tell her, "extra icing."
"Iced or hot?"
"Hot."
"Any cream or sugar?"
"Nope."
"Would that be for here or to go?"

You were about to say 'to go' when you noticed the pale-skinned girl with the umbrella standing just outside the window! For some odd reason, you started to panic again.
"For here! For here! For here!"
"Alrighty. That'll be $4.95-"
"Keep the change!" you slapped a 5 on the table and began sneaking over to a seat... somewhere outside of the girl's view!

"Thank you! Your order's #7!" you almost jumped out of your skin when she said your order number! When you finally regained your composure, you took your seat behind a tall convenient fern which definitely had you outside of the girl's potential view. Less than a minute after feeling relief, you feel regret. What if she was just trying to be nice? What if she just wanted to stop and say hi? She mustve been worried sick about the whole situation like you. She was at the same party. She saw the same people who ended up dying. What if she saw the numbers just like you?! Somebody else musta saw them... youre not crazy. Youre a dead man, but youre not crazy.

God, do you need that caffeine BAD!

The pleasant jazzy music on the radio started to get really staticy as the rain poured down even harder. The lights started to flicker a little. You felt the warmth of the heater started to wear down. Wonderful. The cafe felt just as gloomy as you do. Normally, you'd just blame it on the piss weather, but not anymore! For all you know, everything bad that's gonna happen to you is because DEATH is following you. Hey... for all your luck, maybe your mocha mint is gonna be poisoned?!

As if you couldnt hold back the urge to wet yourself, guess who walks in the cafe?! YOU GUESSED IN! In came the cute pale skinned girl... her purple eyes twinkled as she shook the rain drops off her umbrella, then dusted off her black jacket and black skirt. You practically ducked under the table in hopes that she wouldnt see you! Sure, you didnt really know why, but 'WHY' didnt matter anymore? Why do you have to die? It doesnt matter... you just will!

You peeked a little over the table and watched her head up to the cashier at the front... ducking every time you think she's gonna turn your direction.
Damn it... you couldnt believe how tensed up you were feeling. Part of you felt miserable that youre trying to hide from her for no real reason, yet the other part feels something bad is up with that girl. Granted, it's not everyday you see a girl with skin THAT pale and eyes that are purple (NATURALLY purple, I mean! And you most definitely believe those arent contacts!). But you felt something deeper about this girl. Something deep down in the corner of your mind must know why you should avoid her but will not tell you why.

"Number 7! Your order's ready!"

Oh....crap. A girl at the counter called your number! You'd go up there, but that purple-eyed girl is still in the middle of giving her order!

"Number 7? Your order. Number 7!"

To go up there would mean revealing yourself to her. Then what? It's not that easy to run away without looking suspicious at this rate. What if she wants to talk? What if she wants to gets to know you? What if she wants-

"Uh, number 7? Tall Mocha Mint? It's ready!"

15533222212111.content:
Eh, the day was already miserable so far, might as well finish it up by going to school. Youre gonna be late... and you have a test today... and if the rain wasnt soaking you, everyone'll notice you already soaked yourself, so why the heck not?! You dumped your Mocha Mint in a trashcan cuz you lost your appetite and headed to school.

It wasnt a long walk to school, just an incredibly wet and cold one. You havent blinked the whole time cuz of the vision of that poor employee getting her face torn to shreds burned into your mind. She became #7. YOU were supposed to be #7! The poor girl who probably did nothing wrong and probably deserved to live even more than you took your place. It's not a crime, at least not one that could stand up in court, but you felt entirely responsible for the murder.

Your prediction was right. Youre over 10 minutes late to class. Still, you barged into your Advanced Reading class without a care in the world. Your teacher, Mr. Hethridge turned his head to you the minute you stepped through the door... as did everybody else. Everyone saw you sweating and shivering as if you just saw a ghost... or saw somebody become one!

"Hunter!" Mr. Hethridge called, "youre late! What kept you?"

You spoke quiet as you panted, "...I was questioned by the cops."
The slightly annoyed look on Mr. Hethridge's face quickly faded, "Why? What happened?"
You swallowed hard and lowered your head, "I witnessed a fatal accident in a cafe near where I live." Normally that'd be considered an incredibly lame and incredibly sick excuse for being late to school.. but judging by the look and voice of fear and distraught on you, your teacher knew you werent lying. Your fellow students suddenly stopped writing on their scantrons and stared silently over at you, completely shocked and have no actual clue what to say at this point. You felt no need to tell them about the pale-skinned girl you thought you saw.

"Y...you gonna be alright?" Mr. Hethridge finally broke the scary moment of silence.
You lightly nodded. "Can I still take my test?"
"Y-yeah... here," he handed you your test sheet, "just relax... take a breath... and take your time."
"Thanks," you got to your seat, pulled out your scantron and pencil and started. Despite the vision of that employee's gruesome end repeating in your mind, you werent doing very badly on the test. Just a few vocab questions and trivia on the book you were supposed to read, but nothing incredibly complicated, especially since theyre all just multiple choice. You found it odd the test suddenly skipped Question #8... eh, must be a typo on Mr. Hethridge's part.

You finished the test faster than you expected. Maybe it was the adrenaline rush, pumping all the major blood to brain causing you process the answers so quickly. Regardless, you handed your test sheet and scantron to your teacher.
"Have a safe night," Mr. Hethridge wishes you.
"Thanks, you too," you said back as you headed out the door. Safe night indeed. Advanced Reading is done... next is your TV Production class before youre done for the day. Unfortunately, your class finished early, so you still have over an hour of time to burn before TV Production starts. With your mind racing a mile a minute, it was gonna be a LOOOOOONG break!

You quit all the afterschool clubs you used to a part of ever since Tracy Wong's death, so you were in no mood to hang out or chat with anybody. You just wanted to be in someplace quiet and comfortable and away from the rain. The only place that came to mind was the library. Without another thought, you walked into the library and found yourself a good mystery novel and sat at a table all by your lonesome while you waited for your class to start.
Sadly, you couldnt rely on the library's clock on the wall cuz it stopped at 8!
"Damnit!" you muttered to yourself, "somebody's messing with me!"

You looked around you at the other students reading quietly, working on the computers, and tutoring other students. At least you dont see that purple-eyed girl.
"C'mon! Why am I still worrying about that girl?!" you mumble to yourself. Unfortunately, you couldnt answer your own question. You literally had to think hard to find an answer, but nothing came up. Maybe you are going crazy.

After shaking that bad thought out of your head, you sighed and started reading your book. Shame you couldnt get too deep into it cuz of the tension youre already building up inside you. Apparently, the story has something to do with a guy who changed his fate where he was supposed to die but somehow survived, which ended up offending a super-natural deity and now he has a humanized persona of Death itself hunting him down and killing any and everybody that he's trying to get in contact with about the Death hunter. It made you sad. It made you feel guilty. It made you curse the author.

It also made you feel tired. VERY tired. A bad side effect from not getting enough sleep for too long. As much as you didnt want to go to sleep, your body had to compensate somehow.
But you still had another class to go. Not to mention that many possible nightmares that'll await you if you doze off. Maybe you shoulda had that Mocha Mint while you could.

But you gotta get your rest. Your eyelids were getting heavy. Heck, youre starting to imagine that damn paleskinned girl sitting right in front of you! Maybe a quick nap wouldnt hurt.

1553322221211121.content:
You froze up in absolute horror at your dean down on the floor clenching her chest with her face eternally frozen in the look of a scream. Pills were scattered all over the place as she clenched an empty medicine bottle in her other hand. You wanted to jump over the table, scream for her to be alright, perform CPR, jack the defibrillators from the nurse's office, ANYTHING... but it was all too late. Your sick, cruel wish on such an undeserving innocent woman came true. Your dean, the late Mrs. Mocherie, was dead.

You shivered, you twitched, you wanted to scream bloody murder but you didnt have the drive. What you have just witnessed was absolutely unreal. You knew she mighta had a heart condition, but it was this very day, this very moment, she passed on because of it. No... because of YOU.
'I...I'm sorry,' you mouthed as you sobbed, 'I'm so sorry... I didnt mean what I.... *sob!* Oh god... oh my god!' You fell to the ground, on your knees, gazing at the floor in shame, feeling like you were the one that murdered her as visions of her last moments flashed in your head.
She tried to comfort you, she tried to console you, but you yelled at her and said 'Fuck You' right to her face when she was only trying to help. Why did you have to act like such a dick?! As much as you didnt like her, she did not deserve what she got. It was all your fault, #9.

Tears fell down your face as you covered your face and sobbed while trying to hold back the urge to throw up. This was too much. You should have never left home today. You should have stayed in bed where all this horror could have been avoided. You cried, trying to imagine your bedroom as your own personal happy-place, away from all the horrible death...

Just then, you felt someone patting your shoulder. You lifted your head and turned it to see... that pale-skinned girl with purple eyes again!!

"!!!" you flinched away from her as you stared in a panic. The bitch that followed you from Day 1! Who stalked you all throughout the day! Even haunted your nightmare! Still carrying that stupid umbrella, even indoors! Could that nightmare be true?! Is this woman really Death?!

She merely smiled at you, not even noticing the corpse youre also trying to keep a distance from.

"S...STAY BACK!" you shouted, "DONT COME NEAR ME!!" The girl didnt even flinch. In fact, as if to mock you, she took a step forward.
"I'M WARNING YOU, STAY BACK!!" you shouted again. She didnt show any fear as she cooly and collectively held her umbrella over her shoulder!

Shame you couldnt be as calm. You panicked like your life and soul were on the line, and if that nightmare was true, it probably was! You looked around for something to wield... only thing that came to mind was Mrs. Mocherie's golf club (she used to golf... used to)! You grabbed it and wielded it like a bat!
"KEEP AWAY FROM ME!!" you warned her!
She just snickered as she stared at you. You couldnt believe what a fool you've been acting! Even if the nightmare was real, what good will that golf club do?! You sighed hard and dropped the club on the floor.

Thankfully, the girl simply turned and casually walked out. You felt like a heavy weight was dropped off your shoulders... then you turned back over to your dean and all that relief vanished in a second!

Not long after, all the students in the school were evacuated, then the ambulance came to pick up the body and the police came for questioning.
They questioned a few faculty members, then Mr. Mocherie would spent most of the time sobbing more than you did, and finally you.

“Mr. Walters, I take it?” the big bald muscular blue eyed officer spoke in a light Yiddish accent. Israeli, if you had to guess. You swallowed hard, trying not to look over at Mr. Mocherie still drowning in tears and tissues, and nodded.
“Officer Leanansidhe,” he introduced himself, “if I could have a moment of your time.” As if you had a choice.
“Sure,” you nodded again.

Officer Leanansidhe asked you a few personal questions, like where are you from, what are you studying, you got any brothers or sisters, you got a girlfriend nearby... for some reason, that question made your blood run cold.
Finally, he got to the point.
“How well have you known Mrs. Virginia Mocherie?”
“She was our school dean,” you told her, “had a few conferences with her.”
“You were reported speaking with her last before her demise,” Mr. Leanansidhe noted, “is this true?”
“Yes.”
“What were you two talking about?” Your heart broke thinking about what you two were talking about.
You squinted your eyes and clenched your fists, damning yourself for what you said to her. “She wanted to know if I was doing alright since… the uh…”
“The last two fatal incidences?” Mr. Leanansidhe looked through his notes.
“Yeah,” you answered, “the woman was only trying to help, but I yelled at her and told her to get off my back.” He scribbled notes as you continued. “When I rushed into her office to make up for what I said to her, I found her on the ground.” The cop hmphed and continued scribbled for a little while. You hated the silence, but it was a break from answering the soul-cutting questions and it didnt last long enough

“I am understanding that this is perhaps the 3rd fatal accident you have witnessed throughout this week alone?”
“Yes,” was your only answer.
“Do you by chance believe that these incidences are coincidental?”
You had to think about an answer for almost a minute. Despite the threat you’ve gotten from that girl in your dream, you felt obligated to be honest.
“I dont anymore.”
“Neither do I,” you lifted your head up when you that comment come from him. He continued scribbling on his notepad like it was no big deal, but you know what you heard. You just dont know what he meant by it.

"S...STAY BACK!! DONT COME NEAR ME!"

Through the corner of your eye, you saw the other cops taking a look at the footage from the surveillance camera on one of their tvs. It was humiliating watching yourself shiver and shake desperately in front of a dead body.
"I'M WARNING YOU, STAY BACK!!" you saw yourself shouted to the g... to nobody?!

This was the part where the pale-skinned girl stepped up toward you, but you dont see her on the video! The very spot you remember her standing in was empty! You wielding a golf club at nobody. You were scared witless at air! This was just like what happened at the cafe! Nobody there saw the girl either!

You wanted to scream out to the cops that there was someone in the room with you! You werent flipping out at nothing! You know what you saw... dont you?!

There was a girl there, wasnt there?! Youre not going crazy... are you?!

155332222121112121.content:
Sure, youre gonna look weird trying to talk to your mom about a girlish embodiment of death being responsible for the fatal incidents that have been occurring recently, but youre already in an off state of mind, so what worse will this do?
You know that SHE wont be happy about you telling somebody else about her, but she can more than happily take it out on you for it. You're gonna need to confront her and her sisters sooner or later!

"Uh... mom?" you swallowed hard.

"What is it?" she seemed just as nervous as you.

You were thinking of the right way to word it. It was difficult to say it. You couldnt just flat out say 'A purple eyed girl that represents death has been stalking me', you have to WORK up to it. 'Just take it one step at a time,' you tell yourself. Start slow.

"I've been uh... seeing someone... lately..." Not exactly the BEST way to start, but you were working on a merciless timer!
Sure enough, that interested your mother. "What's her name?" she asked.

"I dont know," you answer. She started looking at you strangely.
"You never learned her name? You've been seeing her lately, yet you never bothered to learn her name?"
You shook your head, "Nope."
"Why havent you?"
"She never told me her name," was the only sensible answer you could come up with.

"Well... is she nice?" good question.

"I thought she was." Honest answer.
"What happened?"
Finally, you thought of the perfect way to word this situation!

"She was awful fixated on the people that were dying lately," you tell her, "ever since I met her at the party a couple of months ago-"
"Oh, the one where you met those kids who died?"
"Yeah," you continue the explanation, "since then, she hasnt gotten off the subject of death. She's really starting to scare me. And now after Tracey died, she's been popping up more often. Today, she followed me at the cafe. I even seen her at the library before seeing Mrs. Mocherie. Hell, I'm having trouble sleeping cuz I'm seeing her in my nightmares!"

Your mother got real worried. Then again, she is your mother, so she'd have to be. "Do you think she's stalking you?"
You nodded strongly. She was silent for about a minute or two, probably in deep thought.

Finally, she took a deep breath and pulled a little card out of her pocket.
"Maybe you should talk to Officer Leanansidhe about it," she suggested, "he was asking for you earlier, but I didnt let him in because he seemed to get a little too personal about you." You looked at the card. Mr. Leanansidhe's business card. That cop who was questioning you earlier. He seemed pretty odd himself. Odd.. just like you. Maybe he's odd enough to listen to a crazy tale regarding Lady Death. "He insisted that you call him right away as soon as you can. You dont have to, but... if this girl is stalking you, you never wanna wait until it's too late." She's got a point. No point in hesitating if that pale skinned girl and her sister's are probably just gonna kill you anyway.

"I'll think about it," you tell her, "I'm glad we had this talk."
"Like I said," she said, "I'm here to listen if you need me."

You nodded and headed back to your room. It felt good to get finally get that off your shoulders. Sure, it wasnt the WHOLE truth, but you can reveal the rest bit by bit. One step at a time.

On your way back to the room, you kept staring at Officer Leanansidhe's card. You wrestled around the thought of calling him. You know you need to call him, but you know you need to keep your mouth shut. All the while, you stared at the phone number.

*Swipe!*

At least it got swiped out of your hands! The rude thief was none other than that pale skinned purple-eyed stalker of yours! Your eyes widened in terror as she glared at you. Her playful smile was gone. What was left behind was a rather irritated glare.
She then whipped out a pair of scissors and cut the card into little pieces!

"HEY, THAT-!!!" you immediately shut up when pinned you against the wall with her scissors! They looked like plain ordinary scissors, but after seeing what her umbrella really was, you dare not take the chances with her scissors. That's when you remembered... DEATH!

"Mr. Crane Walters," she spoke in a snooty tone, "were you blabbing about me after I specifically told you not to?"
You wanted to smart off at the bitch, but because this death is the Reaper, you kept your mouth shut, too afraid to say anything.

"Guilty silence, eh?" she tilted her head, still glaring, "wonderful. Even after I pulled so many strings to save your life. TWICE! THIS is how you repay me?!"
You still stared in silence, not taking any chances with her scissors.
"Your fate was to die today, Hunter," she said, "it not for me, it'd be YOUR face ripped to shreds by an exploding expresso maker!"

"Why do I have to die in the first place?" you finally mustered the courage to ask.
"I said it was FATE, you moron!" she snapped, "you dont have much of a life to live anyway. What kind of future do you think you could have if you dont even have the backbone to handle the deaths a few strangers you met in a stupid stoner party?!" Geez, harsh!
Despite her words cutting you like a knife, she lowered her scissors from your throat. You felt a LITTLE less helpless now that you werent being threatened with a weapon.

"At least I'm giving you the opportunity to be useful," she insisted, "a nice little secret assistant to Death. An undercover reconnaissance agent fingering out those who are next in line to get whacked. Who wouldnt love such an opportunity?"
"I certainly wouldnt!" you almost raise your voice, "you expect me to live with the guilt that two people died because they unwillingly took my place in line?!"
"You'll get over it," she shrugged.
"How do you expect me to get over it?!" you resisted the urge to raise your voice again, "I havent had a goodnight sleep for over a while cuz of the crap that's been going on! Youre telling me I'll get used to it?!"
"I dont like your attitude," your angry responses displeased her, "you dont seem to know quite well who the hell youre talking to!"

"As a matter of fact, I dont," you tell her, "you go through this whole episode of threatening me to keep quiet and I never even got to know your name!"

She just tsked, "My NAME?! What is it with you silly humans? The only species that requires names to tell others apart cuz youre too damn curious for your own good?" You raised your eyebrow as she continued, "My kind have no names. We have no use for them." She then smirked at you, "But you know what? YOURE the inquisitive human. Why dont YOU give me a name?!" She's letting you name her?

You had one good name pop in your mind instantly, but you were gonna get tired of calling her 'Cunt'. Nah, you'd rather be crafty with her name. A name is supposed to be a symbol for the individual who has it. Your life as you know it can vary depending on what your name is. What kind of name could suit HER?

She mentioned she had sisters... she talked quite a bit about faith... scissors... death...

"Atropos," you name her.
Sure enough, her purple eyes brightened as her smirk got wider!

"Atropos!" she giggled, "Like the Moirai! The Sisters of Fate! The last one in line that wields the thread of life... the one who ends a mortal's life by CUTTING that thread! Hahah! I like it!" She even gave you a thumbs up! Nice to see she appreciates it, at least.
She patted your cheek and squinted her eyes as she smiled, "I'll be sure to repay your generosity soon. Provided you dont try to screw me over. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some important business to attend to. I'll be seeing you REAL soon, Hunter!" And with that, Atropos walked out, humming a chilling tune as she left.

After you stopped feeling her chilling aura in the air, you looked down at the cut up pieces of what used to be Officer Leanansidhe's card. Now youre even more terrified to call him. Now that you gave Ms. Death a name, she's probably gonna watch you like a hawk even more than ever. But if you keep silent, who knows who else is gonna fall victim to Atropos?

Despite being in little pieces, you could still piece together the phone number on the card. Question is, do you dare?

1553322221211121212.title: Once more death is a bitch.

15533222212111212121.content:
Nobody's there. The parking lot's empty except for a few cop cars. You see yellow tape and police signs posted everywhere. Police officers were standing outside chatting amongst themselves out in the open.Suffice to say school was closed.

"Sorry sir," one of the cops approached you, "school's closed. Move along." You knew why they were there. You knew what's going on.
"Is this about what happened to the dean," you asked, despite already knowing the answer.
"Not authorized to say," he replied, "please leave." You knew when you werent wanted. You nodded and turned around, heading off, wondering when the next bus'll arrive.

"Wait!" but then you heard a policewoman stop you short, "he's one of the main eye-witnesses! Take him to Leanansidhe!" Aw crap. Shoulda known you werent gonna get away that easy.
"Him? But why would he need to-"
"You heard the guy! Just do it!"
"Alright fine! Come with me, sir."

You sighed as your stomach was in knots, "Yes sir." You swallowed hard and desperately held back the urge to throw up from all the adrenaline pumping as the cop escorted you toward the major crime scene. Just remember it made you pale. Especially the last words you said to the dean before she died. The weight of the whole world as you know it probably rests on your shoulders now.
It was a long walk through the campus. Long and lonely, not counting the cop escorting you. And sadly he wasnt much of a talker. Good reason for that. The only conversation through the long he ever brought up was: "So... is it true that you really witnessed a espresso maker blowing up in a girl's face on the same day?"
You could only reply by taking a cold deep breath.
"Oh right... uh... sorry," at least he immediately apologized. You just pretending you didnt hear anything.

Still, just to be on the safe side, you secretly scouted around in case Atropos was watching. You havent seen her so far, but you dare not relax yet. That bitch couldnt be far. You are a useful enough tool to her and her sisters whom you might as well name Clotho and Lachesis. Than again, she could have more than 2 sisters. Hell, she could have TONS of sisters... each with the exact same goal in mind: Make People Die!

"Mr. Leanansidhe, sir!" your escort announced to the familiar officer chatting with a tall shady looking guy in a black leather trenchcoat, "your eye-witness is back."
Officer Leanansidhe turned his attention to you in a bit of surprise as his 'friend' just stared at you with a non-chalant frown.
"Mr. Walters!" he shouted then turned to the other cop, "thank you. Return to your post."
"Yes sir," he said and walked off... leaving just you, Leanansidhe, and the sharp dressed man. You looked over and examined the long-brown haired, slightly bearded stranger close. He looked about twice your age and the light scars on his face didnt fail to show it. Oh man, he's carrying a big ol' wooden crucifix strapped to his back! He stared into your soul with dark brown piercing eyelids as he smoked his cigarette. You even saw the letters 'H' 'A' 'W' and 'K' tatooed on his fingers. He had quite a strong aura about him, too. Warming.

"Mr. Walters, you havent called," the officer said, "I was starting to worry."

"I... needed to be alone," was the best excuse you could get.

"Are you alright?" he asked you, "did you managed to get sleep last night."
"Yeah, I'm fine," you answer.
"No he aint," the stranger spoke up in a deep, low voice that demanded authority, "he's obviously shaken up." He's also a damn good observer.

You sighed and nodded, "Yeah, I'm shaken up. I'm not even sure I should be here right now." Damn... the cop's friend is good.

"It is a good thing you are," the cop assured you, "because we're going to need your help." YOUR help?! What kind of help could you offer other than a quick and easy way to soil pants?!
"I'm... not sure how I can-"
"Sure ya do," the second guy quickly interrupts, "you just dont want cuz youre too shaken up." You only met him for about a minute and already youre sick of him!

"Er... Mr. Walters, I would like to introduce you to a distant associate of mine. This is Hunter Hawk Huntersen, of Hunter H Huntersen & Ted Incorporated." Ah, his name is your name too. Shame first names are the only thing you two have in common, "It's an underground organization of... uh... well... it's kind of hard to explain-"
"We're Demon Hunters!" the other guy interrupted Mr. Leanansidhe, "what's hard to explain about that? Dragons, wizards, vampires, fairies, you name it, I skinned at least one of those little fuckers." Demon Hunters? Wow.

"Youre... serious?" you looked at the cop strangely, "you guys hired a... demon hunter to investigate a fatal accident?"
"No," Mr. Leanansidhe answered, "I did."
"Think of me as an investigator of paranormal activity," Hunter said, "only without all the Hollywood cameras and commercial sponsors." Wow. You'd find it silly enough that a police force would put a ghost whisperer on a case as tragic as this, but a DEMON HUNTER? A hunter of demons? Mythological creatures that existed only in fairy tales, tv, and your dad's old adventure novels?

"I er... think I should be heading home."
"The next bus headed back to your home aint for another couple hours," damn that Hunter, "I have a gut feeling the Good Lord wants you to stay too." Oh and he's one of THOSE types, too. If he's gonna preach to you, he could at least be holding a bible instead of a flask!

Leanansidhe sighed, "Listen. Remember when you told me you did not think those previous deaths were coincidental and I said neither do I?" You nodded, so he continues, "Mr. Huntersen and I strongly believe there might be something... supernatural involved." He couldnt be more right. But it's not like you could just say 'YEP! IT'S A REAPER!'
"A kind of supernatural I'm way too familiar with," Hunter shrugged, "someone's messing with the balance of life and death. And youre the little tool caught in the middle of it."

If you met this guy BEFORE the experience at the party, you'd say this guy's a loony. But NOW that youre experiencing what youre experiencing, he hit the nail right on the head.

"Mr. Huntersen and I have been involved in particular odd cases such as this in the past," Leanansidhe said, "I know something like this is hard to believe, but-"
"Oh cut the crap, Noland," Hunter once AGAIN interrupts, "we know the kid believes it. Look at him. He's almost as pale as a reaper!"

REAPER?!! No no no no. Calm down. Take a breath. Relax.

"I have no idea what youre talking about," you boldly lie, "and I dont really have to play with your Van Helsing cosplaying friend, officer."
Hunter just chuckled. "So youre gonna deny it then? Alright," he then leaned down at you and stared you deep in the eye, "look me right in the eye." He pointed to his eye.

To humor him, you did what he sai... #10?! You see the number 10 on your forehead in the reflection! Oh crap! Somebody else is gonna die in your place again!
You checked the cop's forehead and then Mr. Helsing's. Neither of them have 9 on their forehead. You looked around to the other cops a ways away... you dont see a 9 on them either! Damn it, who has the 9?! You gotta find them! You gotta warn them! You gotta save them!

As you panicked, Noland stared at you with even more concern as Mr. Huntersen smirked.

"Tell me, Mr. Walters," Hunter said, "what did you see?"
15533222212111212121.title: The Hunt is On!

155332222121112121211.title: The lieing stops here! (bell rings)

1553322221211121212111.content:
The other Hunter stood right in front of you and faced Atropos, as if trying to protect you from her. The big bad soldier of faith casually smoked his cigarette as the Reapette glared daggers at him. All this time, you were too busy soaking in the thought that your mother became the next to die. Even though nothing was negotiated, that was NOT part of the deal! Not only did she not deserve to die, you would rather take her place instead of her! Little Miss Death has gone too far.

Speaking of which, Atropos still hasnt gotten over wanting to wipe you out. The longer Hunter stood in front of you like a human shield, the more impatient she got.
"I wont tell you again," her voice was cold as she ordered Mr. Huntersen, "move out of the way. NOW."
Mr. Huntersen just shook his head and said, "Cant do that."

Atropos tsked. "Fine... then he's #11!" And like a bat out of hell, she leaped at Hunter at mach speed!

*KLLIIINKKK!!*
Her giant scissor blades collided with Hunter's wooden cross that he was holding like a sword! Actually, the wooden cross broke into pieces revealing, in fact, a sword hidden within it! Creative method for concealing your weapon. Atropos gritted her teeth just before leaping back to dodge a swipe from Hunter's sword!
Great, she's agile too!

But Hunter was fast, too. With each swing of Atropos's blades, he was quick to block and repel each swing with his sword. You kept a distance from the two, cuz Hunter would literally jump and sway whenever Atropos tries to get cheap shots at his legs! Atropos was also quick on her feet and flexible enough to swing her head back when Mr. Huntersen tried chopping her pretty head off! In only seconds it felt like they both took a hundred swings at one another. You assumed their movement wasnt human. Well, of course not Atropos, being Death and all, but Mr. Huntersen...

"YAAH!!" with a good quick swing, your guardian angel knocked one of the blades out of her hand! Her purple eyes widened as Hunter shrugged his arms and grinned.
"Look, we all know what's gonna happen at this point" he warned her, "I knock the other one out of your hand, you whine about how this isnt part of fate, I stab your heart out, then I take the boy. Or you can just turn around tell all your little sisters to play nice from now on!"
The purple eyed girl growled... a fearsome beastly growl. The purple eyelids enlarged abnormally wide. Her toothy glare revealed odd-shapped fangs that looked less unusual on a sabertooth tiger than a human!

"YoU gOdDaMn DOG!!!" her voice sounded ungodly, "I wILL nOt LeT yOu RuIn My DESTINY!!!!"
Huntersen didnt even flinch. He still casual smoke his cigarette and remarked, "Silly brat. Everyone knows we make our own destiny. Mine's just better than yours!"
Atropos's monstrous glare turned into a monstrous grin, "OhHhHh?!" she dropped the other blade, "I dIdNt ThInK sOmEoNe WoUlD tHiNk So HiGhLy oF bEcOmInG gHoUl-ChOw?"
Oh crap. That wiped the grin off Hunter's face!

Suddenly, a shadowy set of jaws appeared from the darkened floor below Hunter's feet and engulfed his foot!
"Arggh!!" He struggled for a little bit, then ANOTHER set of jaws clamped down on his other foot! "GYAADD!!" he shouted when another set of jaws appeared behind him and clamped down on his pony-tail! Then another set of jaws clamped on his arm, causing him to drop his sword as he flinched in pain! Damn, he's defenseless!
Atropos's eyes narrowed to normal and her mouth regained normal shaped as she giggled at his misery, "Heheheh... must suck when your God's protection doesnt have a long-distance plan, eh?"

You wanted to run, but after seeing that guy stand up for you like that, you'd never forgive yourself if you just leave him to die. Against common sense, a surge of adrenaline pumped into you, coaxing you to save your new pal! Fortunately, you see Atropos's scythe on the ground! Bad move of her to leave it unwatched!
You pick up the scythe, slowly creep up behind her, say a brief silent pray, and take a swing!

*Woosh!*

Holy shit, it went right through her! No effect!
Even worse, she turned around to you! You gulped hard as she gave you a slightly angry frown.
She stepped up to you, swiped her scythe right out of your hand like it was nothing, and slapped you in the face!

"Aagh!!" man, did it hurt. It wasnt superhuman, but it was pretty agonizing. Not to mention humilating! That simple bitch slap knocked you on your ass.
As it your pride couldnt be hurt worse, Atropos was looking down at you with that slightly angry expression.

"Oh... I almost forgot about the little snitch," she snapped her fingers, causing a giant set of toothy jaws to emit from the ground below you and clamp down on your legs!
"AAHHH!!" you screamed as it swallowed and immediately engulfed your lower torso in seconds!

"Crane! Hang in there!" Huntersen called out to you... by your middle name?! How did he know your middle name?

"We're gonna have a nice long talk," Atropos warned, "as soon as #9's out of the picture." #9!!
"Grr!! ARGGH!!!" you struggled against the jaws after hearing that number, "I WILL NOT LET YOU HURT MY MOM!"
"You dont even need her!" she snapped, "your dad's gonna be fine on his own. He makes more than enough money to support the both of you!" Man was that enfuriating you! Who the hell was she to tell you you didnt need your mom?! "Besides, you already have a wonderful career in which the payout is far more valuable than money!"
"I... DONT... WANT... THIS JOB!!!" you roared as you continued fighting the jaws of death!

Her purple eyes widened and stared deeply into yours, "You WILL want it." Her voice almost sounded as cold as her beastlike one was earlier, "I will make you want it. Even if I have your break you apart... and rebuild you, you will willingly accept this destiny!" What does she mean by that?

And where did that flash bang come from? OHCRAPQUICKCOVERYOUREYESANDEARS!! You'll never forget the last image you saw before covering your eyes and ears: the surprised look on Atropos's face as the flash bang dropped in front of her feet!

*POP!*

You heard a wind shattering pop and saw a nearly blinding white flash! You felt the jaws clamping down on you suddenly vanish. Your ears were ringing, blocking out almost all sound except the faint shriek coming from Atropos as she desperately tried to shield her eyes! You assume that flash bang came from Officer Leanansidhe, fashionably late for the party! Youre pretty sure those things arent police protocol, but it saved the day and that's all that matters!

Noland was trying to scream something to you as he helped Huntersen up, but you couldnt hear him. It didnt matter much anyway, cuz something else caught your attention.

When the blur cleared, you could see an image in the middle of the darkness. You could see your mom's car driving down a highway in the middle of fog and rain! Good, she's still alive! There's still time!

But not long. An image flashed of your mom trying desperately to look through the fog. She probably cant see in front of her with all that fog. That's a major problem, because another image flashed... the car's heading straight toward a bridge just over a cliff... and the bridge is out! She's gonna drive right off it!

You couldnt even hear your own voice shouting 'MOM! STOP!'

It was now or never! You had to go over there and stop her! You got up and started running toward the flashing image!

"...Oh No YoU DOOONNTTT!!!" you clearly heard Atropos's beastly shriek behind you! The darkness became consuming the image as if trying to trap you in!
Youre racing against the clock!

You have to move fast or the next time you see your mother will be at the morgue... to identify the body.

15533222212111212121111.title: To change one's fate is to change alls.

155332222121112121211111.content:
The gloomy dark atmosphere was gone. Atropos and her siblings were gone. It was relieving. Once more, you cheat death. Both your mom's and yours.

Better even, the first thing you see when you open your eyes was Mr. Huntersen staring down at you with that cold serious look that'll no doubt become engraved in your memory. Opposite of him was that cop that quite possibly risked his badge to save both your lives, Officer Noland Leanansidhe. You even saw a third face looking down at you. A girl's. She looked as young as you. Blonde hair, green eyes, slightly freckly cheeks, and a look of sheer nervousness. She had a cop's uniform on, too.

"Good, he's awake," you heard Hunter say.

"FREEZE! HANDS IN THE AIR!!" Holy crap! The girl pulled a gun on you! You almost screamed in fright when Noland cut in!
"No! Lydia! Stop!" he forced her gun arm down, "that is NOT protocol! He just woke from unconsciousness!"
The girl blushed and squinted nervous, "S...sorry, dad!"

Mr. Huntersen didnt look as lenient as his partner, "Noland... why in the hell did you bring her with us? This was supposed to be just us!"
"Mr. Huntersen, she is still my daughter AND my trainee," Noland answered, "I want her to be prepared for the catastrophe ahead just like I will."
Hunter grunted, "The less she knows, the better! You'll only endanger her if she learns too much!"
"Theyre going to hunt down my family sooner or later!" Noland snapped back, "the least I can do is make sure my child at least gets a chance to protect herself."
Hunter just shook his head and muttered, "Damn fool..." before taking out a little flask from his jacket and taking a swig, "...damn fool..."

"Hey! My dad is not a damn fool!" the girl snapped at the big lug, "it's cuz of him, you and whatshisface are still alive long enough to argue about it!" Girl looks pretty nervous, but she's got spunk.
Hunter just stared coldly at her, "He has a name, woman. I would suggest you show it some respect."
"And I would suggest you show Lydia some respect!" said Noland, "I am not paying you to show lip to my flesh and blood!" Ok, you heard enough. You got more important matters to deal with!

"Excuse me!" you speak up as all eyes were on you. You stand up and ask, "Where am I?"

"Forgive us, Mr. Walters," Mr. Leanansidhe answered, "youre in my office. Purgatory City Police Department. We feared the worst when you suddenly disappeared last night. This morning, a few of my boys found you unconscious in the middle of a church fountain." Found at a church. How quaint. "Oh... perhaps I should introduce you. Er... this is my daughter, Lydia. Lydia, this Hunter Crane Walters." Lydia looked at you nervously, as if she wasnt used to meeting new people.
Still, being a guy (who's being stalked by the Reaper!), you politely extend your hand to her, "Nice to meet you, Lydia."
"Nice to meet you too," she extended her hand... only to realize she still had the gun in it! "Oops!" she quickly put it back in her holster and shook your hand.

"Youre supposed to put the safety on," Hunter raised his voice a little.
Lydia's face went red, "Oh...r...right!" she quickly put the safety on and put it back in the holster! Poor girl's gonna shoot herself in the foot one day... or shoot somebody ELSE's foot!

"Mr. Huntersen," Noland decided to change the subject, "enlighten him regarding the threat that we are up against."
Hunter took a sharp look at Lydia, who returned her look with an angry glare, but then spoke, "I wanted to tell you this sooner, but 'fate' apparently didnt leave much time. That thing that attacked you last night was a personification of a Reaper."
"Yeah, I know," you told him, "she... it already explained it to me."

“No she didn’t,” Hunter once again knew better, “otherwise, you’d be a lot more confused and terrified than you are now.” Oh… crap. Do you even WANT to know more about Atropos now?! “I hope you and little miss rookie over there are ready for a history lesson.”
“I’m more than ready!” Lydia boldly stated, “A Leanansidhe never backs down from a challenge!”
You don’t think Mr. Huntersen cared about what she thought. He had his full attention on YOU.
You swallowed hard and nodded.

"I aint gonna lie," he started sweating, "Reapers are a bitch to deal with. There an even bigger bitch to get rid of. The rules of life and death dont really apply to these things, because technically they ARE death. Not zombies, not ghosts, not even fallen angels... if anything, they're probably classed closer to locusts.”
“Locusts?” Bugs?
“Not the grasshoppers,” he explained, “the biblical Locusts. The ones that crawl out of Abaddon’s bottomless pit. Book Revelations.” You probably dont wanna look up that passage.

“Reapers are more legion than individual,” Hunter put up more detail, “similar to bees, they gather in colonies composed of pretty much clones of one another. The major bulk of them are practically soulless drones that act on command of the older alphas that actually HAVE a personality.” Oh… so Atropos’s little sisters are basically carbon copies that do what the big sis’s command. That got you thinking… what if those times Atropos popped up to visit you werent the same girl? Maybe the other Atropi that followed you were her little sisters!

“Like a legion?” Lydia asserted, “my name is Death and we are many.”
“That would probably be the best way to describe her,” Noland responded, then added, “them.” Huntersen was right. You are more confused and terrified than ever. You dont have one crazed lady death in your life to worry about. You didnt even have a few crazed lady deaths. You had an ENDLESS amount! But something doesnt add up. Too many questions remain unanswered.

“Then… how come it wasnt until recently that I started seeing her?” you asked, “and how come it wasnt until recently that I started seeing numbers on people’s heads? And how come WE can see her but nobody else can?! And why… why am I involved in this mess in the first place?”
Sadly, Huntersen remained silent. The big walking talking demon dictionary had nothing to say!

"That's what we're still trying to find out," Noland humbly answered. It was an answer you didnt want to hear, but it was the answer. The mystery of Atropos continues.

You ran your hand across your face then through your hair trying to soak all the bad news you've heard so far in. There was nothing you could say. You felt determined to say something, but nothing came to mind. Nothing to do, but gaze out the window and watch the rain fall... and gaze at the girl with the umbrella standing on a rooftop, purple eyes still staring into your soul. Question is, which girl is that?

*Riiiiing!* Just then, the office's phone rang. Noland answered it.
"Hello? ...I see. We'll be right on it. See you there." And then he hangs up the phone and looks toward Mr. Huntersen, "...I'm going to need your help with this one."
"Gonna cost you extra," Hunter said.
"Fine, I'll write you a check," Noland shrugged, "Lydia, would you mind watching Mr. Walters while we're gone?"
"C-Cant I come with you?" Lydia asked, "I mean, I think I trained well enough! I'm more than ready to go on a mission with you!"
"Learn to carry a gun properly and we'll talk," Huntersen remarked as he lit up another cigarette. Lydia flashed him a glare, but her dad intervened.

"I need you here with Mr. Walters," Noland told his daughter, "I need you to watch him while I'm gone. Can I trust you to do this?"
"But... but I-"
"Can I trust you to do this?" he repeats himself. Lydia's face gets a bit red, but nods. "Good. Shouldnt be long. This way, Mr. Huntersen." And in a flash, the two were out the door, leaving only you and Lydia. Didnt know how long you were gonna be here. You were getting homesick, but you knew this was for the best. At least the reapers turned their attention away from your family... for now at least.

"Who's Atropos?"

"Hm?!" you almost jumped when you heard somebody ELSE say the name of that alpha stalker! You turned your head back to Lydia, who no doubt had a look of intrigue and curiosity on her face.

"I heard you mumbling that name in your sleep," she said, "who's Atropos?"

Crap... Ms. Rookie here heard you calling the reaper by her name. Should you tell her?
