15533222221211111111.content:
"A mortal admirer to these celestials?" asked the long-bearded slightly overweight gentleman in a bright white business suit stained with red blood wielding a bright golden cross-shaped staff, wiping the excess blood off it with a cloth, "interesting... most interesting indeed. ...Sigh, damn angel blood. Is there nothing on this planet that can wash those kind of stains off?"

Meanwhile, you and your folk have split up into a couple of groups hiking toward the nearest hill. Your hiking group consisted of you (duh!), your dad, grandpa, and Uncle Bert.

And when I say 'hiking' I mean 'hitching a ride in grandpa's old pickup'! And when I say 'toward the nearest hill', I mean 'down the country road about a few miles or so past the nearest hill!'
You sat between grandpa who was behind the wheel and dad who shaking his head with his hand in his wondering why he ever agreed going on this trip in the first place. Bert had to sit in the back of the pickup to air out his toe infection. Throughout the ride, the radio was blasting 'Big and Rich' and everybody in the truck was jamming to it except for your pops, who was keeping to himself and being the odd man out. Before that magical moment with Medea, you wouldnt been a mental no-show just like him. But with a new boost of confidence flowing in you thanks to her, you happily sang off the top of your lungs along with the others!

"AND I SADDLE UP MY HORSE AND I RIDE INTO THE CITY!!!" you, your grandpa, and uncle Bert sing, "I MAKE A LOT OF NOISE CUZ THE GIRLS THEY ARE SO PRETTY! RIDING UP AND DOWN BROADWAY ON MY OLD STUD LEROY AND THE GIRLS SAY..." you banged on the dash, "SAVE A HORSE, RIDE A COWBOY!! EVERYBODY SAYS..." You all looked toward your dad to finish the chorus of that song!
He regrettfully muttered, "Save a horse, ride a cowboy..."

When the song finally came to a close, your grandpa started to notice your old man's uneasiness.
"What's wrong with ya, Mike?" he asked you, "ya'll act like you never had any decent fun in yer life!"
He sighed, "I thought we were just going on a simple little hike up a hill."

"Nah!" your grandpa shook his head, "let those suckers have their little hike. Leave the true treasure huntin' associates to their business!"
Treasure hunting associates?!
"What are you talking about, Rufus?" your dad got suspicious.
"Heh! The hell did ya think the REAL reason I had us all come down on this camping trip for?!"

Your dad took a deep hard breath and said, "Please enlighten me."
"I heard from a few special sources o'mine that there's some mighty fine treasure tah be found in this mountain's ancient burial ground."
Treasure hunting in an ancient burial ground?! Maybe it's the boost of adrenaline talking, but that sounds SWEET!

Your dad, however didnt approve, "Are you out of your mind?! We've come all this way just to disturb a Native American burial ground?!"
"Er, I dont think theyre Native American, Mike," uncle Bert said from the back.
"That's right," grandpa said, "heard they were more of a bizarre private sacrilegious cult that got their asses handed to 'em LONG time ago for their heresy."
Your dad dropped his jaw, "U-Unbelievable! Youre putting my soul and the soul of my son in jeopardy over some treasure left by a satanist cult?!"

"Nah, they werent satanists," Rufus shook his head, "but the kind of weird-ass sacrifices those yeehaws were into, they might as well have been!"
"This... this is outrageous!" your dad rightfully gets worried, "this is the problem with you, Rufus! Every single time I agree to go on 'family trips' with you, you SOMEHOW find a way to turn it into a godforsaken test of my patience AND faith!"
"And Mike, THIS is the reason I keep dragging you into these wild shenanigans o'mine!" Rufus replied, "cuz ya seriously need to get yer head outta yer ass and find out what it means to have a REAL good time with our family?! What, ya think I was just gonna HAND ya over my darling little girl with no strings attached?!" Yeah, there was a good reason your dad hardly ever gets along with your mom's side of the family!

"Tell us about the treasure, grandpa," you had to change the subject before things got out of hand.

"Eh, I dont know much about it," he admitted, "but legend has it, this cult stole this priceless rarity straight from the temple of the holiest capital of the world itself!"
Your dad got interested, "they stole it straight from Jerusalem?"
"Ho yeah," gramps answered, "and since then, those cultist aint have nothing but bad luck since they brought it over to their place. Shitty weather, poisoned food, uncurable illnesses, you name it! Each one of 'em was dropping like flies... the last one of those culties that died claimed they saw an angel of death stalking him. Guess the Big Guys upstairs werent too happy wit their mischief." Dang. That is bad. And now that you learned that angels are indeed real, you can believe every word.

"And now you want US to go look for it?" your dad got scared for all the right reasons, "god help us."
"Tsk! Course god's gonna help us! That's why YOURE here!" gramps remarked, "you, Johnny, and Bert here are the best of us to get this job done! Janice woulda never let me go if she knew about it and let's face it... those others... they... uh... aint exact the sharpest knives in the crayon box."
"I'm working to get my PHd!" said Bert, "gotta figure out a cure for this toe SOMEHOW!"

This bit of tantalizing info still fails to provide your dad with assurance. Thinking about it, his concerns are justified. Why arent YOU getting as worried as he is?! You'd have PLENTY to worry about!
...Maybe it's that little good-luck charm your cute angelic mate left for you.

Speak of the bloody devil! You can see in the distance a certain short pink-haired girl in a cut up tank top and daisy duke shorts on the side of the road thinking her thumb out while holding a sign! The text was of a completely different language unfamiliar to you, but the purple glittery handwriting with a kiss-mark dotting the '!' was a dead-giveaway!

MEDEA!! At first you were absolutely thrilled to see her, but then you remember the guys with you... and where youre going! As the truck drives closer and closer toward the little angelic hitch-hiker of love, you ponder whether or not it'd be a good idea to bring her along. It could bring up tons of questions that youre probably gonna have a tough time answering, but if your dad's suspicions were correct, you were heading for unholy territory. At least you'd have one of God's little helpers with you, right?

...Provided going there to begin with wouldnt piss off the rest of the angels that might be out....
15533222221211111111.title: Bonding with the In-Laws

155332222212111111112.content:
While her opinion might be useful, you highly doubt that even she will condone going to that place. you wouldn't be surprised if she'd put us into a car accident to stop us. Even then that might be nothing compared to what other angels might do, but you can't afford to think about that right now. What you're more concerned with is the nature of this angel of death. Was it the Grim reaper or an actual angel? And if so is it still guarding that place? If it is then you're fucked. Something like that will easily wipe your group out, and if it knew about your encounter with the other angel's it might just choose you to be the first to die..

You had trouble hearing any of their conversation as you focused on trying to hide your face in a non suspicious way. Something you failed at as you resorted to pulling your collar up to hide your face until the car passed her. Hopefully she hadn't seen you, else she might have taken it the wrong way as most angels seem to when they encounter you. You focused on the changing scenery as you drove onward, trying to take your mind off of any impending dooms that might be awaiting you.

Soon enough you hear the car pull into a driveway made of gravel. Weeds grew rampant in between the stones and made the ride more than a little bumpy. Eventually the car rolls to a stop in front of a decrepit house. It looked to be abandoned for at least a decade. A tree grew from the veranda nearly blocking off the entrance entirely. Not like it mattered, most of the windows were broken anyway.

You stepped out of the car slowly behind the rest of your group. Your dad was saying something you couldn't quite hear, this house just gave you bad vibes. It felt unnatural making your skin crawl. Your grandpa was the first to head for the door, leaving you at the rear to follow them. Only your Dad seemed to share your feelings on the place. Walking onto the veranda you noticed that the wood was rotted and the paint peeling. The creaking beneath your feet gave you a sense of unease, it felt like the floor was trying to swallow you whole.

Everyone else headed into the bedroom next to the entrance while you noticed a small door down the end of the hallway. You felt compelled to walk towards it, though every fiber in your being was screaming not to split off from the group. Especially when an apparent angel of death may be lurking around the corner. This long hallway did a fine job at increasing your tension, messages scrawled on the walls were faded away leaving nothing but a strangely smudged stain.

The hallway was warped, making it look longer than it actually was. Soon enough you found yourself in front of it making you crouch down in front of it. You wiped the dusty door clean, gripping the door handle. Trying to pull it outwards you figured that it must swing inwards. It took more than a few tries to pound the door inwards. What you didn't expect was that pushing the door open resulted in you being thrown into open air, you barely had time to scream as you plummeted downwards.

You don't know how long you fell for, only that you had to take a breath to continue screaming before hitting the ground resulting in your immediate blacking out.

It couldn't have been to long afterwards that you awoke. Pulling your head up you noticed that you were in some sort of sacrificial chamber. Runes surrounded you, was some sort of magic at work here? Otherwise you don't know how you survived, or how any of those cultists got down here aside from the fall. Torches adorn the walls, they were lit. Someone obviously got here before you did. Looking around in the dim light you can see...
155332222212111111112.title: Just ignore her and drive past.

1553322222121111111122.content:
Alexandria! Well... looks like you're never going to see daylight again. She turned back with a surprised look that quickly changed into an expression of fury.

"I thought I warned you not to impede me! Now you shall face the consequences..." She said drawing a golden blade from the air itself. Was her mission to recover the relic?! From the way she's looking at me you, you can't help but back up. Looks like you're royally screwed as she takes a few test swings. Well, at least heaven would be free of any angels like her if it was any consolidation. You couldn't respond due to the anger shown on her face.

The room developed an odd chill that seemed to slow her down, though she still headed towards you. She still looked in the corners of her vision, almost like she thought something was there. You on the other-hand could barely move let alone think with your approaching doom. That all changed in a moment though as a cold wave of clarity washed over your mind and someone began to speak.

"You need to learn to be patient, how else are you going to call yourself an angel? You can't even appreciate his act of kindness, for shame." A strangely cold voice reverberated around the room bringing the approaching angel to a standstill. Her face contorted into a look of realization as she heard his voice. She looked around wildly, almost as if afraid which was anything but what you'd learnt to expect from her.

"Show yourself Demon!" She shouted, her voice had conviction but her face held anything but. A fact that seemed to worsen for her as she was met with laughter that surrounded the room. Oh crap, this was a demon?

"Please, I don't have to do anything; especially when you lack the conviction to follow through. At this rate I think I might be better suited to take your job. After all, we both know that if I wanted it, you'd be dead." The voice sighed making her head jerk again. "Sadly, I can't otherwise I'd be going against orders. You should be thanking the mortal, he's the only reason you're still alive." If you didn't know better, the voice sounded bored! Was he really so high up the chain of demons that he could instill fear in angel's? That set a whole new wave of terror over you, now the forces of hell wanted you? How much worse could your life possibly get?

"This boy?" She said, her voice taking on that same angry tone but she still wavered. "What does your kind want with him? Or do you think I won't kill him to get an answer out of you?!" She sounded desperate, but she was silenced when the voice took on a much more menacing tone.

"An angel willing to kill a mortal... and you dare call us monsters. Don't think you have any choice here, if you make a move for Jonathan I'll make sure to kill you before your foot hits the ground. Don't make the mistake of thinking I can't when many of your comrades fell the same way. Your harbinger of death knew that, she up and left this place the moment she heard I was coming." Jesus he scared death!? The shadows started to pull towards the altar like hundreds of snakes before it was rendered as black as you imagined the void to be. Soon after the shadows started to fall away like pieces of ash revealing a man sitting on the altar. He wore a black vest over his scarlet shirt, the likes of which could only be compared to blood. His irises held no color and were as black as the shadows the revealed him. His hair was slicked back against his head falling down to his neck, its blackness a contrast to his inhuman paleness.

The fact that he knew your name made you feel faint, he started to walk down the steps his footsteps leaving blackened stone beneath his feet. Alexandria started to move back slowly something you barely noticed as the demon approached.

"Girl surely you know of my name?" He said looking over your head at the angel who barely responded.

"Mephistopheles." She sounded slightly out of breath "The Devil's right hand." Well, that was just about enough to make you hate your life and every event that led up to this point. Seriously, someone that fucking powerful just had to take interest in you?! It's like you've won the worlds worst lottery.

"Good to see the man upstairs hasn't forgotten me." He said with a dark smile. "Though I much prefer the lower management. Someone like you would suit it, but even we have standards." Oh snap, that must have hurt. "So you may leave us, but not before I strike this day from your soul." He said holding his hand out before swinging it. You turned around just in time to see her fall to the ground unconscious. He could alter an angels mind? Of course, he's 2nd to the devil himself whereas she's not even a fully fledged angel yet. Just thinking about what he could do to you is enough to leave you paralyzed.

"L-Lea-" You could barely form a word, let alone a complete sentence with the panic attack you were experiencing.

"Calm down. Didn't you hear that I was here for you?" Yeah you did, and it's why you're freaking out so bad! "OK, bad way to word it. Look I'm not going to hurt you so stop with the panic attack. After I went to the trouble of saving you from that girl you don't trust me?" This allowed you to think for a moment, it didn't seem like trouble for him to do it but he did save you. He's also true to his word so far, he's standing right in front of you and hasn't done a thing.

"W-What do you want?" You ask, barely resisting the urge to vomit. The fear you felt with this guy compared to Alexandria was like comparing a forest fire to a candle. It just didn't quite stack up. He sighed and offered a hand to you, one you knew you should take lest he become annoyed. He pulled you to your feet like a rag doll and gave you a few light taps on the shoulder to steady you. His eyes were endless and you couldn't help but stare into them as he continued.

"Simple, I was told that you were having troubles with angels. Thus my sovereign sent me to find you and make you an offer." He said giving a brief smile. "We can make your life normal again, no more angels to bother you or threaten you." Right about now the deal was sounding pretty good, but you kept your opinions in reserve until he told you the price. "All you have to do is turn away from god."

"But I already have, I'm an atheist." You said not understanding what he meant.

"Yes, but that is merely walking the border, what I mean is to believe in us. Our power is what changes the world as we interfere in it, not god. He would sooner leave the world to rot than interfere, we at least give humanity the right to do as they please." What he was saying was true, but at the same time you didn't want to commit fully to an eternity of suffering even if you were heading there anyway. "I can understand any reservations, but be aware that you have a rare honor. My Sovereign wants to help you and will consider any requests."

"Why does he want to help me? Aren't there plenty of souls out there for the taking?" You ask, skeptical about the apparent 'honor'.

"Yes, but your's has a quality the likes of which this world hasn't seen in centuries. I was told not to force your hand. The offer will always be available, and I'm sure you'll grow to see it our way." He said folding his arms. Your spirit was worth that much huh? Then why exactly did the angels you'd meet treat you like no one special?
1553322222121111111122.title: Demons and Angels

155332222212112.content:
Time passed as you sat at the table waiting for the other family members to wake up. So much time passed that you were starting to fall back to sleep! Where was everybody? You looked at your clock. It was already 10am! You and the crew woulda finished breakfast and Uncle Jake's seventh story regarding his ex-wife's cat by now! They were never the type to sleep in during the yearly family outing!

This wasnt a coincidence! You nursed an ungrateful angel-in-training to health and a pink cherub tried to rape you in your sleep! Maybe there IS a demon that's gonna eat you! And he's starting with your family!!
You didnt have a gun (Uncle Hank had his taken away after rehab) and you didnt have pepper-spray either. You did have a decent splitting axe perfect for chopping firewood. Whether or not it'd work on the outer-worlders remains to be said, but it's all you got. You stash the axe in your jacket and head back to the tents.

"Guys?" you called out to them as you headed to the tents, "Guys, rise and shine! ...Guys? Mom? Uncle Bert? Aunt Christine? Grandma? Great Grandma? Great Great Grandma?" No response.

Scratch that. No family. The tents are all empty! Everybody's gone. The cars and trailers are still here, but everybody else is gone! They couldnt have just gone off on some sort of walk without you! At the very least, they'd leave a note.
And ever since that damn angel, youre gonna start assuming the worst! Now that you found out the hard way that your whole outlook on life was wrong, you'll never be the same again!

To make matters worse, the sky was reddish colored. There was an awful look of dusk up above. It's not even near the afternoon and already it's looking like the moon's gonna come out soon!
"What in the heck?" you muttered to yourself as you gazed up at the reddened sky. Something deep down inside you told you something bad was up. Something REALLY bad.

*Rrrrrrrrrrr....*

Oh crap! The earth rumbled! The ground below you shook! Quick, what did they teach you in earthquake drills?! The only one that came in mind in that split moment was to duck under the table and hold tight to it's leg!

Not long after ____ bursts from the ground!!

Fill in the blank!
155332222212112.title: Nobody but Me!

1553322222121122.content:
Suddenly, long vines began ripping from the ground!! Flowery but thorny vines tearing apart dirt and pavement like paper! Trees sprouted out of nowhere, pushing aside trucks and tents. Right under the table your hiding under, you were surrounded by sunflowers, posies, and pansies. Never in your life have cutesy fragrant flowers seemed so threatening. So what did they teach you in killer plant life drills? Uh... stop, drop, and roll?

"WHAT'S THIS?!! A HUMAN?!! A PESKY HUMAN DEFILING MY PRECIOUS GARDEN?!!!"

Hell's bells and enchanted sea shells! An incredibly thunderous commanding voice of a goddess shook the world around you! It sounded high-pitched with a hint of brattiness, but commanding nonetheless! The aura you felt from the Voice toppled Alexandria's by a mile.What did they teach you in angry merciless god drills?!

"STOP HIDING UNDER THAT STUPID TABLE, BUG!! COME OUT! NOW!!"

Oh right. Do as youre told.

"Y...y...yes, ma'am," you whispered in so low a voice, you couldnt hear it... yet youre betting SHE could! You crawl out and muster up the courage to gaze up at the ginormous goddess...
Uh... hm. She's not there. Yet her empowering aura still remains.

"Down here, you idiot!" shouted the goddess's voice in front of you... only below. You tilted your head and saw.... the God of Twerps glaring up at you. A cute little blonde girl with no eyelids wearing a dress decorated in roots and vines, wearing a thorny rose crown on her head, and a tiny rubbed-on tattoo of the planet earth just below her left eye. Your look of fear turned into a look of dumbfoundedness as she glared up at you with her hands on her hips! However, you still felt the godlike aura towering over you, so you kept your guard up.

"H...Hello," you put on a forced smile and greeted her.
"Hello, bug!" she still glared as she replied, "enjoying your little invasion of my garden?" The forest around you was completely covered in large vines, trees, and flowers. It was a thousand times more green than it started with! Nature went Montezuma's Revenge on this place!
"What did you do to this place?" stricken with shock and awe, you had the gall to ask.
"I only restored it to it's natural luster," the munchkin said, "you know... before your species made a mockery of it!" Your eyes widened as you looked back down at the young(looking) god.

“I am Gaia,” she introduced herself, “the mother of the former good-hearted guardians of this world that you mortals refer to as the Titans!” Oh crap! TITANS?! THE Titans?! The Titanic rulers of the planet before they were overthrown by their children, the Gods?! HELL’S BE-wait. She’s a Titan?

“Wait,” your look of fear went to dumbfoundedness again, “youre a Titan?”
"The MOTHER of Titans, to be exact," Gaia pounded her chest and proudly announced, lifting her chin. Despite her overwhelming aura giving you the heebie jeebies, you got curious.
"Er, no offense," you spoke, "...but... I... always thoughts Titans would be a little... uh... bigger." Famous last words!
"!!" Gaia's eyebrow twitched as her face started going red, "Y...ye....yeah... well... that's because your kind used to be incredibly tiny back then! I'd accidentally step on a few during my nature walk, they were so tiny!" She pounded her sandal as she said that. As funny as it was to make her sweat, comic relief didnt last long.

"You creatures have abused this sacred planet for far too long!" she spoke with absolute disdain, "cutting down trees, burning lively green land, robbing plant life, destroying the lives and homes of your fellow species for your own personal gain! Such a weak species capable of such destruction should be purged of this planet once and for all!" Oh crap. A nature Titan. A human-hating nature Titan!

"W-w-wait a minute there! You sh-" vines entangled your feet!
“Long have I and my children been sealed away by your ancestors and their precious babysitters. Long have we sit idly by and watched your ilk deface the sanctity of this planet like the filthy insects you are. Not anymore! Starting today, there'll be a new chapter in history! The green earth will be restored, your pathetic species will return back to the bottom of the food chain where it belongs, the reign of mankind will fall... and what will rise in it's stead is the glorious rule of the Titans!"

Jesus Christ! This was supposed to be a friendly outing with your distant folks! How did it turn into the revenge of Elder Gods?!

"Odd though," Gaia tilted her head as she looked up to you, "I thought there were more of you here. Where's everyone else?"
"I wish I knew," you sighed.
Gaia just shrugged her shoulders, "Oh well! Just means less mess." Gaia grinned up at you as the vines at your feet spread up your legs! "Congratulations! You get to be the first human to embrace the wrath of the mother of Titans!" Goodie.

"...GRRR!!" Suddenly, her grin into a glare again as she quickly turned around and smacked away a projectile of blinding light aimed at her! She already saw it coming! "Ugh! Ages later and you celestis STILL resort to wimpy sneak attacks?!" She even already knew who tried to attack her!

You guardian angel was none other than that angel-to-be herself! Alexandria! And still wearing your bandage!

Alexandria glared back. But not at Gaia.

"I was aiming for that nosey mortal, Titan!" Oh... she's harsh! Alexandria then turned her head to you, "I gave you a direct order to stay out of my affairs!" Ugh... why'd SHE have to save you?
"It wasnt exactly my choice!" you tried to explain, "the hell was I to know your mission involved the fucking Titans?!"
"Didnt I tell you to watch your mouth?"
"Watch THIS!"

Gaia snickered as she stepped toward Alexandria. "So the celestis hired a low-rank lackie to thwart the Titans' Dream World, eh? Where's your halo, little missy?"
"As if I need to explain myself to the likes of a dethroned god that can grow everything but herself!" Alexandria snapped.
"Have it your way, rookie!" the brat quipped, "how's about you scamper along and deliver a message to your boss? Tell him that this is between humans and Titans. And Heaven itself will crumble if they get between us again!"

As the two were at eachother's throat, you felt obligated to take the opportunity to escape! Gaia was at a pretty far distance from you. And you still had your axe. You could probably cut the vines and make a break for it. Lord knows you dont wanna be anywhere NEAR a fight between a Titan and an angel! This wasnt your business anyway! So why bother being where you werent wanted?
Then again, maybe you shouldnt run. Maybe Gaia'll get p'oed and vent her anger on you if you try to run! Then again, she was gonna vent her anger on you anyway, so what's the difference?

You had to think fast. And if you DID escape, you'd better hope you can RUN fast too!
1553322222121122.title: Remember the Titans!

15533222222211.content:
I couldn't believe I lost a bet. Now I have to go on a blind date. My name is Tyler Sampson. I am sixteen with black hair and green eyes. Currently I'm wearing dress pants and a dress shirt. I am waiting for my date in this resturaunt she requested. I knew nothing of the girl. The only thing I knew was that she was late. But, I heard the door open at the entrance. "I believe I have a dinner reservation..." said a very soothing voice. I looked over and nearly fainted. I saw my blind date, and man was she exotic! One thing was her body; DD cup breasts and wide hips. Her skin was deeply tanned. She had long brown hair that was down to her hips. She wore this strange-looking hair clip that resembled a cobra. Her face, was possibly more beautiful that her body. Her eyes were a deep blue that the ocean would be jealous of. Her hair covered one of these beautiful eyes. On her face were these black markings that were foreign to me. The dress she was wearing was bright green and hugged her body correctly. She prepared to sit, but I got up. Like a true gentlemen, I pulled out her seat and she sat down with a small giggle. I sat back down and greeted her.

"You must be my blind date" she said. Her accent was new to me but it seemed very nice.

"Yes I am" I replied. "My name is Tyler. It is a pleasure to meet you."

"My name is Xandra. It is a pleasure as well."

We continued to talk until our waiter came. I told her everything about me. Well, mostly everything. Xandra though was exotic, just like her. She grew up for a few years in a rainforest in South America before leaving to the U.S. She lives far in the woods but takes a routine trip to the city. Her parents are still together; which I find quite rare in most teens. She had a younger sister but she died before they came here. That memory caused her to cry, but I was there for her. I think she was starting to like me. I actually hoped that. I know what I said about going on a blind date, but WOW!

(I know the first one was kinda short but I will make them longer in the next ones.)

15533222222222212222222211.content:
To the north of the city of Negav and east of the Neko village, a small farm with a small family lived making a pathetic living. A mother, father, and one boy took care of a farm that they grow food on that they sold in Negav. They almost never made more than they spent and often broke even. they grow common foods from other worlds and today was harvest day. the father picked and harvested the crop. The mother cleaned it. And the boy took it to Negav to be sold.

"Now take good care of this crop boy. It's how we make a living." the father said to his boy only 16 years old.

"I'll take good care of it. Negav is only a day away so I'll be back in three days." The Boy said proudly as he left in cart pulled by the family horse. the mother and father waved they're boy goodbye not even knowing if he was safe or would return home.....

The place it thick with humidity, the insects are buzzing, and all around you the sounds of the rainforest go on unimpeded. New Discovery, every day, that is what happens in this place. New Species, new life, new knowledge that can help man to better itself. It's the only place on earth that could offer that, save the ocean. And this was easier to get too, though arguably more dangerous.

You where four days in now, solo mission. You'd had survival training, And things where going well. Until you went to the river. On your way there, the sounds of the jungle stopped, and so did you. You looked, listening intently. You though it would be a leopard, you focused on the tree line. Big mistake.

The Anaconda Lunged forward, grabbing you leg, and taking it out form under you. You tried to draw your revolver, you knife, anything to defend yourself, but it drug you fast along the ground, it's coils getting a solid hold on you, and it started to squeeze. Horror tore through you, you fought with all your strength, but there was just no way to win, not against this thing, It was Fifty feet long, had the leverage, and you couldn't reach your weapons. You just didn't have the strength.


And then, a mighty hand forced it's way in, pulling, hard, and the serpent came free. A shadow of a massive figure was in your vision as you gasped for breath, and a grunt could be heard as it bodily threw the snake, a splash indicating it had made it more then a hundred yards to the river!

The figure took something form a small pack at it's waste, and did something, muttering in a language you didn't understand. And then it spoke.

"Are you well, man?"

The way it said it was not slang. It was almost like it felt the need to differentiate your Gender.

"I'll, live, just gotta, catch my breath." You gasped back as you recovered. "Do you, speak, English, then?"

"No, our magics let us talk to the people of mans world, let us be in it undetected when we must, and let us remain hidden from it. "

This confused you, but you were less interested as you finally got a look at the woman who had rescued you when she moved out of the direct sunlight.

You know the old expression 'Selling your soul to the devil'? Of course you have. Most will tell you that there is no prize, NO PRIZE that is worth selling your soul to the devil over. But most have never had the opportunity. And those that HAVE might say otherwise.
Lucifer was an angel of pride and irresistible charm. It knew what you desired. It knew how badly you desired it. It knew how to tempt you with it. And it knew there was little you could do to resist it's oh-so-generous offer outside of divine intervention. It has tempted millions throughout the ages that were smarter, stronger, and far more clever than you. You were just a kid, after all.

It began just before your graduation of elementary school. Before finally passing the 6th grade and moving on to middle school where you'd finally be qualified to call yourself a 'teenager'. Your friends were excited and couldnt wait to finally graduate to the 7th grade. You on the other hand were in no mood to celebrate. You werent in a mood to do much of anything except worry. Worry for your little sister's life. She's still in that hospital, clinging hopelessly to life. You always walked with her across the street on your way to school. It was your obligation as a big brother to protect her and make sure nothing bad happened to her. The day you had to stay home sick and she decided to walk herself to school like a big girl... she was hit by a speeding car.

So many wounds, so many broken bones, so much blood loss. The doctors said the damage was critical and that she might not have long to live. She grows weaker as the days go by. She wont have long to live. At this rate, she might not live long enough to see you graduate.
You promised you'd protect her! You couldnt bear to let your little sister die! You'd give anything to save her! ANYTHING!

Anything.

That's when the nightmare began.

"Mi....chael.... Mi....chael..."

In the middle of the cold absolute darkness, you heard a voice call out to you. It sounded young and feminine.
"Mmmmmiiiiicchael!! Mmmmicccchhaaeelll!!!"
Another voice called out to you. It sounded harsh and raspy, like it had the worst case of strep throat!
"MICHAEL!! MIICHAEEEELLL!!!!!! MICHAEL!!!"
Another voice roared which sounded deep and grizzly as it the shook the invisible ground around you!

More voices called out your name from all directions! Up down left right, EVERYWHERE a 'Michael'!
Suddenly, big red glowing eyes lit up the darkness. Pairs of red eyes all around you, staring deep into your timid body.
For the first time in your natural life, you felt absolute unrivaled soul-chilling terror. You didnt really notice how badly you were sweating though you did feel your stomach tying in knots! You didnt know what those things were and you hoped that you'd never find out. Each one of them knows your name. Imagine what else they know about you.

Suddenly, a bright soothing light shines in the middle of this cold darkness. It felt soothing and comforting, as if assuring that everything's alright. But something deep down told you not to relax. The blissful light shining was not a good one. You continued to tremble in the bright heavenly placebo.
Not long after, the chilling darkness faded away and you found yourself in the middle of a fancy garden. With plenty of statues all over the place. Each one had an expression of horror in their face with their jaws open if they were in the middle of screaming. Before you could question it, a warm alluring light appeared on the grass in front of you and shined toward the direction of the gazebo in the middle of the garden. Like a naive lamb blindly being led to slaughter, you follow the lit up grass directing to the gazebo.

The source of that alluring light came from a beautiful young girl in the blue and white dress sitting aside a table sipping tea.
The girl, who looked who looked to be your age, even from a distance, was breath-taking. You can see her golden-blonde hair sparkling with joy, no friggin lady-shampoo commercial could secure a set of hair so shiny and gorgeous and alive and not having a single breaking strand (yes, you can notice!). Her lovely serene peach-skinned face lacked any unnecessary wrinkles, zits, blackheads, and looked incredibly smooth, your hand BEGGED to stroke her cheek.. let alone did your lips beg to press against her soft smooth cherry red lips!
Her bright shining sky-blue eyes gazed at you hypnotically, nearly sending your feeble mind in a trance as you dumbly approached her. Something deep down told you to keep your distance from her, but the rest of your body didnt listen!

"!!!" You suddenly flinched when she flicked her golden hair and smiled your way. In a split second flashed the sight of six big beautiful feathery wings sprouting from her back. It was only a quick second, but the image remained in your head.
You spotted her necklace which had a medallion with an unfamiliar V-like sigil engraved on it. Something deep down told you to were WAY too close to her!

"Michael!" she spoke in cutesy adorably uppity voice that warmed your heart (yet chilled something deep down), "I've been expecting you! Please, sit down! Sit!"
Still speechless at her presence, you nodded and sat in the chair opposite of her. You swallowed hard as the heavenly aura about her entwined your cold body.
"So..." you finally muster the courage to speak, "...who are you?"

She almost drops the cup when you said that! One of the orbs in her blue eyes widened almost with surprise!
"Wh...who am I?" she repeated with a surpised smile, "who am I?" She set her cup down and stood up, "WHO. AM. I. Ahahahah!" She started her laugh a gentle, yet ecstatic laugh. "Hahahaha! Who am I! Youre joking! Youre clearly joking. Dear child... you already know who I am. I need no introduction! Only someone who has never stepped outside or at the very least read a book or turned on the tv in his entire life would not know who I am!"
Before you could deny it, something deep down within you had a very good guess who she is... and is scared shitless because of it!

"I went by many names throughout the ages and I doubt you never heard a single one of them! I have seen many nations rise and fall. Witnessed many events that revolutionized history as we know it. I was written in many books and poems, songs, television shows, you name it! Bringer of the Dawn. The Morning Star. The Prince of Light."
*zip*
Suddenly, she zipped at lightning speed and appeared right behind you!
"The Angel of Beauty," she whispers in your ear!
*zip*
"WHOA!!" you shouted in surprised when she reappeared inches away from your face!
"The Great Seducer," her soothing breath blew in your face as she spoke.

She then walked back toward her chair, "And the best damn fiddler player the world has ever known! ...ER... the SECOND." She then turned back to you and grabbed the folds of her dress and curtsied before sitting back in her chair, "...Pleased to meet you. Hope you guess my name!"

The something deep down was right! You knew EXACTLY who 'she' was! As much as you wanted to deny the existence of the greatest fallen angel known to man, you couldnt.
Noticing something clicked in your head, 'Lucy' smirked as she sipped her tea. You could almost hear the faint screaming of thousands of tortured mortals in that cup!

You knocked the table over and dash out of the gazebo like a bat out of... well anyway!

"Youre welcome to leave anytime," you hear her voice echo in your mind, "I wont keep you here against your will. ...But do you wish to deny yourself the only chance to save your sister?"

You stopped running. The bitch knew about your sister. You turned around to see Lucy already standing before you smiling.

"What do you mean?" you questioned her.

"Exactly as I said," she spoke, "your sister's condition is critical. Fate has decided not to be generous with her. By the time you wake up from this wonderful dream... she's going to die."
You paled at those words. You wanted to scream your head off at her, but youre not that stupid!

"However, I can save her," Lucy said, "I guarantee you that with a wave of my hand, she'll make a startling recovery! And then she'll be right as rain and be back at school dodging stray cars in no time!" Smart mouthed...
"You... can seriously do that?"
"You already know the answer to that question!" the prideful angel said with a wink, "and I think you know what I want in return!"

THE CATCH.

"My soul," you whispered in horror.
"BINGO!" she snapped her in your face, "but dont worry. I wont claim it NOW. I dont need it YET. I'm gonna give you plenty of time to spend with that brat, to appreciate how lucky she is to have a big bro like you. And after 6 years from this day... right after you graduate high school... I'll come back. To claim what's owed to me." 6 years. That's quite a bit of time... but then it's an ETERNITY! You wont get to experience becoming an adult before your soul becomes doomed.

But... if what's she's saying is true.... if you refuse, your sister will....

"Ahem! Mikey? Wakey wakey!" she derailed your train of thought, "we dont have much time left! I'm a very busy woman! Will you accept my ever so generous offer? Or that poor little girl not important enough to you?!"
15533222222222222122222222.title: Pleased To Meet You. Hope You Guessed My Name!

155332222222222221222222221.content:
After thinking for a few seconds, you reach the conclusion that you don't have any other option if you want your little sister to live. Sure, you could wait and see if the medics could help her, but then it might be too late and she might not make it. You certainly don't like the idea of making a deal with the Lady of Hell, Lucifer, but, right then, it seemed like the only thing you could do.

'...deal.' you said through clenched teeth.

'I'm sorry, could you repeat what you just said, please?' she toyed with you, very well aware of what you had said.

'I said that we have a deal.' you repeated, unwilling to turn the most dangerous demon into your enemy with your sister's life on the line.

'That's very good to hear, Michael. It's good to see you're so wise even when you're so young.' She mocked and acknowledged at the same time.

'Don't get me wrong. I'm not giving my soul out of fear, as many have surely done when they were here. I'm an atheist. I don't believe in God's existence, and that translates into me not believing in your existence as well. But I've seen what you can do, and you're my best choice. If you want my soul in exchange for my sister's life, take it. Six years by her side are worth it. But first, we need to set some terms to this deal, and that isn't negotiable.' You swear you didn't know how you managed to talk to the fallen angel like that, but you certainly hope she doesn't get angry or it's your ass.

However, instead of angry, she seemed somewhat amused.

'Some nerve you have to talk to me like that, HUMAN. It's been ages since anyone has done it. More accurately, since I was cast out of Heaven...' her face flinched for a moment and then Lucy, caressing her golden hair, turned to you and continued speaking. 'Well then, let's hear those terms YOU need to set in order to feel safer.'

Oh, no. Those terms weren't for you to feel safer, at least not about yourself. You knew that if she wanted, your soul would already be in her hands. Those terms were meant for another thing even more important than your own life.

'First thing: you'll heal my sister fully, not only from the injuries of the accident. This means, if she was going to have cancer, or she has a broken bone from before, you'll heal her. Second: you will not play any role in my sister's future, nor will any of your underlings. After this, you'll leave her alone from your presence. Third: you will not harm my sister, even if indirectly. Fourth: her soul will not be for you. She will stand by God's Right for all Eternity. These terms aren't negotiable as well.' you were shaking in fear, a fear so primary and absolute that, were you in any other situation, you would have already collapse. But the vivid image of your sister laying in her hospital bed, unable to do anything but trying to fight a hopeless battle against Fate, gave you the strength and resolve you needed for this inhuman task.

You sighed hard and looked at Lucy, who seemed a bit off.

'Strange. I thought some of the terms would be related to you. Humans tend to prioritize themselves over anything. Strange and interesting indeed. Very well. I shall give you what you desire. I, the Morning Star, swear upon mine name to fulfill the deal made with thee.' She said the last part using an archaic form of speech you had only read about.

'And that's it. Now is my turn to work.' She closed her blue eyes and extended a hand toward the sky, which changed from blue to red in a moment before returning to the soothing blue.

After a few minutes (or so you thought), she opened her eyes a gazed directly into yours, like she was staring into your very soul (and you could swear she was doing just that, as if she was checking the quality of an item after buying it) and said the three words that made you happier than ever before:

'It is done.'

'F-for real?' you asked without thinking too much.

'Are you, per chance, doubting my words?' her voice turned too hellish for you likening and you saw her right hand turn into a claw as she rested her head on it and grinned a bit angrily, with the cheek on the palm. She had also spread her six wings!

'N-no!' you shouted, afraid. 'Of course not! It was just... too good to believe. I'm very sorry.' You bowed your head., hoping that that would calm her down a bit.

'Is that so? Well, in any case, you are forgiven. Funny, I think it's the first time I've ever said that.' She giggled and, for a moment, you caught a glimpse of her as a normal girl. However, you were too much aware that that was just a lie. A lie she had been improving since millenniums ago.

'I believe it is time for you to wake up. Our business here it's finished.' She turned around.

'Thank you.' You said sincerely.

'Save it. You might want to wait until your soul is mine. However, the thanks are.. appreciated.' You could have sworn she had blushed, if just for a nanosecond. 'Oh, and by the way, if God notices that Fate hasn't gone the way he wanted, and believe me, he always notices, he will probably send someone to... deal with it. But, do not fear. My underlings will... protect you and your sister. That is, without breaking the second term of our deal Though I'm not very sure they'll like the job.'

'What---' Your complaint was silenced when she approached you and gave you a kiss on the forehead, standing a bit on her tiptoes.

'Now, go with my blessings. We'll see each other in six years. Or perhaps sooner...'


You woke up with you clothes completely soaked and an expression of fear and amazement on your face, or so you felt. You sat on the bed and gently massaged your temples, making sure that hadn't been an extremely realistic dream. However, you were very sure it wasn't a dream (at least, not an usual one) because of the lingering sensation of Lucy's cherry lips pressed against your forehead. Sure, some dreams were so real that you still felt the sensations even after you had awakened, but you were damn sure dreams didn't left a lipstick mark on your forehead!

You got out your bedroom, entered the bath, closed the door and, having abandoned the idea of sleeping, washed your face and wiped the lipstick gently (just in case the Lady of Hell was watching you!). While you were still drying your face and trying to take all the information at once, you heard someone hit the door REALLY hard.

'Michael! Michael!! Get out!!'

It was your mother. You sighed, finished drying your face and opened the door.

'Yes, mom? What is it?'

'It's... it's...' she said out of breath.

'Mom, calm down. Breathe and then tell me what is it.' You tried to calm her down.

She did as she was told and resumed talking.

'It's your sister! Elisa! The doctor said... he said that she was recovering!'

Obviously, you knew this. But it was still shocking to hear it. Your sister, who had been just a few heartbeats away from dying, was now starting to recover, and soon she would be just as she was before the accident, perhaps even better, and all thanks to you. That made your eyes well up with tears and embrace your mother while both of you sobbed and cried in joy.

'Hurry up and get ready! Your father is getting the car ready. We're going to the hospital right now!'

You nodded and ran to your room. After that, you dressed up quickly and got down the stairs three by three, You got in the car as quickly as you had done all of those things and all three of you departed toward the hospital.

The half an hour the trip took was the longest one in your whole life (excluding the time that you had been with Lucy, obviously). When you reached the hospital, the doctor made you wait in the waiting room for another half and hour, and your heart was racing like crazy. When the doctor finally came to talk to you, you felt relieved.

'Mr. Evans, Mrs. Evans. I'm very happy to inform you that your daughter is recovering at an amazing speed.' He said, with a faint smile in his face. You felt a bit bad when he didn't bother to mention you, but you stood still and continue listening.

'In fact, it's such an amazing speed that it almost looks like.. well, I shouldn't say this, being a doctor and all, but... it almost looks like magic. It must be that new surgery method. We definitely need to adapt it to our whole hospital right away.' The last part wasn't about your sister, but you couldn't care less. She was okay! She was recovering! That was all that mattered. You silently thanked Lucy again and continue to listen again.

'She is sleeping right now, but I believe in two or three days, maybe even less at this rate, you will be able to talk to her.'

'Can we see her now, doctor?'

'Of course. Please, follow me.' He started to walk and you all followed him. When you entered Elisa's room and saw her sleeping so peacefully, her life no longer threatened, you started to cry again.

Your mother kindly embraced you as she said:

'It is a miracle. This is God's doing, no doubt. Thank you, Lord.'

'No, mom,' you said bitterly. 'God had no part in this. That, I assure you.'

'Michael, I understand that you don't believe in Him, but please, do not say that.'

'Whatever. I'm not going to ruin this moment.'


A few days went by and your sister got out of the hospital. You greeted her crying and embraced her with all your might, a gesture she returned the same way. That same week, she resumed school, and you made sure to go with her all the times. You trusted Lucy, after all she had done, but you didn't want to take any chances with Fate ever again. A certain day, while you were walking to school with her, you got a weird feeling and itching all over your body. Somebody was watching you, or at least you REALLY felt that way. But was the feeling true, or it was just your imagination?

1553322222222222212222222211112112.content:
You felt a strong fearsome aura watching over from afar.... then you suddenly felt the fearsome aura stop watching you. Then a few seconds later the fearsome aura was watching you again. Then the fearsome aura seemed to dimmer as if it was dozing off. Then the fearsome aura gleamed brighter as if forcing itself to stay awake. But then the fearsome aura decided 'Screw it' and glimmer out and you could hear almost hear snoring in the distance on cue with the glimmer out!

"Hm. That was weird," you said to yourself.
"What's weird, Mike?" your sis asked you.
"Um... n...nothing!" you lied to her, hoping to keep her from learning the truth of her miraculous recovery as long as possible, "let's hurry. We dont want to be late."
"Ok, Mike!"
As the two of you headed to school, the fact that your soul is sold clouds your head and will continue to cloud your head for a long time. You shoulda known better than to make such a deal with the Devil, but it was either that or lose your sister. Sooner or later, she had to know the truth. But until then, you were gonna keep it mum until you could find a way to explain it to her.

A year had past since that horrible night. Youre halfway through the end of jr high and you still remember the deal. Your attitude towards others changed a bit and you distanced yourself from your friends since. Sure, you were confident enough to join the school's soccer team, but you never hung out with any of them after the game. Heck, you didnt so much as join them for the pizza party after winning the city championship!

Oh, and dont think Lucy hasnt forgotten about you! During your thirteenth birthday party, your mom said a friend from your school came by and dropped off a nice little present. The words 'From Lucy' was a dead giveway but to avoid suspicion, you had to open your birthday present in front of EVERYBODY! She got you a nice little necklace with a V-shaped sigil you remembered her wearing in your nightmare. With it was a note that read 'Hope you didnt forget! Love, Lucy!'
"Who's Lucy?" your mom asked.
"Uh... just a friend who I owe a favor too!" was your best response that may/may not be true.
"What did she hope you didnt forget, Mike?" your sis just HAD to ask!
"Just the little favor. Nothing big," was definitely not true!
The next morning, you tossed that damn necklace in the lake! But later that night, you found it sitting next to your bed completely clean and dry with a note that read 'DONT EVER DO THAT AGAIN! Love, Lucy!' You lowered your head with a mixture of shame and fear, making it even harder to sleep.

Of course, waking the hell up was no issue thanks to the fearsome aura you felt inches away on your very bed with you!
Your basic animal instinct assume a fearsome demonic grizzly beast staring hungrily at you ready to sink it's jaws into your throat!

"Zzzzz...."

...Or taking a nap. Still, considering that the aura was still fearsome, you took no chances and slowly crept away until you finally got off your bed. Fortunately, the demon didnt follow you. It didnt even wake up. You gazed questionably at the large lump in your bed hogging all your blanket and snoring away.

"Zz...zz.z....ZZZZZ....zzz... zzZz. ZZ! ZZZZ!! zzzZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZzzzzz!!!!"

"Jesus!!" you gasped in horror at the sudden beastly snore that didnt sound like something a human throat could make! It left chills down your spine. Despite this, you got way too damn curious and gotten closer to the sleeping demon wrapped in blanket!
Against your better judgement, you pulled back the blanket.

You squinted your eyes at the tall slighty corpulent brunette in a black nightgown with cartoony pictures of little sleeping devils on it. The fearsome aura was overflowing from this girl! Despite this, wondering what she's doing in your bed outranked the animal instinct!

"Hey! Wake up! Get up!" you said, constantly shaking her around!

"Zzzz....e..r... wh... huh?" she took her slowly waking up as she turned her head your direction. Even after shaking off the sleep, she stared at you sleepily barely opening her widened brown eyes (possibly enlarged like she was in a dream state!) as you noticed the thick dark bags under her eyes.
"...Oh... hey," she said lazily with little to no care. She even tried to go back to sleep until you shook her up again.
"What are you doing in my bed?!" you questioned her.
"Sleeping," she lazily answered.
"I know THAT!" you almost raised your voice, "why are you here?!"

She just stared at you for a couple seconds registering that question like her brain was on dial-up "...Oh... Oh! That Lucy girl sent me."
"Lucifer?" you questioned.
"Yeah...what time is it?"

You gazed at the clock. It was almost time to get up and get ready for school! Dang it! Lucifer FINALLY sends somebody to protect you TODAY of all days?!
"Who are you?" you asked.
"Bel....uh..." she squinted her eyes a little as if forgetting her name, "...Bel... something. I forget." You facepalmed, but quickly registered a possibility who this particular demon might be!

"Belphegor?"
"Oh yeah! That's it! Heh," Bel laughed a little, "...could you massage my neck? I think I pulled something there in my sleep." Awesome. Lucy possibly had thousands up thousands of suitable demons to watch over you... and she chooses one that represents SLOTH?! Then again, should you really be all that surprised? Lucifer is well known to be a cruel manipulative dick! This might be part of her sick sense of humor! She's probably laughing her ass off, watching you suffer with Bel!

"Bel," you tried to calm yourself down, "you gotta get up. If my parents find out youre here in my room, they're gonna freak and-"
"Eh, nevermind, I'm sure the pain'll go away soon. Zzzz..." she actually fell asleep in your grip!
"Bel! Wake up!" you get tired of her so fast!
"Zz..w..wh...what?"
"This isnt the time to be sleeping!"

"Y... yeah, youre right," she agreed, "I'm supposed to be protecting you from the Fallen." The Fallen?
"The Fallen? Who are the Fallen?" you began to tense up worrying about that name.
"I'll tell you in a couple hours... g'night!" she pulled herself out of your grip and lied back on your bed, immediately going back to sleep! Man was your blood-pressure going off the charts!

"Bel! Bel, get up! Get up now!" no matter how much you shook her or shouted in her ear, she was not getting up! She was much heavier than she looked, so just rolling her over was nearly beyond your strength! "C'mon, Bel! Wake up! Wake up before-"

"Michael! It's time to get up! Breakfast is ready!"

You froze up when you heard your mom call out! You were not only running out of patience, you were running out of time! How are you gonna explain a girl sleeping in your bed refusing to budge, let alone that girl being a demonic embodiment of the Sin of Sloth!
"Bel, c'mon you gotta get up!" you whispered to her, still shaking her, "if mom sees you, I'm gonna get in trouble."

"Zzzz..." she curled up in your blanket, offering no care.
"Bel please wake up!" you still pleaded and still shook her, "we dont have much time!"
"Zz...mm...MMmmph!" Bel began to squirm, pushing your struggling away, which kinda made you mad!
"I said wake up! WAKE UP!" then finally with one hard push!

*THUMP!*

She fell off the bed and landed on the floor! You flinched in fear hoping you didnt hurt her... or piss her off!
"Bel, Bel I'm sorry! I didnt mean to do that! Are you alri-"
"ZZZZZZZZ!!!!" she's STILL sleeping! The regret for your action immediately vanished! Now you wanted to KICK her awake!

"Michael! Didnt you hear me? Breakfast is ready!"

You didnt have much time left at this point! Better think of something fast!
