15533222222222222222222121212.content:
(Note: I dont care what anybody else calls him. I'M calling him Jeremiah Westwayne!)

You felt quite a bit different than what you were much earlier. Physically, you dont notice anything different about yourself. No wings or claws or devil horns or centipede-like appendages, etc! Yet, you feel different... somehow.

"What... happened to me?" you spoke out.

"In ackschange fur a share of ya mortal burack enahgy... I gavuh you a taste of my divine powah."

You heard another voice answer your question. A voice you didnt hear earlier. A young yet heavily accented voice. High pitched, kinda cute, sounds even younger than you, but the aura given about it demanded authority.
You squinted your eyes at the young Japanese woman standing where Izanami used to be. This tall beautiful black haired (slightly braided) woman with fair peach skin, purple mascara coating her slanted eyelids, pointed elf-like ears, enlarged pupils in the middle of her shining silver eyes, a black Shinto symbol tattooed on her forehead, wearing a thick warm pink kimono sparkling with glittering golden designs (you wouldnt be surprised if they were in fact REAL gold!). Even if you didnt know by heart who this woman is, the kanji ring on her finger, the kabuki mask in her hand, and the white snake slithering around her wouldve given it away!

"I...I....IZANAMI-SAMA?!" you shouted in a mixture of disbelief AND awe. To say she was gorgeous wouldve been an understatement. She was HEAVENLY!

Izanami giggled as she pulled out an oriental fan, "Hohohoho... you may stop durooling now, Westwayne-kun!" You wiped the drool off your lip as she spoke, "sadiry, zis is only an irrusionary image of my fahmer self. Da enahgy I ackwired furum you is still rimited, but 'as potential to gurow."
You glanced over at the reflection of her in the pond... still revealing her corpsy form.
"I see." That's one hell of a magic trick.
Even the demonic creatures around you had human forms in tattered clothes, military uniforms, and broken samurai armor. Perhaps these were their previous lives before their damnation?

Izanami squinted her eyes and gave a cutesy smile, SO ungodly like, " 'Owevah, dis sample of powah does not eben compare to what I've gibben YOU! You havuh notting to fear from yo Whitah Gouncil anymore!" Nothing to fear, she says? You looked down at your palms, curious at what kinds of magic she has just given to you in exchange for what you gave her. Considering this game from the Goddess of the Dead herself, you'd be lying if you said you werent slightly terrified. You were reckless with the magic you already had.

"I berieve we havah spent more dan enough time here, Westwayne-kun," it sounded a little odd she was now calling you 'Westwayne-KUN! "In cereburation of my newbound freedom, I am curious tah know how my rand has changed throught dhe ages. Would yoo kindury show me around?" You dare not assume this was some sort of 'fancy' way of her asking you out on a date! Perhaps your newbound knowledge was telling you otherwise, but you flat out ignored it and just believed she wanted to know how her country looks in modern-day.

You humbly bowed, despite your newbound knowledge telling you it was no longer necessary, "As you wish, Izanami-sama."
She giggled at your continuing show of loyalty as she fanned herself.

"/My loyal children! Let us depart from this fallen shrine quickly before the authorities arrive!/"

Izanami gave that order to her followers... in Japanese! And you understood every word completely! Another taste of your newbound power from Izanami, perhaps?

"/You heard the Goddess, men!/" the slightly aged samurai with the fancy mustache announced, "/ONWARD!!/"

"/YES!!!/" announced the others.

But before you could depart with them, you turned your attention back to the poor Miko who's now lying on the ground unconscious.
"What about her?" you asked.
"She wirr rive," Izanami casually replied, "an' when she wakes, she wirr remember notting of what 'appened to her." You hope so. Still, you couldnt help but stare at that poor girl. As the others marched out of there, you sensed someone glaring behind you. You turned around and saw the samurai with the fancy mustache staring at you, showing little emotion on his face.

He squinted his eyes. "/I see doubt in this foreigner's eyes/" he spoke in Japanese, "/It is REALLY a good idea for Ms. Izanami to trust THIS lowly boy to be her head knight?/" Did he assume you couldnt understand a word he's saying?!
"/Oh, come off your high-horse, Oda-san!/" rattled a middle-aged grey bearded man in a WWII military uniform, "/we're finally out of that damn place! Tonight's the tonight we should be celebrating!/" After grey-beard left, Oda still stared at you with a distrusting look, but moved along with the others.

*Ding ding-a ding DING!*

Just then, your cellphone went off. Since you were kind of away from the revived Hellspawn's attention, you checked your phone. You got a text message your dad. On your phone, the message read 'Where are you?'
Oh right. Your dad! You never told him you left! You just didnt have the heart to worry him with the fact that youre wanted for murder by the White Council. Well, he's probably worried about you now!

You didnt wanna tell him what you did, but he's still your dad. He's the last member of your family left. You'd only feel even more miserable if you keep even MORE secrets from him!
But how the HELL (no pun intended) are you gonna be able to explain to him you freed a Goddess from Hell?!

You were walking in a forest, near your home during one evening, when you had the sudden felling that you were being watched.

"Who goes there!?" you called out. Everywhere you looked did not reveal the presence of your stalker.

"Why, your future girlfriend, foretold to find you by the priestess of my village..." A melodious feminine voice called out from around you.

"Show yourself then!" You demanded, while stopping in place in an attempt to hide your anxiousness from the mystery lady.

"So turn around. I'm right behind you." the mystery lady replied.

When you turned around, you gasped. From the ears, you recognized the lady as a...

---

Extra info time!

Regular elves have a high tenancy to look down on you, prefer forests over everything else, and can be a bit too preachy at times. But their potential upside is they stick with a code of conduct and are willing to hear your side of a argument/story/debate, even if they don't feel like talking to you at the moment. Of course, you might meet the rare Elf who is kind,sweet, and caring toward everyone. If you do meet with that kind of Elf, count your blessings and hope her family doesn't try to separate the two of you.

Dark elves like to fight, prefer low-lit places, and have a fondness for spiders. They have a great desire to be the one in control of the relationship, but some people claim that a few secretly want the guy to fight back and dominate them. They also have a hidden jealous streak a mile wide, so if you find yourself in a relationship with one, avoid talking to any other women at all costs. Because if you do, She won't kill you, but she will make your life very unpleasant for quite a while. You better hope that she isn't a wiz at creating potions.

1553322222222222222222222222222221.content:
Our story begins one dark and rainy day in Texas when a young man was driving down the street in what appeared to be a Cadillac car. This young man was Trent and he was driving to work in his father’s car. His father had borrowed Trent’s own truck to go to a flea market. “I hope that Dad doesn’t bring home another “Bigfoot” foot fossil. This obsession with cryptids is really beginning to bug me.” Trent’s father was a self-proclaimed cryptozoologist who claimed to have seen Bigfoot and had been tracking him for years. Trent himself didn’t believe in the supernatural and doubted the existence of cryptids. Of course, he was 24 and had never been on a date in his life. This gave Trent a cynical outlook on life. It didn’t help matters that working for a Mexican restaurant was the closest excitement that he got in his life. The customers at his workplace were eccentric bordering on insane but by now he had gotten so accustomed to such strange happening that he had fallen into depression. The reason he took the job in the first place was an attempt to meet a beautiful girl, but so far, none of the female customers ever interested him. It was as if there was a certain quality that he was looking for and never found.

Trent just let out a sigh and then came to a red light. "Houston just isn't what it used to be. I gotta get out of here." Trent then heard thunder and looked in the sky over the traffic light. "The rain is really coming down hard today. And it's not even noon." But then something flew through the sky that looked too big to be a bird. "Huh?" asked Trent. Trent took a closer look and saw that the creature flying through the sky was large and heavily built but surprisingly humanoid and it appeared to have arms and wings and horns and a tail with sharp talons. Trent's jaw dropped and while he was trying to figure out what he saw, he heard a honking noise and turned around to see he was holding up traffic. The light had turned green. The young man momentarily had to forget what he saw and drive off towards his destination.

15 minutes later, Trent had arrived in the parking lot of El Rodadoro, the very restaurant at which he was employed. His first reaction was to take out his cell phone and contact his father. At that moment, Trent's father was at the flea market and was observing what he believed to be the skeleton of a gremlin in a jar when the phone ran. "Hello?" asked Trent's father. "Dad!" yelled Trent on the phone. "On my way to work, I saw something amazing." Trent's father's eyes popped and he put down the gremlin jar he was observing. "Did you see him, son. Did you see Bigfoot?" "Not Bigfoot!" yelled Trent. "Bigfoot can't fly! What I saw was a large flying creature with leather wings, the horns of a demon and sharp talons! I don't know exactly what it was since it was too cloudy to get a good look but it looked like a gargoyle." "Impossible," said Trent's father. "The only area in North America where gargoyles live is in New York. With one exception. Wait. You're in Texas and you're not that far from Houston's NASA base. You must've seen Frank Shaw's Gargoyle." "I'm not sure what I saw, Dad. Listen, I've got to go to work in a few minutes. I'll call you again later.”

Trent hung up on the phone and let out a sigh. “And now for reality to win over fantasy.” The young man walked up to his post behind the counter but surprisingly there was nobody there in the form of customers. “Well look at that,” said Trent. “It’s raining so hard that not even the freaks are coming out. Heck, I don’t even see Isaiah today? Where is that boss of mine?” Trent noticed a not left on the counter and picked it up to read it. “Dear, Trent. I’m feeling under the weather and couldn’t make it to work. I’m going to need you to be in charge for the next few days. I am expecting a new employee today to help you out. She will be working as the waitress for El Rodadoro and recently arrived from France. Her name is Monique and I believe it is only fair to warn you. She looks somewhat unusual. Do not give her any reason to feel uncomfortable in Houston. Signed, Isaiah.” Trent rolled his eyes. “It’s about time he hired somebody else. I keep telling that idiot that we need more employees in here than just him and me. Looks like he finally listened. Hmm. A young lady all the way from France. Hmm. This might be just what I need to spice up my life.” Trent looked in the window and adjusted his glasses and then fixed the collar on his shirt.” He gave a smile and then he heard the door to El Rodadoro open up.

"Bonjour?" asked a female voice in a French accent. "C'est le Rodadoro." "Huh," said Trent not looking to see the new employee. "That was surprisingly fast. Yes, this is El Rodadoro. My name is Trent. You must be Monique. Welcome to Tex...as?" Trent's eyes popped because he could not believe his eyes. Monique was indeed from France but she was most definitely not human. Monique was a rather large gargoyle. She stood 10 feet high and was very fat and pear-shaped. She had bright red-violet-skin with long blonde hair reaching down to her rather enormous butt. Her fingers were sharp claws and she had talons for feet. She had two long, pointy and curved horns facing downwards and a long lizard-like tail with leather wings that had bright lavender-colored membranes like the wings of a bat. Finally, in terms of appearance, Monique had a small mole on her chin. For clothing, the gargoyle girl wore a brown loincloth with a belt, fishnet stockings and a light blue tank top." Trent gasped as the gargoyle girl smiled at him and wagged her tail. Then it hit him, he was looking at the same creature he and seen flying through the air earlier. Trent wanted to be afraid, but for some reason, he also felt somewhat fascinated with the gargoyle beauty standing before him and shaking her hips.
1553322222222222222222222222222221.title: Gargoyles Rock!

15533222222222222222222222222222221.content:
WHAT. THE. FLYING PISS.

How the hell do you describe this?! How can anyone wrap their head around this?! They actually exist?! No serious. THEY ACTUALLY EXIST?! Something that spawned from a stupid South Park episode actually exists in your flipping reality!

No, I'm not talking about Manbearpig, cuz that would actually make a little sense (a LITTLE sense!). I'm talking about...

ok, bare with me here...

...the goddamn Underpants Gnomes!

Yep, short little underground-based munchkins that swipe people's underwear for some apparent reason that allows them to make profits are REAL. You couldnt possibly dream this kind of stupid! Matt and Trey are spinning in their graves and theyre not even dead! It was incredibly hard to come to grips with that kind of unbelievable fact! Before this incident, you wouldve never believed that the Underpants Gnomes were real. You didnt even find that episode all that funny! But one night, one cold lonely night during a really bad blackout, things changed.

You woke up after hearing a loud rustling in the middle of the night. As tired as you were, you assumed the worse that you had a break in and judging by your bedroom window shattered, you were right.
You slowly got up being careful not to make a sound, fearing the intruder may be armed (and wishing you finally did the sensible thing and got that damn gun permit your dad constantly suggested you getting!), and quietly slip out of bed while your eyes took time to adjust in the dark.

Good news is your little cash-safe remained untouched. You tip toe toward the sound of the rustling… and the sound of the sniffing. The heavy sniffing. The direction it came from was your clothes hamper. Yep, your CLOTHES HAMPER.
Seems like your intruder is worse than a thief, it’s a creepy stalker!

With your eyes better focused, you could spot what looked to be a short brown-haired girl in funny little brown munchkin clothes with funny shoes and a brown cap that looked sort of like one of those mardi gras hats. You squinted your eyes at this odd girl, not being sure how to react until you noticed her pointy ears. They actually looked elven.

You mouthed ‘What the fu-’ then you noticed what exactly she was sniffing. A pair of your used boxers! For that moment, forget the funny clothes, forget the funny ears, your intruder is sniffing your underwear! Friggin ew!

“What in the hell are you doing?” you spoke up, startling your underwear sniffer!

“!!” she nearly jumped just before turning around and tilted her head up at you! Her big jade green eyes widened at yours. Despite being spooked, she was still gripping your boxers tightly in her hands.

“What are you doing in my house?” you questioned, “and were you just sniffing those?”

“……” she stared back at you in nervous silence like a cat that just got caught sticking her paw in the fish tank… while sniffing her master’s boxers! You waited impatiently for an answer.
But instead, she just quickly swipes a few more pairs out of the hamper and makes a dash out the window!

“HEY! COME BACK HERE!” you shouted and gave chase to that thieving creepy stalker pointy eared thing! “WHO ARE YOU?!!”
She doesnt even reply. She resumes running from you and you chase her across the block. Dang this midget is fast! After a couple minutes, you follow her toward the park.

Just when youre starting to catch up, the short pointy earred raises her hand and some bright pink aura of light emits from it! The ground in front of her suddenly glow a bright strange weird symbol! Then all of a sudden, the earth shakes and the glowing ground tears open, revealing a huge hole! You stop running and drop your jaw at the oddity before you.

“You gotta be kidding me!” you mutter. The gnome turns back to you one last time, locking her big green eyes with yours before leaping into the hole with your stolen boxers in tow! Unbelievable. There were no words to describe what just happen but WTF. You dont get enough time to reflect on the weirdness tonight before the hole begins to close…

1553322222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Our story begins one dark Halloween when a young man in his early 20s is in his apartment putting together his costume and makeup. He put in a pair of red contact lenses before he heard the phone ringing and picked up a metal mask made to look like the head of the Marvel Comics villain Ultron. “Hello?” said the young man on the phone. “Hey, Mack,” said the voice on the other end. “What are you waiting for? It’s almost Sundown. You don’t want the costume party to start without you.” Mack gave a scoff and put on his Ultron mask. “I can wait, Duncan. You said the theme was superhero comics? I can’t wait to see everyone’s faces when I come in dressed as Ultron. It took me a month to design the costume.” On the other end of the line, Mack’s friend, Duncan, was dressed up in a costume that made him look like Iron Patriot. “Going as a super villain this time, huh? Well, I’ll be seeing you there.”

Once Duncan hung up, Mack adjusted his Ultron mask and looked into the mirror before he gave a hiss. “I wonder if chicks dig killer robots.” Mack joked to himself. Mack then took out a flashlight and painted the lens blue before placing it in a jack-o-lantern with the Avengers logo on it and turning the light on right before placing it outside of his house and locking the door. Mack let out an evil laugh as he saw that the sun was going down. “Showtime.” He said. Mack walked down the streets noticing that this Halloween was wild as ever. The buildings were decorated with fake spider webs and gargoyle statues. Mack heard giggling and saw three children. One was dressed as Frankenstein’s monster, one was dressed as a mummy and the third was dressed as a wolfman. Mack couldn’t help but laugh at their costumes. “For a minute,” he said. “I would’ve sworn that those were real monsters.” That was when Mack heard a scoff. “That’s only because you’ve never seen a real monster.” It was there Mack heard loud footsteps and turned around to see a woman who looked like she was on the way to the same costume party that he was.

The most striking feature of this mysterious woman was that she didn’t appear to be human. Though it could’ve possibly been a costume. She was a huge 10ft tall minotaur resembling a white Holstein cow with pink spots instead of black and long slicked-back hair as red as blood worn in a ponytail. Fitting a cow she was very fat and most likely weighed 1000lbs and she had massive E-cup breasts and a huge cow’s udder between her legs as well as a pair of large horns. The big minotaur lady wore dark red lipstick and gold earrings. While it seemed that her bovine features were her costume, this strange woman was wearing a purple domino mask and cape and an indigo tank top and shorts with a belt (albeit opened up to reveal her udder), making her resemble the Huntress from DC Comics. Mack took one look at the cow girl and was in utter surprise. “That is an amazing costume.” He said.

The cow girl turned her head to face Mack and then she gave a smile. “Thanks,” she said. “I was going to dress up as Jean Grey, but I’ve dressed as a Marvel superhero for the last 7 years and decided to throw DC a bone for a change.” “Actually,” said Mack. “I’m more amazed at that cow costume under your Huntress costume. It’s so realistic.” The minotaur Huntress girl gave a look of surprise and then let out a slight laugh. “Uh,” she said. “Yeah. But to be fair... my mother made that costume, if you know what I mean.” Mack didn’t appear to know what she meant and looked around. “She did a good job. Tell the old girl she should be designing costumes for Mardi Gras.” The minotaur girl had to fight back the urge to laugh. “He’s so ignorant it’s cute,” she thought to herself. “Boy, is he for a big surprise.” The cow girl then cleared her throat. “I really like your Ultron costume as well. My favorite Marvel villain. I take it you’re heading for that big costume party at 77 Wyvern Street.” “I sure am,” said Mack. “Wait. Duncan never told me about you. I don't even know your name." The cow woman turned her head and smiled. "Dominique. See you at the party." As Dominique walked away, Mack could've sworn that she had a tail. But at that time, Mack didn't think much of it because it was Halloween. "That is a very good costume."
1553322222222222222222222222222222221.title: The Halloween Cow

You sit in a dive bar tired, annoyed, and angry. you had a very bad strike of luck since the reveal of the inter-species and their current...invasion of them into certain parts of society, and you where dealing with the worse part loan sharks. you couldn't trust banks being they would probably ask why you needed fifty thousand dollars in a week and what it was for.

you drink deep from the glass as the door opened and your loan shark walked in she was a brown haired girl with tan skin and a healthy hourglass figure wrapped in a blue dress that showed off the body quite well, and then there is the extra features a set of small brown triangular ears pointed on top of her head a green leaf sitting between them and a large furry tail with several black ring wrapping around it. she smiled seeing you and plopped down next to you as her muscle walked in shortly after a large oni girl who sat down in a booth across from you.

"Well Mr. Steel pleasure seeing you made our appointment I hope your a man of your word?" She asks leaning on the bar as you take another sip of your drink. as she seems to sigh. "I am so glad you agreed to this method of payment I mean it is no fun just to take away everything a man owns." she says as she waves down the bar keep (A busty Inari girl.) and orders a glass of whisky.

The deal was simple she gives you the money no questions asked you have to be her boyfriend with the caveat that if she liked it she may take you as her mate, and if that happened you could get a advance on a second loan with no need to pay her back...or so she says. this is the first date so how could it go wrong?
